original English: You will have to play my husband now or you will compromise me.

original Spanish: La señora está para besarla.
original English: Madame looks good enough to kiss.

original Spanish: ¡Circule por favor!
original English: Keep walking please!

original Spanish: Enséñeme alguna documentación por favor.
original English: Let me see some identification please.

original Spanish: Hacemos un brindis por cada nuevo cliente.
original English: We are toasting every new customer.

original Spanish: Tanto llorar por nada.
original English: Every tear was in vain.

original Spanish: ¿Y por eso se pelea usted conmigo?
original English: And you're here squabbling with me?

original Spanish: ¿Cómo te llamas por cierto?
original English: What's your name anyway?

original Spanish: ¡Hoy noto por primera vez que la Tierra da vueltas!
original English: Today I'm noticir for the first time that the earth's spinning!

original Spanish: Estas flores para nuestros invitados de esta noche.
original English: Flowers for this evening's guests.

original Spanish: No olvide que está Ud. invitado por Arnol Lind.
original English: Don't forget you will be Lind's guest I'll introduce you there tonight.

original Spanish: ¿... por qué sacrifica Ud. su juventud con ese enfermo celoso?
original English: Why sacrifice your youth for this sick and jealous man?

original Spanish: La magnífica gran pintura del pintor LIND fue comprada en la exposición para el Museo.
original English: The magnificent painting by Lind was bought at the exposition by the museum.

original Spanish: El trabajo y la emoción son perjudiciales para él.
original English: Work and excitement are bad for him.

original Spanish: Prométeme que vas a utilizar todos tus esfuerzos para el divorcio.
original English: Promise me you will attempt everything in order to get a divorce.

original Spanish: Daría mi vida por tu amor pero no puedo ser su asesina.
original English: I would give up my life for love of you but his murderer I cannot be.

original Spanish: Ahora entiendo que para ti el amor es un tormento...
original English: Our love was nothing but a whim for you yet to me it meant my whole life.

original Spanish: El notario notifica a Lena las deudas de su marido y que para pagarlas tendría que vender sus posesiones.
original English: The accountant notified Margrit of her husband's debts and that to pay those all her possessions would have to be sold.

original Spanish: Por Lena que ahora está en la pobreza para proporcionarle un medio de vida busca su antiguo amigo Kruger un cabaret cuyo propietario es un conocido suyo.
original English: Margrit's old pal Kruger forwards Margrit now impoverished to an acquaintance's cabaret so she can provide herself the means to live.

original Spanish: ...los espero a los dos mañana por la mañana en el ensayo...
original English: I'll be expecting the both of you at tomorrow morning's rehearsal.

original Spanish: Lena es contratada para canciones con acompañamiento de arpa.
original English: Margrit is engaged for songs accompanied by harp.

original Spanish: Knud el hermano de Frits llega a la ciudad para hacer compras.
original English: Knud Arvid's brother travels to the city for his purchases.

original Spanish: Knud y sus amigos de negocios acuden al cabaret que se ha hecho famoso por Lena.
original English: Knud and his business friends visit the cabaret now famous thanks to Margrit.

original Spanish: ¿Ya sabe señor que le toman por tonto?
original English: Are you aware Sir that you have been played for a fool?

original Spanish: Mañana se cumplirá nuestro deseo todo está preparado para la huida.
original English: Tomorrow our desire will be fulfilled the escape has been fully prepared.

original Spanish: ¡ Por dos veces ha rechazado el Gobernador blanco tu petición de más tierras para tu tribu oh Jefe!
original English: The white Governor has twice denied your request for land for your tribe O Chief!

original Spanish: ¡ Por dos veces ha rechazado el Gobernador blanco tu petición de más tierras para tu tribu oh Jefe!
original English: The white Governor has twice denied your request for land for your tribe O Chief!

original Spanish: ¿Qué va a suceder si la rechaza por tercera vez?
original English: What will happen if he denies it a third time?

original Spanish: Llegará el momento en que yo tu padre esté camino del más allá y tú mi hijo le demostrarás al gran Jefe Blanco que África es para nuestra raza negra.
original English: The time will come when I your father will take the long road to the other side and you my son will prove to the great white Chief that Africa belongs to our black race.

original Spanish: Durante muchos meses Ushakapilla ha estado acumulando tesoros para comprar armas y munición para la revuelta que planea.
original English: For many months Ushakapilla has been hoarding booty to buy weapons and ammunition for the planned uprising.

original Spanish: Durante dos días Winters erró por el desierto de Karoo sin agua ni alimentos.
original English: For two days Winters wanders in the Karoo Desert without water or food.

original Spanish: yasídecidióLordCholmondeley por amor a esa mujer dejar su gran fortuna y su enorme herencia puesto que nunca habría permitido que de sus labios saliera una palabra contra una mujer.
original English: ...and Lord Cholmondeley decided to leave his vast property and immense inheritance for the love of this woman for he would never allow words of disrespect for any woman to pass his lips.

original Spanish: Tras su llegada a África alquiló el Lord inmediatamente un tren especial para dirigirse a Rhodesia...
original English: Arriving in Africa the noble lord immediately hired a special train to get to Rhodesia...

original Spanish: Winters sabe que todas las estaciones están vigiladas y decide por ello intentar salvarse en la pequeña estación del desierto Green Willow.
original English: Knowing that all stations are being watched Winters decides to try his luck at the little station in the desert called Green Willow.

original Spanish: Aquí todos lo tienen por loco.
original English: Everyone here thinks he's crazy.

original Spanish: Al llegar a Rhodesia Lord Cholmondeley se dirigió al único hotel del pequeño poblado de Seijaduntella para que el mundo se olvidara de él.
original English: Arriving in Rhodesia Lord Cholmondeley checked into the only hotel in the little settlement of Seijaduntella in order that the world might forget him utterly.

original Spanish: Ya te encontraré algún sitio para que duermas.
original English: Ich werde schon irgend eine Schlafstelle fur Dich finden.

original Spanish: Buscando venados para la mesa de su padre
original English: Looking for game to put on her father's table

original Spanish: Con alegría daré mi consentimiento para que estudiéis con mi amigo blanco.
original English: I will gladly allow you to study under my white friend.

original Spanish: El día que cumple veinticinco años Mofti es llevado por primera vez a la piedra de sacrificios de sus antepasados.
original English: On his twenty-first birthday Mofti is taken for the first time to his ancestors' sacrificial rock.

original Spanish: Voy a buscar a mi amigo Jack para que no lo destrocen los leones.
original English: I will fetch my friend Jack lest he be torn apart by lions.

original Spanish: Las ideas de Mofti habían sido mejoradas por el cristianismo y lleva a su amigo Jack a enseñarle la piedra de sacrificios.
original English: His ideas purified by Christianity Mofti shows his friend Jack the sacrificial rock.

original Spanish: Ya no podré guiarte más por los senderos de caza.
original English: I can no longer lead you along hunting paths.

original Spanish: Saludos oh amigo para ti y tu pequeña Rosa blanca.
original English: Greetings O friend to you and your little White Rose.

original Spanish: ¿Y quién podrá afirmar que este corazón negro no está tan destrozado por el dolor como el de cualquier otro padre?
original English: And who could deny that this black man's heart is torn apart with pain just like that of any father?

original Spanish: Yace aquí bajo las piedras donde me traía de cacería. Sus últimas palabras fueron para ti
original English: He lies there beneath the rocks where he had led me on the hunt.

original Spanish: En Japón Yukio hijo del almirante estadounidense Milton y de la japonesa Saki San descubre por medio del viejo Chizo que el almirante fue responsable del suicidio de su madre.
original English: Yukio son of the American admiral Milton and the Japanese Saki San is raised in Japan by the old Chizo who tells him that the admiral was responsible for the suicide of his mother. Yukio vows to take revenge.

original Spanish: El juego está en pleno apogeo cuando Yukio pregunta por mister Barnes.
original English: The game is in full motion when Yukio asks to speak to mr. Barnes.

original Spanish: Tal vez tenga tiempo para ayudarte en tus clases de inglés.
original English: Maybe I will find the time to help you with your language lessons.

original Spanish: Gestionando nuestro trabajo para la Cruz Roja con la señora Smith.
original English: I have taken care of our work for the Red Cross with mrs. Smith.

original Spanish: La verdadera razón del interés de Barnes por el joven Yukio durante su visita al almirante.
original English: The true reason for Barnes' interest in the young Yukio during his visit to the admiral.

original Spanish: ¡Ha venido desde Japón para matarte!
original English: He has come here all the way from Japan to kill you.

original Spanish: Pero creo que puedo digamos por cinco mil dólares hallar la forma de mandarlo de nuevo a Japón.
original English: But I believe that I can let's say for 5000 dollar find the way to send him back to Japan.

original Spanish: Con la ayuda de Elsa Yukio hace grandes progresos con el idioma. Pero las costumbres de aquel mundo nuevo aún son extrañas para él.
original English: Yukio with the help of Elsa is making good progress in the language ...but the manners of the outgoing world are still very strange to him.

original Spanish: Interpretada por Mary Anderson.
original English: Interpreted by Mary Anderson.

original Spanish: Así... hasta mañana por la noche.
original English: ... yes until tomorrow evening.

original Spanish: Ese papel no vale nada para ti.
original English: This paper has no value for you at all...

original Spanish: Sí fui un estúpido pero ahora ya sé quién eres. ¡Tendré ese papel aunque deba aplastarte para conseguirlo!
original English: Yes I was a fool. But I've found out who and what you are ...and I will have the paper even if I have to crush you for it!

original Spanish: Vine a América para vengar a mi madre... ¡no para convertirme en un ladrón!
original English: I've come to Amerika to avenge my mother... not to become a thief!

original Spanish: De ahora en adelante mi mayor deseo es dar la vida por la gloria de tu país. ¡De NUESTRO país!
original English: My dearest wish from now on is to give my life for the glory of your country OUR COUNTRY!

original Spanish: Dispuesto a dar mi vida por las barras y estrellas de tu país. ¡De NUESTRO país!
original English: I am willing to give my life for the Stars and Stripes- your country-OUR COUNTRY!" The End.

original Spanish: ¡Esto va por ti Maria!
original English: That means you of course Maria!

original Spanish: Maria tira las flores de ese extraño. Sabes que te quiero por encima de todas las cosas.
original English: Maria throw the flowers from that stranger away you know I love you more than anything.

original Spanish: Cuando tuve que quedarme aquí por la enfermedad de Gunne mientras el Circo Panelli se iba de tournée nos casamos fuera.
original English: When you were forced to stay here by Gunne's illness while the circus Panelli was on tour we got married on the way.

original Spanish: Póngame por favor con el director.
original English: Please call the director to the telephone.

original Spanish: Quiero comprobarlo por mí misma.
original English: I want to see for myself in order to be convinced.

original Spanish: La srta. Lina le espera para una partida de crocket.
original English: Ms. Lina expects you at her croquet game.

original Spanish: El inspector jefe Müller se deja llevar en un súbito arrebato por sus sentimientos apasionados.
original English: Chief Inspector Muller feels a sudden strong passion for Helene. Chief Inspector Muller feels a sudden strong passion for Helene.

original Spanish: El padre del príncipe Kossotski coronel retirado de la guardia antes de su muerte testa para que su hijo se incorpore al ejército.
original English: The father of Prince Kossotski colonel of the guard in retirement had pronounced as he lay dying his wish that his son follow a career in the army.

original Spanish: En el regimiento Kossotski se distinguía por sus brillantes facultades e infinito orgullo.
original English: Kossotski distinguished himself at the Academy for his brilliant skills and infinite pride.

original Spanish: Y habría sido un cadete ejemplar si no fuera por sus cambios violentos de humor.
original English: And would have been an outstanding cadet if not for his violent temper.

original Spanish: La condesa Korotbova una de las damas de honor preferidas por la emperatriz demostraba al principio mucha frialdad con él.
original English: Countess Korotbova one of the Empress' favorite maids of honor was at first very cold towards him.

original Spanish: Entrando en el monasterio Kossotski muestra desprecio por todo lo que parece importar a los demás.
original English: By entering the monastery Kossotski showed he despised everything that seemed important to others.

original Spanish: Me desnudaré para secarme.
original English: I must undress to dry myself ...

original Spanish: No sale por el día... teme la luz.
original English: She doesn't go out during the day... she's afraid of the light.

original Spanish: ¿...y tú casualmente pasabas por allí?
original English: ... And then you just happened to drop in?

original Spanish: He hipotecado nuestra casa para comprar una mina de cobre.
original English: I've mortgaged our home to buy a copper mine.

original Spanish: Pero ahora mismo necesito un millón para ponerla en marcha.
original English: But right now I need a million to get it going.

original Spanish: Si no le importa señor nos gustaría recibir nuestro salario por adelantado.
original English: If you don't mind sir we'd like to have our wages in advance. There are certain rumors...

original Spanish: Demasiado bella para ser una sirvienta.
original English: Much too beautiful to be a maid.

original Spanish: Usted está casada y yo podría para ser su padre.
original English: You are married and I'm old enough to be your father.

original Spanish: El Sr. Bradford era un hombre muy excéntrico por así decirlo.
original English: Mr. Bradford was a very eccentric man... to say the least.

original Spanish: Tráigame esos papeles que guardó para mí.
original English: Get me the papers that you put away for me.

original Spanish: Si se me hace tarde para coger un tren normalmente suelo coger el especial.
original English: If I'm late for my train I usually charter a special.

original Spanish: Nunca olvidaré lo que has hecho por nosotros hoy.
original English: I will never forget what you have done for us today.

original Spanish: Sin embargo esta noche loca ha sido satisfactoria para mí en un sentido. Digamos que...
original English: However this crazy night has been satisfactory in one way for me namely...

original Spanish: Me llevaré tu ropa para que no escapes.
original English: I'll take your clothes with me so I know you won't run away.

original Spanish: No se lo digas por amor de Dios.
original English: Don't tell him for heaven's sake.

original Spanish: Sal por la ventana.
original English: Just climb out of the window.

original Spanish: Si entras en esta habitación me tiro por la ventana.
original English: If you enter this room I'll throw myself out of the window.

original Spanish: Lo más probable es que él haya perdido ese millón de dólares pero por lo demás todo bien.
original English: Most likely he's lost the million dollars... but otherwise there's nothing wrong.

original Spanish: Finalicemos el trato salgo para Montana ya mismo.
original English: Let's get the envelope ready. I'm leaving for Montana now.

original Spanish: Dirigida por Márton Garas.
original English: Directed by: Marton Garas Made in 1918 by Hungaria Filmgyar.

original Spanish: - Me iré por un par de días.
original English: I'll go away for a couple of days.

original Spanish: Anna Karenina se encuentra con la condesa Vronskaya en la estación quien viaja para ver a su hijo en Moscú.
original English: Anna Karenina meets Countess Vronskaya at the station who is travelling to see her son in Moscow.

original Spanish: - - Ese ferroviario que se llevaban ha sido atropellado por el tren.
original English: That railwayman who was just taken away had been hit by the train.

original Spanish: Debo tomar el tren a San Petersburgo por la mañana.
original English: I must go take the train to St. Petersburg in the morning.

original Spanish: Ahora para mí eres el único.
original English: You are the only one for me now... Don't ever forget that!

original Spanish: No tengo derecho a romper una familia que fue sancionada por un poder superior.
original English: I have no right to break up a family which was sanctioned by a higher power. I'll be waiting for you to cool down.

original Spanish: - Me temo que si me enfrento a él no tendré fuerzas suficientes para insistir en el divorcio. -
original English: I'm afraid that if I face him

original Spanish: - Soy tu esposo por ley; por lo tanto es mi deber pensar en nuestro destino y decidir sobre nuestro futuro y lo que es mejor para nosotros.
original English: I am your husband by law therefore it is my duty to think about our fate and to decide about our future and what is best for us...

original Spanish: - Soy tu esposo por ley; por lo tanto es mi deber pensar en nuestro destino y decidir sobre nuestro futuro y lo que es mejor para nosotros.
original English: I am your husband by law therefore it is my duty to think about our fate and to decide about our future and what is best for us...

original Spanish: - Soy tu esposo por ley; por lo tanto es mi deber pensar en nuestro destino y decidir sobre nuestro futuro y lo que es mejor para nosotros.
original English: I am your husband by law therefore it is my duty to think about our fate and to decide about our future and what is best for us...

original Spanish: Como todavía estoy enamorado de ti no puedo dejarte ir sin intentar convencerte por última vez.
original English: Since I am still in love with you I cannot let you go without trying to convince you for the last time. You must understand this.

original Spanish: - A menudo en mis sueños puedo ver a ese pobre ferroviario que fue atropellado por el tren durante mi visita a Moscú.
original English: Often in my dreams I can see that wretched railwayman who was hit by the train during my visit to Moscow. He just looks at me with a distorted smile and whispers:

original Spanish: Como Anna Karenina no puede recuperar su libertad envía a su hermano para que hable con Karenin.
original English: Since Anna Karenina could not regain her freedom she sends her brother to Karenin.

original Spanish: Te pido Karenin que me perdones para que pueda morir con tranquilidad.
original English: I am asking you Karenin to forgive me so that I can die with peace of mind. Anna

original Spanish: Sólo estoy aquí para cumplir el último deseo de Anna.
original English: I am only here to fulfill Anna's final wish.

original Spanish: ¿Qué te pasa? ¡Ven a casa por favor!
original English: What's wrong with you?

original Spanish: Voy a ver a mi madre a por algo de dinero.
original English: I will travel to my mother for some money.

original Spanish: ¿No sigo significando algo para ti?
original English: ... Don't I at least still mean something to you?

original Spanish: ¿O sólo soy una mujer caída para ti una carga de algún tipo?
original English: Or am I just a fallen woman to you a burden of some sort?

original Spanish: Viniste tan de repente que debo disculparme por no poder saludarte.
original English: You came so suddenly that I must apologize for being unable to greet you.

original Spanish: Estoy retenido por un viaje al campo previamente planificado en compañía de la princesa Sorokina y su sobrina.
original English: I am withheld by a previously planned field-trip in the company of Princess Sorokina and her niece.

original Spanish: En 1921 se modificó mucho el negativo original para la versión americana GIPSY BLOOD.
original English: In 1921 the original negative was heavily altered for the American version of the film Gypsy Blood.

original Spanish: La base para la restauración digital de la Fundación Friedrich-Wilhelm-Murnau en 2018 fue un duplicado incompleto del archivo en blanco y negro del Archivo Estatal de Cine de la RDA.
original English: The basis for the digital restoration of the Friedrich Wilhelm Murnau Foundation in 2018 was an incomplete black-and-white archive duplicate from the former holdings of the State Film Archive of the GDR.

original Spanish: Otro duplicado acortado en blanco y negro de la copia occidental de los años 70 con intertítulos en alemán sirvió como complemento para las escenas modificadas o que faltaban.
original English: Another shortened black-and-white duplicate of Western production from the 1970s with German intertitles served as a supplement for changed or missing shots.

original Spanish: La base para los virados en la película en blanco y negro fueron los fragmentos del nitrato.
original English: The nitrate film fragments served as the basis for the black and white materials.

original Spanish: Éstos también sirvieron como base para el esquema de color que sin embargo sigue siendo en gran medida especulativo.
original English: These also served as the basis for the colour plan which however remains largely speculative.

original Spanish: Drama en seis actos versión libre de Prosper Mérimée adaptado a la pantalla por Hanns Kräly.
original English: Drama in 6 acts freely adapted for the screen by Hanns Kräly from Prosper Merrimé

original Spanish: Al dragón José Navarro se le informa por la presente de que ha sido promovido a sargento.
original English: - DON PHILIPPO To the Dragoon José Navarro. The Dragoon José Navarro is hereby notified that he has been promoted to sergeant.

original Spanish: José va de guardia por primera vez como sargento en Sevilla.
original English: José is on guard duty for the first time as a Sergeant in Seville.

original Spanish: Que el diablo le crea que un tipo tan fuerte se deje atropellar por una chica así.
original English: The devil believe you that such a strapping fellow could let himself be run around by a girl.

original Spanish: Perdona tengo que dejarte sola un momento hermosa niña para controlar a los presos.
original English: Excuse me I have to leave you alone for a moment beautiful child to check on the prisoners.

original Spanish: Ve al barrio gitano y consigue una buena bailarina para la fiesta.
original English: Go to the gypsy quarter and arrange a good dancer for the feast.

original Spanish: De acuerdo seréis recogida esta noche por un carruaje del coronel.
original English: It's agreed you will be collected this evening by the Colonels carriage.

original Spanish: Tras el cumplimiento de su condena José vuelve a estar por primera vez en su puesto.
original English: Having served his sentence José is back at his post for the first time.

original Spanish: Carmen tiene que enseñarnos esta noche el camino por el que llegar a la ciudad sin ser vistos con las mercancías.
original English: Carmen has to show us the way to get into the city with the goods tonight without being seen.

original Spanish: No puedo quedarme esta noche tengo guardia junto a la grieta de la muralla por ahí toda clase de gentuza pasa de contrabando sus mercancías.
original English: I can't stay I have to stand guard at the postern tonight... all sorts of rabble are smuggling goods through there.

original Spanish: Eres un tesoro fiel para mí te acortas el tiempo de una novia.
original English: What a loyal sweetheart you are to me whiling away the time with a young girl.

original Spanish: Sí sí amigo mío el perrito bueno tiene que darse por vencido!
original English: Yes yes my friend the good little doggie must beg before his master!

original Spanish: No te preocupes por tu futuro los contrabandistas te acogerán alegremente.
original English: Don't worry about your future the smugglers will gladly take you in.

original Spanish: ¡Ese oficio no es para mí!
original English: This profession is no good for me!

original Spanish: Hemos de separarnos tengo que ir a Gibraltar para explorar buenas oportunidades.
original English: We have to part I must go to Gibraltar seek out some good opportunities.

original Spanish: ¿Me hablas así cuando he abandonado por ti a mi madre y a mi prometida?
original English: This is how you speak to me for whose sake I have left my mother and my bride?

original Spanish: Estoy invitada por Escamillo a sentarme hoy en su carruaje.
original English: I have been invited by Escamillo to ride in his carriage today.

original Spanish: Una copia de esta película ha sido restaurada y conservada por la Cinemateca Francesa que la había recibido de Abel Gance.
original English: A copy of this movie has been restored and preserved by the Cinémathèque Française which it received from Abel Gance.

original Spanish: Interpretado por M. Severin-Mars
original English: Performed by M. Severin-Mars

original Spanish: Vestuario diseñado por Babani.
original English: Costumes designed by Babani.

original Spanish: Si aún quiere dejarte la amenazaré con contar la naturaleza de vuestras relaciones. Como odia el escándalo pagará por mi silencio.
original English: If she still wants to leave you I'll threaten to tell everything about your relationship as she hates a scandal she will pay a lot for my silence.

original Spanish: He enviado a casa a los sirvientes esta tarde para evitar testigos indiscretos.
original English: Struggle for Life: I sent home the servants this afternoon so we'll avoid any witnesses.

original Spanish: ¿Cuánto por tu silencio?
original English: How much to keep you quiet?

original Spanish: Sabiendo que soy rico y huérfano usted y su hermano me han introducido cobardemente en su pervertido mundo para así poder explotarme pero ahora puedo ver con claridad y quiero abandonar esta degradante vida.
original English: Knowing that I'm rich and an orphan you and your brother have cowardly conceded to luring me into your perverted world so you can exploit me but I can see clearly now and want to leave this demeaning life. I'll do anything to make it happen.

original Spanish: Le daré todo el dinero que necesita para empezar una nueva vida.
original English: I'll give all the money you need to start a new life.

original Spanish: - ¿Y desaparecerás para siempre de mi vida?
original English: - And you will disappear forever from my life?

original Spanish: ¿La señorita Claire por favor?
original English: Mlle Claire please?

original Spanish: ¿Acabo de encontrarme con la felicidad y la fortuna y voy a perderlas por asuntos del pasado? Voy a casarme con Claire.
original English: I've just met with happiness and fortune why would I possibly want to give this up just because of something that happened in the past?

original Spanish: Sois mis testigos Mañana por la mañana a las 9...
original English: You are my witnesses... Tomorrow morning at 9 o'clock.

original Spanish: Su criado me telefoneó esta mañana para decirme la razón de este duelo.
original English: You telephoned me this morning to tell me the reason for this duel. You do not...

original Spanish: ¡Gracias por el mal que me has hecho!
original English: Thank you for the evil you raise in me!

original Spanish: Danzas por Ms.
original English: Dances by Ms. Ariane Hugon of the Opera.

original Spanish: A los pies de su maestro Beethoven un músico desesperado por una traición de mujer trata de olvidar y expresar su tristeza.
original English: At the feet of his master Beethoven a musician distraught by the treason of women tries to forget and express his sadness.

original Spanish: Le escribiré para explicárselo.
original English: I'll write to you with more details.

original Spanish: Mañana 2 en punto Villa Floreal preparada para partir.
original English: Tomorrow 2 o'clock Villa Floreal be ready to leave.

original Spanish: No es para usted Madame es para él. ¡Retírese!
original English: This is not for you Madame it's for him. Out of the way!

original Spanish: ¿Cree que voy a dejarle vivo para que mate a mi padre en un duelo?
original English: Do you think I can let him go alive to then go and kill my father in a duel?

original Spanish: Eve me esperaba para el té... ha vuelto conmigo!
original English: She has returned with me!

original Spanish: Tal para cual.
original English: Two of a kind.

original Spanish: Una llamada para voluntarios.
original English: A call for volunteers.

original Spanish: Arrestado por ayudar a los Aliados.
original English: Arrested for aiding the Allies.

original Spanish: Paz en la tierra... los mejores deseos para toda la humanidad.
original English: Peace on earth -- good will to all mankind.

original Spanish: Todo está listo para viajar en barco.
original English: All fixed up for the boat ride.

original Spanish: Ud se ha estado pegando por aquí desde hace buén tiempo!
original English: You have been sticking around here long enough.

original Spanish: Distribuida por Scandia-film
original English: Published by Scandia-film

original Spanish: Yo recibiré a quien se abra paso por aquí.
original English: Whoever makes his way here will be saluted by me

original Spanish: A pesar de que la chica es un poco tímida por supuesto.
original English: Although the girl is a little shy of course.

original Spanish: Hasta ahora la tradición en Huseby para las hijas de los granjeros ... no es compartir la alcoba matrimonial con hijos de minifundistas.
original English: As yet there is no tradition here on Huseby for farmers' daughters ...to share the marriage bed with smallholders' sons.

original Spanish: Al siguiente sábado por la noche.
original English: The next Saturday night.

original Spanish: Solo un camino lleva a la granja de verano Huseby y pasaba por la granja principal.
original English: Only one road led to the Huseby summer farm and it passed right by the main farm.

original Spanish: La paz de Dios para ti también.
original English: God's peace to you too.

original Spanish: Aún conservo cierto talento para eso.
original English: I may still possess some talent in that direction.

original Spanish: ¡Basta por hoy violinista!
original English: Enough for today fiddler!

original Spanish: ¿Qué haces por aquí arriba Aslaug?
original English: How do you do up here Aslaug?

original Spanish: Estamos aquí para asegurarnos de que el minifundista de Naesset no se acerque esta noche.
original English: We're just here to make sure that the smallholder boy from Nesset stays away from the summer farm tonight.

original Spanish: Fue un sábado por la noche.
original English: It was on a Saturday evening.

original Spanish: ¡La paz de Dios para ti también!
original English: God's peace to you too!

original Spanish: Noble Señor vuestro sirviente cuidó los Lugares Sagrados para que nadie los profane!
original English: Noble Lord Your servant is guarding the Holy Shrine from the trampling of foreign feet!

original Spanish: Este cruel Bonze me persigue porque comprendo sus oscuras intenciones... pero le preguntaré a Buda por mí mismo...
original English: That awful Bonze persecutes me because I have perceived his unclean purposes... but I will pray to Buddha myself...

original Spanish: Gracias por tu mensaje por Daimyo que con las doctrinas extranjeras quiere levantar al pueblo contra Mikado.
original English: Thanks You for Your message about the traitorous Daimyo who with foreign doctrines wants to incite the people against the sanctified person of the Mikado.

original Spanish: Buda castigó a tu padre por sus pecados.
original English: Your father was punished for your sins by Buddha.

original Spanish: Oh Take-San sería una excelente geisha para el dueño de la casa de té.
original English: O-Take-San would be a very good Geisha for the keeper of the Teahouse.

original Spanish: Vine por mi herencia...
original English: I went to collect my inheritance...

original Spanish: Esta es la espada que mi padre usó para suicidarse por orden del Mikado"!
original English: This is the sword with which my father killed himself by order of the Mikado!

original Spanish: Esta es la espada que mi padre usó para suicidarse por orden del Mikado"!
original English: This is the sword with which my father killed himself by order of the Mikado!

original Spanish: ...y si ella no tiene dinero para comprar su libertad"! ...
original English: ...and if she has no money to buy herself free!"...

original Spanish: La criatura se lo tomó en serio y te esperó todos estos años con su hija llena de nostalgia por tí...
original English: The poor creature has taken the affair very seriously and has been waiting all these years with her child in tender longing for you...

original Spanish: El extranjero pagó por tres años Oh Take-San vivió conmigo cuatro años y si no paga la renta debe dejar la casa.
original English: That stranger paid for three years O-Take-San has been living here with me for four years now and if does not pay the rent she must leave this house immediately.

original Spanish: Ven Hanake decoremos la casa con flores para recibirlo!
original English: Come Hanake let us decorate the house with flowers for the reception!

original Spanish: Iré al consulado para que me informen!
original English: I'm going to the consulate to ask for him!

original Spanish: Olaf Anderson por el amor de Dios!
original English: Olaf Anderson help for godsake!

original Spanish: Decorados y vestuario creado y supervisado por Axel Esbensen
original English: Sets and wardrove created and supervised by Axel Esbensen Chief engineer:

original Spanish: Mats Lindberg Dirigida por Mauritz Stiller Una producción de Svensk Filmindustri
original English: Directed by Mauritz Stiller a production of Svensk Filmindustri

original Spanish: Querido amigo ¿qué tienes en contra de Solberga? "¿Acaso no nos hemos acercado más veces por la casa del párroco a visitar a Sir Arne?
original English: Dear dog what do you have against Solberga? Have we not many times swung past the vicarage to pay visit to Sir Arne?

original Spanish: Bastante después de medianoche unos pocos hombres salieron de la posada de Branehög para ensillar sus caballos y volver a casa.
original English: Long after mignight a few men left the inn at Branehög in order to saddle their horses and return home.

original Spanish: Anoche Sir Arne y toda su familia fueron asesinados por tres hombres... que entraron en la casa por la chimenea... iban vestidos con andrajos.
original English: Last night Sir Arne and his entire household were murdered by three men... who entered the house though the smoke-hole in the roof.. men dressed in rough hides.

original Spanish: La pobre doncella la única superviviente de la carnicería fue llevada por Torarin a vivir con él y su madre a su casa.
original English: The impoverished young maid the sole survivor of the bloodbath was taken by Torarin to come live with him and his mother in their cottage.

original Spanish: La casa de Torarin estaba situada en el punto más alto de la isla y todos los mercenarios escoceses marineros y pescadores atrapados en Marstrand por el hielo solían pasar cerca de ella cuando iban a ver
original English: Torarin's cottage was situated at the highest point of the island -- -- and all the Scottish mercenaries mariners and fishermen locked in by the ice at Marstrand used to pass by his cottage on their way to see if the sea had begun to cast off its blanket of ice.

original Spanish: Observaba lo agraciados que eran por hacer algo.
original English: She would ponder how blessed they were to have something to look forward to.

original Spanish: No soy lo suficientemente rica como para alimentarte y vestirte Elsalill... para que puedas estar sin hacer nada y sigas alimentando tu dolor.
original English: I am not wealthy enough Elsalill to feed and clothe you-- so that you may remain idle and nurture your grief.

original Spanish: ¡Espero que estén vivos para poder arrancarles el corazón del pecho!
original English: I hope they are alive so I may rip their hearts from their chests!

original Spanish: ¡Espero que estén vivos para poder verlos destrozados y descuartizados!
original English: I hope they are alive so I may see them drawn and quartered!

original Spanish: No hemos venido para asustarla sino a pedirle que comparta su relato con nosotros.
original English: We did not come to frighten you good maiden but to ask you to share your tale with us.

original Spanish: Vinimos a Marstrand para reservar pasaje hacia Escocia pero todos los fiordos y los estrechos están helados.
original English: We came to Marstrand to book passage to Scotland but all the fjords and sounds are frozen.

original Spanish: ¡Muéstrale al caballero que no careces de educación para responderle adecuadamente Elsalill!
original English: Show the gentleman you do not lack the breeding to respond properly Elsalill!

original Spanish: Naciste para pertenecer a la clase alta y no eres una humilde vendedora de pescado.
original English: You were born to a higher station and are not a lowly fish wench.

original Spanish: Después de ese día Sir Archie iría con frecuencia a la casa de Torarin para hablar con Elsalill.
original English: After that day Sir Archie often ventured to Torarin's cottage to speak to Elsalill.

original Spanish: ¡Me has sido enviada por Dios Elsalill!
original English: God himself has sent you to me Elsalill!

original Spanish: De ese misma manera el pelo de mi hermana fue retorcido por las manos de su asesino.
original English: In this very same manner the hair of my foster sister was twisted around the hand of her killer.

original Spanish: Fíjate no eran más que unos rayos de sol que entraban por la ventana.
original English: Look it was but a few sunbeams shining in from the window.

original Spanish: Un hombre como usted que viaja tanto y oye todo tipo de cosas ¿no sabrá por qué Dios mantiene las puertas del mar cerradas durante tanto tiempo... manteniéndonos prisioneros?
original English: A man like yourself who travels everywhere and hears everything do you know why God keeps the gates of the sea barred for so long...?

original Spanish: ¿Sabe por qué le pregunté por qué Dios mantenía las puertas del mar cerradas?
original English: Do you know why I asked why God keeps the gates of the sea barred?

original Spanish: Solicitó pasaje para Escocia para él y sus hombres pero no me gusta llevar a ese tipo de rufianes a bordo de mi barco.
original English: He requested passage to Scotland for himself and his men but I do not like to have such ruffians aboard my vessel.

original Spanish: Solicitó pasaje para Escocia para él y sus hombres pero no me gusta llevar a ese tipo de rufianes a bordo de mi barco.
original English: He requested passage to Scotland for himself and his men but I do not like to have such ruffians aboard my vessel.

original Spanish: Al día siguiente recordaba el sueño y éste no se desvanecía y ella se sentía irresistiblemente atraída por los lugares a los que su hermana le había llevado en sueños.
original English: The next day the dream lingered and would not fade and she was irresistibly drawn to the places her foster sister had taken her in the dream.

original Spanish: Dios te bendiga por venir a verme esta noche Elsalill.
original English: God bless you for coming to see me tonight Elsalill.

original Spanish: Pero ahora que por fin nos encontramos mi corazón me dice lo que tengo que hacer... liberarme de mi tormento.
original English: But when I happened upon you just now my heart told me what I must to do -- to be released from my torment.

original Spanish: Lloro Sir Archie porque el amor que siento por usted es demasiado fuerte.
original English: I weep Sir Archie for the love I bear in my heart for you is too strong.

original Spanish: Debes acudir conmigo a las autoridades para que puedan detener a los asesinos y castigarlos como se merecen.
original English: You must go with me to the rightful authorities so they may seize the murderers and duly punish them.

original Spanish: ¿Me reconociste Elsalill y por eso los mandaste detrás mía?
original English: Did you recognize me Elsalill and set them upon me?

original Spanish: ¡Vienen a por ti...
original English: They are coming for you...

original Spanish: Estábamos cegados por el alcohol.
original English: We were senseless with drink.

original Spanish: Usando a Elsalill como escudo Sir Archie huyó por la puerta.
original English: Using Elsalill as a shield Sir Archie ran for the door.

original Spanish: Quién sabe qué era lo que le obsesionaba tanto como para estar a la intemperie en una noche como aquella.
original English: Who could know what possessed the skipper to be out on such a night as this.

original Spanish: Pero la ensenada en la que su barco estaba atrapado por el hielo no mostraba ninguna salida... estaba completamente helada.
original English: But the inlet where his ship was iced in showed no channels -- it was frozen solid.

original Spanish: Fue secuestrada por los hombres que asesinaron a Sir Arne y la trajeron a tu barco.
original English: Last night she was abducted by the men who killed Sir Arne and they brought her to your ship.

original Spanish: Ahora entiendo por qué hemos sido retenidos... mientras que los demás barcos han podido zarpar.
original English: Now I know why we have been held back... while all other ships may put to sea.

original Spanish: Habían ido a recoger a la joven doncella que había amado a un malhechor... y había sacrificado su vida para destruirlo.
original English: They had come to collect the young maiden who had loved an evildoer... and had given her life to destroy him.

original Spanish: La música para Sir Arne's Treasure es el resultado de la colaboración entre Swedish Film Institute y Swedish Filmindustry
original English: The musical score for Sir Arne's Treasure is the result of a collaboration between the Swedish Film Institute and Swedish Filmindustry

original Spanish: La partitura fue coescrita por Matti Bye y Fredrik Emilson
original English: The score was co-written by Matti Bye and Fredrik Emilson Instrumentatilst:

original Spanish: Sir Arne's Treasure fue restaurada por el Swedish Film Institute Archive en el año 2000.
original English: Sir Arne's Treasure was restored by the Swedish Film Institute Archive in 2000.

original Spanish: Estaba en la corte cuando la ví por última vez--" (Juez...
original English: It was in court I saw her last --" (Judge...

original Spanish: Lo dije sólo para que ella tuviera una sentencia más apacible".
original English: I said it just so that she would get a milder sentence.

original Spanish: No ella mató todo el amor por mí.
original English: No she's killed all love for me.

original Spanish: ...y la corte de distrito por consiguiente la juzga y la sentencia a tres años de trabajo forzado.
original English: ...and the district court therefore deems it just "to sentence you to three years hard labor.

original Spanish: Padre crees que no tengo que hacer nada por ella
original English: Father you don't think that I need do anything for her

original Spanish: Será difícil para ella cuando esté sentada en casa.
original English: It will be difficult for her this fall when she is sitting at home.

original Spanish: Apenas puede ir a la iglesia --será duro para ella.
original English: She can hardly dare go to church either -- it will be hard for her all around.

original Spanish: Pero no es tan fácil para mí casarme con ella.
original English: But it isn't so easy for me to marry her.

original Spanish: Los Ingmars siempre han intentado caminar por los caminos de Dios.
original English: The Ingmars have always tried to walk in God's paths.

original Spanish: Nosotros los Ingmars no necesitamos temer a los hombres solo tenemos que caminar por los caminos de Dios.
original English: We Ingmars don't need to fear men we just have to walk in God's paths.

original Spanish: Pensé que podría crecer como éste por algún tiempo.
original English: I thought it could grow like this for a while.

original Spanish: Quería hablar sobre lo que tenemos arreglado para Brita cuando ella sea liberada.
original English: I wanted to talk about what we've arranged for Brita when she is freed.

original Spanish: Ya hemos comprado un boleto para ella.
original English: We've already bought a ticket for her.

original Spanish: Si su padre quiere rechazarla para congraciarse con usted
original English: If her father wants to reject her in order to ingratiate himself to you

original Spanish: entonces todavía debe caminar por los caminos de Dios Pequeño Ingmar Ingmarsson" Pequeño
original English: then you should still walk in God's paths Little Ingmar Ingmarsson!

original Spanish: Estoy seguro que está enviando al padre de Brita aquí para mostrarme qué malo es querer que lleve toda la verguenza sola.
original English: I'm sure he's sent Brita's father here to show me how wicked it is to want "to let her bear all the blame alone.

original Spanish: que en estos últimos días no tengo mucho deseo para ir y conseguirla.
original English: that in these last few days I haven't had much desire to go and get her.

original Spanish: ¡Gracias señor por venir aquí hoy"!
original English: Thank you sir for coming here today!

original Spanish: ...no hay nada para ser ganado en su regreso primero es mejor evitar el encuentro.
original English: ...there is nothing to be gained in your coming home first it's better to avoid meeting.

original Spanish: Hay un tronco condensado en lo de Löfberg y también un boleto y dinero esperando por usted.
original English: There is a packed trunk at the merchant Löfberg's and also a ticket and money waiting for you.

original Spanish: Sí pero el Gran Ingmar me ha traído aquí para sacar a mi novia de la cárcel.
original English: Yes but Big Ingmar has brought me here to get my bride out of jail.

original Spanish: Le habría gustado para ella que saliera por una puerta de honor
original English: He would have liked for her to have come out through a port of honor

original Spanish: Le habría gustado para ella que saliera por una puerta de honor
original English: He would have liked for her to have come out through a port of honor

original Spanish: Es demasiado grande para ponerlo en la parte de atrás de la carreta.
original English: It's too big to put on the back of the cart.

original Spanish: si él está feliz de tenerme--o si él ¡sólo ha venido por caridad!
original English: if he is happy to have me -- or if he has only come out of charity!

original Spanish: Durmieron toda la noche en una posada pero salieron con buen tiempo y fue por el camino que... vieron la iglesia de su parroquia --
original English: They slept overnight at an inn but left in good time and were so far along the way that... They saw the church of their home parish --

original Spanish: Él no pensó que tuviera valor para encontrarse con las lenguas afiladas.
original English: He didn't think he had the courage to meet the sharp tongues.

original Spanish: Ella entendió que él había querido hacer todo genuinamente bien pero que había sido demasiado difícil para él.
original English: She understood that he had wanted to make everything genuinely nice but that it then had gotten too difficult for him.

original Spanish: ¡No soy lo bastante buena para usted!
original English: I'm not good enough for you!

original Spanish: Ella dijo que no era suficientemente buena para nosotros.
original English: She said she wasn't good enough for us.

original Spanish: ¿Y por qué está llorando?
original English: And why is she crying?

original Spanish: Porque no quiero traer el infortunio para Ingmar!
original English: Because I don't want to bring Ingmar misfortune!

original Spanish: Debes saber a propósito que por otra parte seré yo quién se vaya.
original English: You should know by the way that otherwise it will be me who goes.

original Spanish: Ingmar se molestó por eso y se desvió por un pequeño camino del bosque.
original English: Ingmar was bothered by it and drove into a small forest path.

original Spanish: Ingmar se molestó por eso y se desvió por un pequeño camino del bosque.
original English: Ingmar was bothered by it and drove into a small forest path.

original Spanish: ¡Aquí hay una carta para usted Ingmar"!
original English: Here's a letter for you Ingmar!

original Spanish: No tienes derecho para leerla todavía!
original English: You don't have the right to read it yet!

original Spanish: Dios sabe que oré todos los días para poder verte antes de irme.
original English: God knows I prayed everyday that I might see you before I went.

original Spanish: Ahora era su turno para llorar--
original English: Now it was his turn to cry --

original Spanish: Ella estaba tan contenta no sabía cómo hacer para impedir reírse.
original English: She was so happy she didn't know what to do to keep from laughing out loud.

original Spanish: Podría haberme atrevido a escribir una carta de amor para tí
original English: Would I have dared write a love letter to you

original Spanish: Y creeme él estará honrado por el resto de sus vidas!
original English: And believe me he'll be honored for it for as long as he lives!

original Spanish: Ingmar es un ejemplo para todos como su padre!
original English: Ingmar is an example to us all just like his father!

original Spanish: Es mejor para tí que los dos lo llevemos?
original English: Is it better for you now that there are two of us to bear it?

original Spanish: Buenos días Padre y gracias por la ayuda!
original English: Good day Father and thank you for the help!

original Spanish: Nosotros los Ingmars ¡simplemente debemos caminar por los caminos de Dios!
original English: We Ingmars just have to walk in God's paths!

original Spanish: Se necesita algo más que el brillo del sol y un clima hermoso para sentirse tan dichoso como uno de los niños de Dios en el cielo?
original English: Is anything needed more than sunshine and beautiful weather "to feel as blissful as one of God's children in heaven?

original Spanish: Yo soy por lo menos tan rico como cualquiera en la parroquia
original English: I am at least as rich as anyone in the parish

original Spanish: y por lo menos ellos han estado haciendolo hasta ahora.
original English: and at least they've been doing that up to now.

original Spanish: Si mi padre hubiera "estado vivo podría preguntarle por esto
original English: Had father still been alive I could have asked him about this

original Spanish: Me gustaría encontrar al Gran Ingmar para pedirle consejo sobre una situación".
original English: I would like to meet Big Ingmar to ask his advice about an awkward situation.

original Spanish: Yo le diré a Sven quesaque el caballo para usted.
original English: I'll tell Sven to hitch up the horse for you.

original Spanish: Y Brita se fue a la Granja de Ingmar antes de la boda para ayudar a Mamá.
original English: And Brita moved down to Ingmar's Farm before the wedding "in order to help mother.

original Spanish: Y no tengo medios para eso este año.
original English: And I just don't have the means for it this year.

original Spanish: Tenía la sospecha que Brita estaba haciendo algo sobre mí para posponer la boda
original English: I had a suspicion Brita was brooding about me postponing the wedding

original Spanish: Solo así puede quemar para él todo lo de la Granja de Ingmar!
original English: It can just as well burn up for him all of Ingmar's Farm!

original Spanish: Yo voy a hacer algo por él.
original English: I'm going to do something to him.

original Spanish: Todo lo que puedo pensar es cómo hacer para herirlos!
original English: All I can think about is how I can hurt them!

original Spanish: Estoy en problemas por mis malos pensamientos!
original English: I am so troubled by my evil thoughts!

original Spanish: Pero ahora era demasiado tarde para hacer eso.
original English: But now it was too late to do that.

original Spanish: Ella lo hizo para vengarse de mí porque me habían forzado por ella--
original English: She did it to take revenge on me because I had forced myself on her --

original Spanish: Ella lo hizo para vengarse de mí porque me habían forzado por ella--
original English: She did it to take revenge on me because I had forced myself on her --

original Spanish: Unos días después él obtuvo el permiso de sus superiores para hacer una parada de dos horas en Orneval para que su compañía se reportara a la estación más cercana...
original English: A few days later he obtained permission from his superiors to make a two-hour stopover in Orneval as his company was to report to a nearby station...

original Spanish: - ¡Deberías comparecer ante una corte marcial por eso!
original English: You could be court-martialed for that!

original Spanish: Esperemos que no sea por mucho tiempo.
original English: Watch over her. When I return to civilian life I will take her back.

original Spanish: La noticia de la captura de Edith corrió rápidamente por la aldea.
original English: The news of Edith's abduction spread rapidly through the village.

original Spanish: No tengo más motivos para quedarme.
original English: I have no more reason to stay.

original Spanish: ella te envió ese telegrama para que te sintieras en libertad de unirte a Jean que está emboscado en alguna parte;
original English: She sent you that telegram to be free to join Jean who's lying low somewhere.

original Spanish: ¡Qué lugar para escribir cartas!
original English: What a spot to write letters!

original Spanish: Ella te envió ese telegrama para que te sintieras en libertad de unirte a Jean que está emboscado en alguna parte.
original English: She sent you that telegram to be free to join Jean who's lying low somewhere.

original Spanish: Regreso a casa para agasajar al nuevo teniente...
original English: Back home to celebrate the appointment...

original Spanish: Mereces la Legión de Honor por tus hazañas. y las arras por haber arriesgado tu vida en lugar de la de François a quien yo había asignado.
original English: You deserve the Legion of Honor for your exploits and the guardhouse for risking your life instead of Francois whom I had appointed.

original Spanish: ¿Me perdonarás François por haberla amado tanto como tú?
original English: Will you forgive me M. Laurin for having loved her as much as you

original Spanish: Tienes que comprender que siempre habrá belleza en ésta Tierra y el hombre nunca será lo suficientemente cruel como para destruirla
original English: You have to understand that there will always be beauty on this earth and that man will never be cruel enough to destroy it

original Spanish: YO ACUSO por by Abel Gance Parte Dos
original English: J'ACCUSE by Abel Gance Part Two

original Spanish: Los cañones están atascados o yacen monstruosamente diseminados el eterno espíritu del Mal planea sobre ésta gigantesca batalla para liberar el mundo.
original English: The cannon squat or lie monstrously sprawled the eternal spirit of Evil hovers over this battle to save the world.

original Spanish: Estoy escribiendo ésto en secreto porque ella no quiere que dejes Francia por ella como valientemente ha expresado.
original English: I'm writing this in secret because she doesn't want him to leave France for her as she courageously puts it

original Spanish: Pero todo lo que encontró fué la tristeza del crepúsculo angustiado por el dulce espíritu de Edith.
original English: But all he found was the sadness of the twilight haunted by Edith's gentle spirit.

original Spanish: ¡La muerte se marcha por una puerta mientras la vida entra por la otra!
original English: Death leaves through one door as life enters through another!

original Spanish: ¡Prepárenos algo especial para mañana!
original English: Prepare us something special for tomorrow!

original Spanish: Antiguo oficial licenciado por razones de salud solicito ahora permiso para reincorporarme al servicio activo en mi antigua compañía con el rango de soldado raso de segunda a las ordenes del sargento François Laurin.
original English: I now request permission to return to active duty in my old company with the rank of Private 2nd Class under the orders of Sergeant Francois Laurin.

original Spanish: Antiguo oficial licenciado por razones de salud solicito ahora permiso para reincorporarme al servicio activo en mi antigua compañía con el rango de soldado raso de segunda a las ordenes del sargento François Laurin.
original English: I now request permission to return to active duty in my old company with the rank of Private 2nd Class under the orders of Sergeant Francois Laurin.

original Spanish: YO ACUSO por Abel Gance Parte Tres
original English: J'ACCUSE by Abel Gance Part Three

original Spanish: Y el visionario les dijo muchas otras cosas cosas profundas y dolorosas que no pueden emerger del barro a través de las imagenes... porque los ojos están aún tan lejos del corazón para comprender verdaderamente.
original English: And the visionary told them many other things. Profound and painful things which mustn't emerge from the mud through images because the eyes are still too far from the heart to truly understand.

original Spanish: Si esas letras llegan a alguien pueden infundir en un corazón honesto el horror de la infamia hacia los responsables por ésta guerra.
original English: If these letters reach anyone may they instill in the honest heart a horror of the infamy of those responsible for this war.

original Spanish: Adorable y querida madre. No deseo nada para mí;
original English: Dearest darling mother I desire nothing more for myself.

original Spanish: Jean temiendo un grave peligro ha preparado una serie de cartas para Edith fechadas para los meses por venir así ella permanecería ignorante de lo sucedido tanto tiempo como fuera posible...
original English: Jean fearing the worst had prepared a series of letters for Edith pre-dated with the months to come so that she would remain ignorant as long as possible...

original Spanish: Jean temiendo un grave peligro ha preparado una serie de cartas para Edith fechadas para los meses por venir así ella permanecería ignorante de lo sucedido tanto tiempo como fuera posible...
original English: Jean fearing the worst had prepared a series of letters for Edith pre-dated with the months to come so that she would remain ignorant as long as possible...

original Spanish: - Si caigo en la batalla envía una de éstas cartas por mes en éste orden.
original English: If I fall in battle send one letter per month in order.

original Spanish: Y mientras su vida se extinguía sus febriles pensamientos eran para su querida Edith a quien había amado tanto si que ella lo supiera y quien mientras tanto debería estar riendo bajo la dulce luz de Provence.
original English: And as his life ebbed his feverish last thoughts were for his dear Edith whom he had loved so much without her knowing it and who at that moment may have been laughing in the gentle light of Provence.

original Spanish: Ven a la casa de Edith Laurin a las 10 de la noche... para tener noticias de vuestros muertos.
original English: Come to Edith Laurin's home at 10 p.m. for news of your dead. -

original Spanish: - ¡Mis amigos ha llegado el momento de saber... si nuestra muerte ha servido para algo!
original English: Friends the time has come to find out if our death has done any good!

original Spanish: Los famosos muertos... también marchaban He huído de ese enjambre innumerable y estoy aquí para advertiros.
original English: The famous dead marched as well... I fled this innumerable flock. I'm here to warn you.

original Spanish: ¡Tú Amelie tu marido también murió por tí!
original English: You Amelie! Your husband died for you too!

original Spanish: - ... ¡Y tú Darmont Bernard Chantonin todos vosotros os habéis enriquecido ávidamente con vergonzosa sangre fría para engordar vuestros bolsillos!
original English: And you Darmont Bernard Chantonin you all greedily profited from the bloodshed shamelessly to line your pockets!

original Spanish: Cuando el viento norte sopla por la noche ¿no escucháis las voces de millones de estertores agónicos clamando: "¡Yo acuso! - ... ¡Yo acuso!
original English: ...When the north wind blows at night can't you hear the millions of death rattles: "I accuse!

original Spanish: ...Que una bella llamarada te transporte y en vez de llorar por haber perdido el día
original English: May a good flame raise you up And rather than weep That I have lost the day

original Spanish: Es porque ¡capricho amargo! ... para morir mi iré
original English: Abomination has thou clothed In robes of light

original Spanish: Mi estimada Sally esto es para "tú sabes quién!
original English: Dearest Sally this is for "You know who"!

original Spanish: ¡Ahora estoy listo para rodar!
original English: Now I'm ready to roll!

original Spanish: ¡A Tirol por favor!
original English: To Tyrol please!

original Spanish: Escribes que eres seguida por los señores pero yo conozco a mi Kitty quién sólo piensa en su Harry.
original English: You write that you are harrassed by gentlemen but I know my Kitty who only thinks about her Harry.

original Spanish: Llevará su traje encantador para la cena también?
original English: Will you wear your charming suit for dinner as well?

original Spanish: ¿Se supone que venga desnudo para la cena?
original English: Am I supposed to come naked for dinner?

original Spanish: Ahora sírvanos para un cambio.
original English: Now serve us for a change.

original Spanish: ¡Mañana nos encontraremos para un duelo!
original English: Tomorrow we will meet for a duel!

original Spanish: Llamada telefónica para el Sr. Schulze de Plauen!
original English: Phone call for Mr. Schulze from Plauen!

original Spanish: ¿Es esta una conversación para usted?
original English: Is this a conversation for you?

original Spanish: ¡Ya me preocupaba por usted!
original English: I already worried about you!

original Spanish: Puedes comprarme un boleto a Tirol para mí?
original English: Could you buy a ticket to Tyrol for me?

original Spanish: Me temo que tendremos que quedarnos por una noche!
original English: I'm afraid we will have to stay overnight!

original Spanish: Simplemente para mostrarle ¡que no tengo timidez!
original English: Just to show you that I am not shy!

original Spanish: Por más de un año el Professor Gesellius el famoso doctor ha estado en China el hogar del opio para poder estudiar este veneno misterioso
original English: For more than a year Professor Gesellius the famous doctor had been in China the homeland of opium in order to study this mysterious poison

original Spanish: Por más de un año el Professor Gesellius el famoso doctor ha estado en China el hogar del opio para poder estudiar este veneno misterioso
original English: For more than a year Professor Gesellius the famous doctor had been in China the homeland of opium in order to study this mysterious poison

original Spanish: Ali su fiel sirviente indio finaliza los preparativos para su regreso a casa
original English: Ali his faithful Indian servant who makes final preparations for their return home.

original Spanish: Si su barco no se fuera tan pronto por la mañana podría llevarle ante Nung-Chiang
original English: If your ship didn't leave so early in the morning I could take you back to Nung-Chiang

original Spanish: ¡Mi opio te eleva por encima de las miserias de la vida!
original English: My opium carries you over all the hardships of death!

original Spanish: Debería comprender mi amor por los europeos
original English: You should understand my love for Europeans

original Spanish: A pesar de los delirios su amor por su mujer e hijo al que amaba sobre todo lo empujó a regresar a casa
original English: Through all the dreams his longing for his wife and child who he loved above all pulled him back toward his home

original Spanish: Tengo tanto que decir que es vital para la felicidad de la humanidad
original English: I have so much to say that is vital for the happiness of all mankind

original Spanish: ... para la felicidad de la humanidad ...
original English: ... for the happiness of all mankind ...

original Spanish: ... de la ausencia de alegría para que la gente mantenga los pies en el suelo
original English: ... a terrifying absence of joy thrusts people back down to earth

original Spanish: Y por ello es que muchos incluso los mejores de entre nosotros despiertan su triste alma con el humo de la alegría -- ¡El opio!
original English: ... So it is that many some of the best and finest rouse their weary soul with poison The smoke of joy - - Opium!

original Spanish: Crearé un asilo en mi finca para esos desafortunados
original English: I will create an asylum in my house for these unfortunates

original Spanish: He vagado sin descanso por el mundo durante 17 años
original English: I have wandered restlessly through the world for 17 years

original Spanish: He pagado el precio por los placeres celestiales y delicias del humo del opio
original English: I have paid for the heavenly pleasures and delights of smoking opium

original Spanish: Pero Richard descuidó su ocupación por razones que nadie sospechaba
original English: But Richard neglected his profession for reasons which no one suspected

original Spanish: Crucé el océano para estar donde tú estás - hasta que me llegue la hora
original English: I came across the sea to be where you are - until my hour strikes

original Spanish: Dejo por voluntad propia esta vida qué es tan miserable para mí.
original English: I leave of my own free will this life which is so miserable to me.

original Spanish: Dejo por voluntad propia esta vida qué es tan miserable para mí.
original English: I leave of my own free will this life which is so miserable to me.

original Spanish: Sin vigor confuso por la fuerza del destino que lo aplastó el profesor se aferró al veneno contra el que había luchado durante toda una vida
original English: Robbed of his vigor confused by the blow of fate which dashed him down the professor grasped at the poison the fight against which had been his life's work

original Spanish: Mi paz mi felicidad destruidas por él - ¡Debe morir!
original English: My peace my happiness destroyed by him - He must die!

original Spanish: Daría mi vida por ti
original English: I would give my life for you

original Spanish: Estimulado por el veneno
original English: Excited from the poison

original Spanish: Gesellius deambulaba por los Campos Elíseos
original English: Gesellius wandered in the Elysian Fields

original Spanish: Mientras el Professor es capturado por los hombres del Príncipe
original English: In the meantime the Professor is captured by the Prince's men

original Spanish: ¿Hay sitio en el "Hogar de la alegría" para un desesperado?
original English: Is there room in the House of Joy for one in despair?

original Spanish: Magdalena condenada en prisión como condena por su culpa
original English: Magdalena condemned in jail to pay the penalty for her guilt

original Spanish: Abandono por propia voluntad esta vida que me es tan miserable.
original English: I leave of my own free will this life which is so miserable to me.

original Spanish: Abandono por propia voluntad esta vida que me es tan miserable.
original English: I leave of my own free will this life which is so miserable to me.

original Spanish: ¿Estás aquí para guiarme?
original English: Are you here to lead me?

original Spanish: En la guerra me he ganado el grado de oficial por mi comportamiento y no por proteccionismo y de la misma manera me gustaría ascender en el mundo de los negocios.
original English: In the war I made the rank of officer by my behaviour and not by protection and I want to make it in the business world in the same way now.

original Spanish: Totalmente esclavo de su negocio que fue creado por él... "su negocio...
original English: Completely the slave of the business which had been created by him... "his business"...

original Spanish: ¿Qué puedo hacer por usted?
original English: What can I do for you?

original Spanish: Mi Cocinera Más Encantadora" Interpretado por el Cuarteto Peerles.
original English: My Dearest Kitchen Maid" Sung by the Peerles Quartet.

original Spanish: Gracias a usted siento el deseo de interesarme más por la gente de este barrio.
original English: Because of you I feel a wish dawning in me to interest myself more for the people in this neighbourhood.

original Spanish: Caleb Fairman es alguien que sólo busca la verdad y esto está por encima de la búsqueda de expansión de la posesión material.
original English: Caleb Fairman es alguien que sólo busca la verdad y esto está por encima de la búsqueda de expansión de la posesión material.

original Spanish: No yo ERA el editor porque mi gaceta va a aparecer por última vez.
original English: No I WAS the editor because tomorrow my gazette will appear for the last time.

original Spanish: Siempre he hecho todo lo posible por exponer solo la verdad nada más que la verdad en mi periódico pero por desgracia... el coste es demasiado alto.
original English: I have always done my best to state only the truth nothing but the truth in my paper but unfortunately... the cost is too high.

original Spanish: Siempre he hecho todo lo posible por exponer solo la verdad nada más que la verdad en mi periódico pero por desgracia... el coste es demasiado alto.
original English: I have always done my best to state only the truth nothing but the truth in my paper but unfortunately... the cost is too high.

original Spanish: Permítame decirle que "El Faro" no aparecerá por última vez".
original English: Permit me to tell you that "The lighthouse" will NOT appear for the last time.

original Spanish: Estas son las personas que reúnen los requisitos para ser capataz.
original English: These are the people who qualify to become foreman.

original Spanish: Conseguí un suscriptor principal para 'El Faro'.
original English: Conseguí un suscriptor principal para 'El Faro'.

original Spanish: La orden fue firmada por el joven Trent... pero...!
original English: The order was signed by young Mr Trent... But...!

original Spanish: Dame tiempo para pensarlo.
original English: Give me time to think about it.

original Spanish: ¡Tengo una noticia muy importante para el periódico!
original English: I've got a fairly important message for the paper!

original Spanish: Los informes indican que varios trabajadores han resultado heridos gravemente por el derrumbe de una pared.
original English: With information it appeared to us that several workers are heavily injured by the collapse of a wall.

original Spanish: He venido por una respuesta.
original English: I've come for a reply.

original Spanish: No vas a dejar que tu sentido de la justicia se exprese porque estás siguiendo los pasos de tu padre y eres demasiado débil para aplicar tus principios.
original English: You do not want to let speak the justice in you because you follow in the footsteps of your father and are too weak to practice your principles.

original Spanish: Ya que no vienes a mí como hombre sino como una herramienta... te aseguro que tu propuesta de matrimonio es un insulto para mí.
original English: As long as you do not come to me as a man but as an instrument instead... then I assure you that your wedding proposal is insulting for me.

original Spanish: Pero por supuesto... está muy ocupado de lo contrario habría venido a visitarme.
original English: But of course... he is very busy otherwise he would come to me.

original Spanish: Esta película ha sido restaurada por la Fundación Murnau en colaboración con la Cinemateca alemana de Berlín a partir de un negativo original conservado por esta última.
original English: The film was restored in 1999/2000 by Friedrich-Wilhelm-Murnau-Stiftung in collaboration with Bundesarchiv - Filmarchiv in Berlin. The basis was a camera negative from Bundesarchiv

original Spanish: Siete capítulos del Renacimiento italiano contados por Fritz Lang.
original English: Seven chapters of the Italian Renaissance retold by Fritz Lang

original Spanish: Es demasiado guapa como para no constituir un potente rival de la iglesia.
original English: She is too beautiful not to emerge as a powerful adversary of the Church.

original Spanish: Dile a tu señor que todos los tesoros de Ophir no serían suficientes para obtener de mí ni una sola palabra agradable.
original English: Tell your master that all the treasures of Ophir wouldn't suffice to buy a single word of love from me!

original Spanish: El más alto mandatario de la iglesia me envía para que me informe de tu fe.
original English: The highest servant of the Church has sent me to question you about your faith.

original Spanish: ¡Quiero dar una fiesta para los florentinos. Rodearme de gente alegre.
original English: I shall give a feast to the Florentines and see happy people laughing around me!

original Spanish: ¡Abra bien las verjas de mis jardines para que hasta el más pobre pueda sentirse contento!
original English: Open wide the gates of my gardens so that even the poorest feels joyful today!

original Spanish: Por eso abandonaremos la ciudad como Loth hizo en el pasado con Sodoma absteniéndonos de regresar para que el pecado no se cebe con nosotros.
original English: And that is why we shall leave this city as Lot once left Sodom and we shall not look back so that sin will attain no power over us.

original Spanish: Por eso abandonaremos la ciudad como Loth hizo en el pasado con Sodoma absteniéndonos de regresar para que el pecado no se cebe con nosotros.
original English: And that is why we shall leave this city as Lot once left Sodom and we shall not look back so that sin will attain no power over us.

original Spanish: En la montaña se iba a levantar una voz para alertar a la depravada ciudad.
original English: Then the depraved city found an admonisher in the mountains.

original Spanish: ¡Están afectados por el anatema!
original English: Anathema upon you!

original Spanish: Vamos a aislarnos del mundo para mantener esta plaga alejada de nosotros!
original English: - Let us seclude ourselves from the world so that the plague can't get in to us!

original Spanish: Dia y noche se mantenían encendidas las hogueras para impedir la llegada de la plaga.
original English: Day and night the stakes were burning so that the plague wouldn't rise.

original Spanish: Deja de llorar por quien ya no está. ¡Los vivos están hechos para vivir!
original English: Cease from mourning the vanished the living belong to life!

original Spanish: Deja de llorar por quien ya no está. ¡Los vivos están hechos para vivir!
original English: Cease from mourning the vanished the living belong to life!

original Spanish: Las ruinas del castillo Sendlingen antaño altivas son ahora... campo de juegos para los hijos de los pobres.
original English: The ruins of Sendlingen castle once so proud... now a playground for the children of the poor.

original Spanish: Jura por el honor de la familia que nunca te casarás con una inferior a ti...
original English: Then swear by our family honour that you will never marry a commoner.

original Spanish: ... no te maldigo pero deseo con todo mi corazón "que no nos hayas sacrificado a mí y a mi hija "a la que bauticé Victorine por ti en vano.
original English: Although I do not curse you but wish with all my heart... that you have not sacrificed me and my daughter... whom I have named Victorine after you in vain.

original Spanish: Querido amigo iré a verte para hablarte de la desdichada infanticida Victorine Lippert
original English: Dear friend I shall come to you in order to talk to you about the wretched Victorine Lippert...

original Spanish: Werner siempre aplica pena de muerte para casos tan horribles
original English: Werner always applies the death penalty in such dread causes...

original Spanish: ... no te maldigo pero deseo con todo mi corazón "que no nos hayas sacrificado a mí y a mi hija "a la que bauticé Victorine por ti en vano.
original English: Although I do not curse you but wish with all my heart... that you have not sacrificed me and my daughter... whom I have named Victorine after you in vain.

original Spanish: Mañana parto para visitar a mi hijo: vengo a suplicarle... "me haga el inapreciable favor de tomar mi lugar... "en el caso de Victorine Lippert.
original English: I am to leave for my son's tomorrow and have come to beseech you... to grant me the favour of taking the bench... in the trial of Victorine Lippert.

original Spanish: Si cayó fue por creer en un ser indigno.
original English: Where she erred was in trusting an unworthy man.

original Spanish: Aunque sus votos estén empatados y el mío sea el decisivo no vacilo al decidirme por la pena de muerte... Para mí no cabe otra posibilidad en un caso así.
original English: Although I see that your votes are equal and mine... is the deciding ballot I am not afraid to vote for the sentence of death... for it seems to me that it is the only just penalty in this case.

original Spanish: Aunque sus votos estén empatados y el mío sea el decisivo no vacilo al decidirme por la pena de muerte... Para mí no cabe otra posibilidad en un caso así.
original English: Although I see that your votes are equal and mine... is the deciding ballot I am not afraid to vote for the sentence of death... for it seems to me that it is the only just penalty in this case.

original Spanish: Se ponen de acuerdo en que Berger preparará... a la joven para la visita de su padre.
original English: The two friends agree that Berger shall prepare... for the father's visit to the young woman.

original Spanish: Le informo por este medio que su petición de clemencia... "en favor de la infanticida Victorine Lippert... "ha sido denegada.
original English: I hereby inform you that your petition for clemency... for the condemned infanticide Victorine Lippert... has been turned down.

original Spanish: Ya que no lo tendremos más entre nosotros como ejemplo de virtud... sirva este friso para recordarnos constantemente su amor por la Justicia.
original English: Now we longer have you as a shining example of judges virtue among us... your features on this frieze will be a constand reminder of your justice.

original Spanish: Ya que no lo tendremos más entre nosotros como ejemplo de virtud... sirva este friso para recordarnos constantemente su amor por la Justicia.
original English: Now we longer have you as a shining example of judges virtue among us... your features on this frieze will be a constand reminder of your justice.

original Spanish: Su esfuerzo nos demuestra que es deber del juez... atenerse al rigor de la Ley... por doloroso que sea.
