original English: Your efforts have proved that it is the judge's duty... to act in accordance with the law... even if it breaks his heart to do so.

original Spanish: ... por este medio. Me aquejan problemas de salud y no puedo... "encarar otra tarea que no sea la de mi recuperación.
original English: I am ailing and under no circumstances am I able... to undertake any task save that of my own recovery...

original Spanish: Estoy muy emocionado por vuestra amabilidad y espero que ni mis colegas... ni mis conciudadanos cambien nunca la opinión que de mí tienen.
original English: I am deeply touched by your kindness and I hope my fellow... townspeople and colleagues will never amend their opinion of me.

original Spanish: Durante un viaje fluvial al extranjero el abogado Berger conoce a Weyden dueño de una plantación en Java... que viene a Europa para contraer nupcias.
original English: On a river boat on a journey abroad Councillor Berger meets Weyden a plantation owner from Java... who has come to Europe to get married.

original Spanish: Birgitte termina un monumento para conmemorar... a un amigo recientemente fallecido.
original English: Birgitte is finishing a monument... to commemorate a friend who died recently.

original Spanish: Dos días después Karl Victor nunca tocado por la sospecha... confiesa su crimen al presidente Werner.
original English: Two days later. Karl Victor whom no one has ever suspected... confesses his crime to president Werner.

original Spanish: He venido para sufrir el castigo que merezco como todo criminal.
original English: I have come to demand the punishment I deserve as a criminal.

original Spanish: Si no deja todo esto de lado por propia voluntad... juro que buscaré a su hija... y veré que se cumpla su sentencia.
original English: If you do not drop the matter of your own free will... I swear we shall find your daughter... and execute her sentence.

original Spanish: Que Dios lo perdone por esto.
original English: God forgive me for what you have done to me.

original Spanish: Esa misma noche el presidente escribió... su última voluntad y testamento... y pasando por el antiguo lugar de las ejecuciones completó... el largo y empinado sendero que llevaba a las ruinas del castillo ancestral.
original English: That night the president wrote... his last will and testament. and past the old place of execution he walked the last... burdensome mile to the ruins of his ancestral castle.

original Spanish: Este film fue restaurado por Marguerite Engberg a partir de un master print obtenido de un negativo original.
original English: This film has been restored by Marguerite Engberg from a master print... made from the original negative.

original Spanish: El propio Dreyer dejó directivas para los virados.
original English: Dreyer has left directions for the tinting of the film.

original Spanish: Cuatro divertidos actos a partir de una caja de juguetes adaptación libre de Wilner por Hanns Kräly y Ernst Lubitsch.
original English: Four amusing acts from a toy-chest freely adapted from Wilner by Hanns Kräly and Ernst Lubitsch

original Spanish: Querido Sol resplandece para que no me resfríe.
original English: Dearest sun please shine so that I don't catch a cold.

original Spanish: El barón von Chanterelle deseando que no se extinga su estirpe ruega a todas las jóvenes del pueblo y alrededores que se reúnan en la Plaza del Mercado para permitir a su sobrino y heredero universal escoger a la joven idónea para convertirse en su mujer.
original English: The Baron von Chanterelle does not wish for his lineage to die out and therefore invites all of the region's maidens to gather in the marketplace so that his nephew the sole heir may choose a fitting maiden to take as his wife.

original Spanish: ¡Oferta especial para solterones viudos y misóginos!
original English: Available for bachelors widowers and misogynists!

original Spanish: He conseguido gracias a un mecanismo inventado por mí construir muñecas antropomórficas.
original English: I have succeeded with the help of a mechanism I built

original Spanish: ¡No olvide engrasarla dos veces por semana!
original English: Don't forget to oil her twice a week!

original Spanish: ¡Vístanse para la boda!
original English: Everyone get changed for the wedding!

original Spanish: No aguanto esta humillación ¡me tiro por la ventana!
original English: I can't bear the shame... I'm throwing myself out the window.

original Spanish: Hilario se ha vuelto sonámbulo por la desesperación.
original English: Due to his grief Hilarius has been sleepwalking.

original Spanish: La niñera de las niñas Leah era una segunda madre para las gemelas.
original English: The children's nurse Leah was a second mother for the little twins.

original Spanish: Tengo que irme para un corto viaje de negocios.
original English: I have to leave for a short business trip.

original Spanish: A él no le gustaba la violencia; por el contrario le gustaba la doctrina de la paz y el amor y los libros de Tolstoi.
original English: He didn't like untamed violence; on the contrary he was drawn to Tolstoy's doctrine of universal peace and love.

original Spanish: Si los salarios de nuestro personal pueden seguir igual ganaremos cinco millones por año de guerra. ¡Sería fantástico!
original English: If our workers' wages can stay what they are now then we can make a five-million war profit this year. It would be huge.

original Spanish: A pesar de todo pueden vivir tan bien como para ahorrar...
original English: In spite of that they can live just as well if they economize a bit...

original Spanish: Cinco mil dólares para la Cruz Roja.
original English: Five thousand dollar for the Red Cross.

original Spanish: Dorothy quería salir al mundo a Estados Unidos para conocer aquellas condiciones de vida y tratar de cumplir sus ideales.
original English: Sonia wanted to see the world to great America to acquaint herself with its conditions and try to realize her ideals.

original Spanish: El último plan de Vivian: una casa- residencia para todos los perros falderos viejos.
original English: To the success of my daughter Vivian's latest plan a home for sick and old lapdogs.

original Spanish: La mitad de lo que tengo es para ti...
original English: Half of what I have is for you...

original Spanish: la mitad de lo que tienes para mí.
original English: half of what you have is for me.

original Spanish: No puedo hacer nada por vosotros.
original English: I can't help you.

original Spanish: Pero sé razonable. ¿Se puede dar trabajo para unas fábricas que ya disponen de su personal?
original English: But with a little good will every busy factory can still use an extra hand these days.

original Spanish: No se debilitaría... estarían agradecidos por la oportunidad que les damos no les forzaríamos a irse.
original English: No question of weakening... They'll be grateful for the opportunity we'd offer... We didn't force them to leave...

original Spanish: Lo que han hecho [ir a la guerra] es por interés general.
original English: What they did was in the general interest...

original Spanish: Mira acabo de comprar esto para ti.
original English: Look I bought this just FOR YOU.

original Spanish: Con esto podré comprar mucha leche para niños pobres.
original English: Great this will buy milk for a lot of poor babies.

original Spanish: ¿Existe la bondad para las personas?
original English: But is there enough goodness in people for it?

original Spanish: Esa feroz y despreocupada pérdida de vidas ese griterío contrapuesto a la fría muerte esa despreocupación de la juventud... eran demasiado para ella.
original English: This harsh harrowing suffering this blatant contrast between impassive death and carefree youth were too much for her.

original Spanish: Lo hiciste para salvarme...
original English: You did it to save me.

original Spanish: He comprendido por su noble sacrificio.
original English: Her noble sacrifice made me understand!

original Spanish: Vivió feliz para los otros... y murió feliz por la misma razón.
original English: Happily she lived for others... and happily she died...

original Spanish: Vivió feliz para los otros... y murió feliz por la misma razón.
original English: Happily she lived for others... and happily she died...

original Spanish: Cada año en primavera me encuentro con un famoso escultor de quien aprendí mucho y que incluso prometió interesarse por mí en el futuro.
original English: Every year in the most beautiful season I meet a famous sculptor of whom I have learned a great deal and he even promised to take an interest in me in the future.

original Spanish: Me pregunto qué puedo hacer por ti Gloria.
original English: I'm wondering about what I could do for you Gloria!

original Spanish: Morton el primo de la señorita Sedgwick es un mortal feliz bendecido por la riqueza lo que le permite actuar y decir lo que quiera.
original English: Miss Sedgewick's cousin Morton is a happy mortal blessed with wealth allowing him to act and say whatever he wants to. Morton Sedgewick... Played by JACK GILBERT

original Spanish: Cuando Albert se entera de la partida de Gloria convence a su amigo escultor para que le invite a Nueva York.
original English: Albert aware of Gloria's departure convinced his acquainted sculptor to invite him to New York.

original Spanish: - Madre no tenemos nada más que pan seco para la cena.
original English: We have nothing but dry bread for dinner!

original Spanish: -- ¿Y si aprovechamos esta deliciosa velada y damos un último paseo por el lago?
original English: If we would benefit from this delightful evening with a last ride on the lake?

original Spanish: - Querido Señor bendice a Gloria a quien debemos estar agradecidos por librarnos de nuestros problemas. -
original English: Dear Lord send your blessing to Gloria whom we have to be thankful for freeing us from our troubles.

original Spanish: - Mi querido amigo estoy muy contento de informarle de la decisión del gobierno de comprar su trabajo para la Galería Nacional. -
original English: My dear friend I'm overjoyed to inform you of the government's decision to purchase your work for the National Gallery!

original Spanish: La pobre y tierna Gloria piensa en Albert pero su alma está herida por lo ocurrido. ¿Todavía tiene derecho a amar a alguien?
original English: The poor tender and wounded Gloria thinks of Albert yet her soul is hurt by doubt. Does she still have the right to love someone?

original Spanish: Todo lo que logré lo hice por ti...
original English: Everything I achieved I did for you... It's due to my love for you I succeeded.

original Spanish: Confiando en su sinceridad y en el gran amor que Albert siente por ella Gloria decide confesarle la verdad.
original English: Confident of her sincerity and trusting in Albert's great love for her Gloria decides to confess the truth.

original Spanish: - Cuando viniste a decirme "gracias por amarme" ¡estaba convencida de que la habías leído!
original English: Her tortured soul makes the sacrifice for the great love she feels for him and reveals the whole truth. "When you came to me saying 'Thanks for loving me' I was convinced you read it!" "Gloria!

original Spanish: La señorita Sedgwick tras oír por qué la joven se fue tan de repente obliga a su primo a casarse con Gloria quien es engañada con la noticia falsa de la muerte de Albert.
original English: Miss Sedgewick having heard why the young girl left so suddenly meanwhile has forced her cousin to marry Gloria who was finally persuaded with the deceitful news of Albert's death.

original Spanish: Mi querido hija desde tu boda con Morton la señorita Sedgwick hace todo lo posible para tenernos felices.
original English: My dear child Since your marriage with Morton Miss Sedgewick does everything to make us happy. So she has kept her vow to take care of us if you would become her cousin.

original Spanish: Y para liberar a mi familia de la pobreza ¡me sacrifiqué casándome con el hombre que una vez destruyó mi vida! -- ¡Me dijeron que estabas muerto!
original English: I was told you were dead!

original Spanish: ...Y sus corazones fortalecidos por las muchas pruebas pasadas se reencontraron.
original English: ...and their hearts strengthened by their many trials felt grief nor sorrow now that he was folly convinced of her pure innocence.

original Spanish: Ayer por la noche...
original English: Last night...

original Spanish: A nadie se le permitió decir que había muerto por la peste.
original English: Nobody was allowed to say that she had died from the plague.

original Spanish: uno en que se entra libremente para no dejarlo nunca libremente.
original English: where one is free to join but never free to leave.

original Spanish: En un viaje ha tenido una desgracia. Aquí lo traemos para su consuelo.
original English: His mount is well beyond repair. / We shall rest him in this chair.

original Spanish: Sin embargo por favor os ruego Soy el único hombre aquí.
original English: But please ignore me I must espouse / For I am but a husbandly spouse.

original Spanish: Si una mujer besa a su esposo Esta es una historia por mi honor Donde todo resulta nada misterioso.
original English: / A woman who loves her husband it is true That in this tale of history / There is nothing strange nor uncanny.

original Spanish: Inga hija del profesor Manini adora a su primo Felix pero él suspira por Ysabel.
original English: Professor Manini's daughter Inga loves and adores her cousin Felix but he only has eyes for Ysabel...

original Spanish: ¡$ 50 por besar su bella mano!
original English: $ 50 to kiss your beatiful hand!

original Spanish: El profesor Manini ha prometido reunirnos para una partida de cartas hoy en el club.
original English: Professor Manini has promised to join us for a game of cards at the club later tonight! And he can afford to lose!

original Spanish: La vida era un infierno para mí y por eso decidí...
original English: Life was Hell to me and I decided...

original Spanish: La vida era un infierno para mí y por eso decidí...
original English: Life was Hell to me and I decided...

original Spanish: Estimado Señor le agradezco lo que ha hecho por mí hoy.
original English: Dear Lord I thank you for the blessing you have given my work today.

original Spanish: El deseo por Ysabel lleva a Felix a visitarla al día siguiente...
original English: The desire for Ysabel leads Felix to pay her a visit already the next day...

original Spanish: Dios nunca lleva por el mal camino.
original English: God will never lead you astray.

original Spanish: La condesa se preocupa por la simpatía de su hija por Sandro Grec...
original English: The countess is concerned by her daughter's sympathy for Sandro Grec...

original Spanish: Mi amor por ti significa vida para mí.
original English: My love for you meant life to me.

original Spanish: Mi amor por ti significa vida para mí.
original English: My love for you meant life to me.

original Spanish: Generosas donaciones han posibilitado que Elias Renato pudiera crear un hogar para los huérfanos de la sociedad en una isla no muy lejos de la ciudad...
original English: Generous donations have made it possible for Elias Renato to create a home for the orphans of society on an island not far from the city... Generous donations have made it possible for Elias Renato to create a home for the orphans of society on an island not far from the city...

original Spanish: Un mes más tarde la condesa Ysabel se prepara para la boda.
original English: A month later Countess Ysabel prepares for her wedding.

original Spanish: Profesor podría venir con nosotros al Prosca Palace y preparar a la condesa para el desastre
original English: Professor maybe you will come with us to Prosca Palace and prepare the Countess for the disaster!

original Spanish: La conspiración se hace más pesada para Sandro Grec.
original English: The plot thickens for Sandro Grec.

original Spanish: Tengo que acelerar el arresto para que su hija no empiece su vida con un impostor
original English: I felt obliged to speed up the arrest so your daughter did not start a life with an imposter!

original Spanish: Ése fue el castigo por su temeridadd...
original English: That was the punishment for your recklessness...

original Spanish: No hay nada que temer por encontrarse con su antiguo marido.
original English: You need have no fear of meeting your former husband.

original Spanish: No admitía religión cuando la vida era justa y soy demasiado orgullosa para admitirla ahora
original English: I did not acknowledge religion when life was fair and I am too proud to do it now that my happiness has been cast aside!

original Spanish: El enamoramiento de Ysabel por Elias Renato se despierta con renovada fuerza.
original English: Ysabel's infatuation with Elias Renato awakens with renewed strenght.

original Spanish: - Ayúdame Elias Renato para que mi alma pueda encontrar la paz.
original English: - Help me Elias Renato that I can find peace in my soul.

original Spanish: Mientras Ysabel lucha por conseguir uno de sus deseos las fuerzas de su madre se apagan...
original English: While Ysabel fights to pull in the one she desires her mother's strenght fades...

original Spanish: ¡Me has humillado tanto que prolongar esta conversación sería vergonzoso para ambos!
original English: You have humiliated me so deeply that a prolongation of this meeting will be an embarrassment for both us!

original Spanish: Gracias Señor por ayudarme a vencerme a mí mismo.
original English: I thank you Lord for helping me overcome myself.

original Spanish: Y para jóvenes y viejos Ysabel es un ángel de luz.
original English: And to young and old Ysabel is an angel of light.

original Spanish: Protagonizada por Sessue Hayakawa.
original English: Starring Sessue Hayakawa.

original Spanish: - - Sé muy bien por qué siempre lo defiendes.
original English: I know very well why you always defend him.

original Spanish: Mi corazón siempre ha latido por ti.
original English: My heart has always been beating for you.

original Spanish: ¿Por qué no podemos seguir siendo amigos para siempre?
original English: Why can't we stay friends forever?

original Spanish: - - Iré a los que me llaman desde el desierto pensando en el amor por ti que será ofrecido como incienso en el altar de la amistad.
original English: I will go to them who call me from the wilderness thinking of the Jove for you which will be offered up like incense on the altar of friendship.

original Spanish: Rezaré por vosotros todos los días.
original English: I will pray for you every day...

original Spanish: - - Tu corazón es como el de alguien que es un completo desconocido para nuestro pueblo. ¡Ay de ti!
original English: Your heart is like that of someone who is a complete stranger to our people...

original Spanish: Afectado por un miedo mortal Basset parece buscar un escondite cerca de su amigo.
original English: Stricken with mortal fear Basset looks for a hiding place close to his friend.

original Spanish: - - Has elegido la bola negra. ¡El honor de asesinar a nuestro enemigo el juez que condenó a uno de nosotros es para ti!
original English: You have picked the black ball the honor to murder our enemy the judge who convicted one of us goes to you!

original Spanish: Prepárate de inmediato para partir hacia Italia.
original English: Prepare at once to leave for Italy.

original Spanish: Está agotado y estresado por todos sus viajes pero tened la seguridad de que lo cuidaré.
original English: He is exhausted and stressed from all of his travels but rest assured I will look after him.

original Spanish: Saludos para ti y tu hermana Ashuter.
original English: Greetings to you and your sister.

original Spanish: Pero es muy amable por parte del doctor Ashuter verlo en casa.
original English: But it is awfully kind of Dr. Ashuter to see him home.

original Spanish: -- ¡Ashuter! Este viaje ha sido una pesadilla para mí y tu doble atormentaba mis nervios pero en cualquier caso el objetivo se ha alcanzado.
original English: This journey has been a nightmare for me and your double tormented my nerves but in any case the goal has been reached.

original Spanish: Usaré mi influencia para protegerte con la condición de que no se le haga daño a Bassett.
original English: I will use my influence to protect you on the condition that no harm will be done to Bassett.

original Spanish: Que tu espíritu me ilumine para alumbrarme el camino en los años venideros y que las estrellas puedan mirarte con amor y puedan representar el amor de Ashuter de esta manera. ¡Adiós!
original English: That your spirit may illuminate me to shine the way for me in years to come and that the stars may look down on you with love and may represent the Jove of Ashuter in this way... Farewell!

original Spanish: Bella y encantadora como vos fue obligada por sus padres a un matrimonio odioso...
original English: Beautiful and charming just like you forced by her parents into a hated marriage

original Spanish: Vengo del bosque he sido atacado por ladrones.
original English: I come from the woods where I was ambushed by bandits.

original Spanish: Escucha oh palabras ah está rezando. ¡Rezará por mí!
original English: Listen those words she prays. Prays for me!

original Spanish: ¡Ella por todas partes y en ninguna!
original English: It's her everywhere and nowhere!

original Spanish: Tampoco necesitaría armas para conseguir la libertad.
original English: It wouldn't take weapons to take me to freedom.

original Spanish: Tiene algo importante que anunciar algo importante para él y para vos.
original English: He says it is important for him and for you.

original Spanish: Sería para mi un placer que viniese a visitarme el próximo domingo.
original English: I would be very happy if you came for a visit Sunday.

original Spanish: El domingo por la tarde.
original English: Sunday afternoon.

original Spanish: No tengo tiempo para ti cariño.
original English: I have no time for you dear;

original Spanish: ¿Acaso uno es para mi?
original English: Perhaps one is for me?

original Spanish: Perdoname por haberme portado contigo de ese modo mas mi corazón siempre te pertenecerá.
original English: Forgive me for having carried you thus but my heart will always belong to you.

original Spanish: Derechos sobre el tesoro de la ciudad por mi cesión para la expedición corsa por un total de 100.000 Libras.
original English: Concerning my loan for the Corsican expedition and for a total of 100000 pounds.

original Spanish: Derechos sobre el tesoro de la ciudad por mi cesión para la expedición corsa por un total de 100.000 Libras.
original English: Concerning my loan for the Corsican expedition and for a total of 100000 pounds.

original Spanish: Un encuentro tan encantador es un buen augurio para empezar el día.
original English: A find so enchanting is a good omen to start the day.

original Spanish: Todas las tardes en casa del conde Dubarry se reúnen los personajes mas ilustres para entregarse al juego.
original English: Every evening the best society is found at the Count Dubarry's to play games.

original Spanish: Me haría un gran favor si me cediera a su amiga para presentársela al rey.
original English: You would do me a great favor if you presented your friend to the king.

original Spanish: Derechos sobre el tesoro de la ciudad por mi cesión para la expedición corsa por un total de 100.000 Libras.
original English: Concerning my loan for the Corsican expedition and for a total of 100000 pounds.

original Spanish: Derechos sobre el tesoro de la ciudad por mi cesión para la expedición corsa por un total de 100.000 Libras.
original English: Concerning my loan for the Corsican expedition and for a total of 100000 pounds.

original Spanish: Todavía no te he dado permiso para retirarte.
original English: Still I have not given you permission to retire.

original Spanish: Recibirás 100.000 libras por ello.
original English: You will then receive 100000 pounds for it.

original Spanish: Tengo un regalo de boda muy especial para usted.
original English: I have a very special wedding gift for you.

original Spanish: ¡Y todo eso por una querida!
original English: And all this for a mistress!

original Spanish: ¿Sabes cuánto he sufrido por ti?

original English: I cannot continue to serve a king who has taken from me what I hold so dear.

original Spanish: Mamá ahora tenemos dinero para comprar pan.
original English: Ma'am we now have money to buy bread.

original Spanish: El es quien impide la importación de cereales para proteger sus intereses.
original English: It is he who keeps the privileges of those who profit.

original Spanish: He conseguido enterarme de que Gourdan va a reunir esta noche en su casa a algunos "elementos indeseables" para urdir planes contra la señora condesa.
original English: I managed to learn that the suspects will meet tonight at Gourdan's home to devise plans against the countess.

original Spanish: Sólo tengo el deseo de que desaparezcas para siempre de mi memoria.
original English: I have only one desire that you disappear forever from my memory.

original Spanish: A la mañana siguiente los "elementos indeseables" se encuentran reunidos en casa de Paillet para presentarse al rey.
original English: The next morning the malcontents are meeting at Paillet's house to present themselves to the king.

original Spanish: Tú no tienes por qué ir.
original English: You have no need to go there:

original Spanish: Quiero verla por última vez.
original English: I want to see her one last time.

original Spanish: ¡A las Tullerías a por el rey!
original English: Let's go to the Tuilleries ... to the king!

original Spanish: provocada por la guerra y la miseria.
original English: caused by war and misery.

original Spanish: La película fue modificada múltiples veces por la censura.
original English: The film was modified several times by the censors.

original Spanish: Nuestra reconstrucción se esfuerza por ser fiel al concepto original de la película.
original English: Our reconstruction efforts have tried to be faithful to the original concept of the film.

original Spanish: El por lo que ciertos planos et secuencias han sido modificados y se han añadido nuevos intertítulos.
original English: Therefore some shots and sequences were swapped and new headings added.

original Spanish: Con nuestros útiles y máquinas Concebidos para vencer toda resistencia conquistaremos toda la Tierra.
original English: With our tools and machines designed to overcome resistance we will conquer the whole Earth.

original Spanish: Se pelean por su vida.
original English: These people are fighting for their lives.

original Spanish: Ningún caballero me podrá tomar por esposa.
original English: No man of honor can take me as a wife.

original English: Roloff urged Marja to tell him what happened.

original Spanish: Marja por el amor de Cristo ¡dime toda la verdad!
original English: Marja for the love of Christ tell me the truth!

original Spanish: Orador: "¡No nos extraviemos por fanáticos sin escrúpulos!
original English: He: "Let us not be misled by ruthless fanatics!

original Spanish: Presentarte ante el tribunal será un deshonor para la familia.
original English: You will apologize for being ill.

original Spanish: Se negaba a pronunciar la mínima palabra para su defensa.
original English: He refused to pronounce any word in his defense.

original Spanish: Marja abandona la casa decidida a luchar por los ideales de Johannes.
original English: Marja leaves the house resolved to fight for the Johannes's ideas.

original Spanish: Lo peor es que se ve perseguido por sí mismo.

original Spanish: El progreso de la civilización la lucha por la supervivencia El miedo y los horrores de la guerra los pecados de los padres...
original English: The progress of civilization the struggle for survival fear and the horrors of war the sins of the parents ...

original Spanish: Llora por su ídolo Johannes que yo hice arrestar.
original English: You cry for your idol Johannes whom I arrested.

original Spanish: Si está muerta es por tu culpa.
original English: If she is dead it is your fault.

original Spanish: Estoy desbordada de amor por usted.
original English: I have come to the end of my love for you.

original Spanish: No es por la violencia que la humanidad comprenderá sus ideales.
original English: Humanity will not achieve its ideals throught violence.

original Spanish: No hay salida para nuestro amor.
original English: Thereisno questionofourlove.

original Spanish: Johannes: "Pervierten mis ideales por la violencia.
original English: Johannes: "You pervert my ideas with violence.

original Spanish: Se moría de amor por Elisabeth.
original English: His love for Elizabeth stops him.

original Spanish: Tanto sacrificio por su felicidad.
original English: I the unlucky one will sacrifice for their happiness.

original Spanish: Se atormenta por un terrible secreto.
original English: He is haunted by a terrible secret.

original Spanish: Lo hizo para evitar un terrible final.
original English: Hehasdoneittosavehimselffromahorribleend.

original Spanish: Se muere por amor a Elisabeth.
original English: His love for Elizabeth stops him.

original Spanish: Tanto sacrificio por su felicidad.
original English: I the unlucky one will sacrifice for their happiness.

original Spanish: ¡Es por tu culpa!
original English: It's your fault!

original Spanish: Dejaremos este país para siempre.
original English: We will leave this country forever.

original Spanish: En su extrema confusión Marja opta por un acto espantoso.
original English: In her extreme confusion Marja chose a terrible act.

original Spanish: Me fui a un convento para hacer penitencia.
original English: I entered the convent to do penance there.

original Spanish: ¡Creo en los ideales que he defendido y por los que muero!
original English: I think of the ideals that I have defended and for what I'm dying!

original Spanish: Necesitareis dinero para medicinas.
original English: You'll be needing money for medicine.

original Spanish: Yo te devolveré un Pfennig por cada Heller.
original English: I'll pay ya back every penny.

original Spanish: Lo que yo hago lo hago por la voluntad de Dios.
original English: What can I do for heaven's sake?

original Spanish: Una chica estupenda como tú no tiene que preocuparse por casarse.
original English: A swell lass like you won't wed in a hurry.

original Spanish: Incluso los domingos corre por ahí con su escopeta.
original English: He runs around with his rifle even on a Sunday.

original Spanish: ¡Yo nunca iría a hablar mal de ti por todas partes!
original English: I shan't go and spread word about you.

original Spanish: ¿En toda la semana no hay tiempo para trabajar?
original English: Isn't there enough time to work during the week?

original Spanish: Has de vivir en el temor de Dios niña para que luego también puedas crear un hogar cristiano.
original English: You're to live fearing the Lord child so that you can maintain a Christian home later.

original Spanish: Dios te castigará por eso.
original English: The Lord will punish you for this.

original Spanish: No hay nada mejor para una mujer. ¡Agárrate a eso!
original English: There is no bigger blessing for women. Hold onto it!

original Spanish: Tendré que aceptarlo por el puñetazo pero lo otro... por lo de la ofensa al honor...
original English: I'll have to make good for the punch but the other thing... the insulted honour...

original Spanish: No puedo ocultároslo por más tiempo...
original English: I can't keep it from you any longer...

original Spanish: Ossi toma clases para el matrimonio.
original English: Ossi is instructed in the ways of marriage.

original Spanish: Alteza tengo una candidata para Vd. Una jovencita encantadora.
original English: Your Highness I have a proposal for you... a charming young girl... .

original Spanish: No vamos a despertarle por semejante tontería.
original English: Since it's such a trifle we don't want to wake him up.

original English: Prince Nucki do you take Ms. Quaker to be your wife?

original Spanish: Los amigos de Nucki van a buscarle para dar un paseo.
original English: Nucki is called upon by his friends to go for a stroll.

original English: The Association of Millionaires' Daughters for the Prevention of Dipsomania holds an official breakfast for young ladies.

original Spanish: Si las consultas no se realizan pronto los pacientes se desembriagarán por sí mismos.
original English: If consulting hours aren't held soon the patients will sober up on their own.

original Spanish: En Niza un antiguo empleado de las Mensajerías Marítimas Marius Bernard que tiene la prueba de la muerte del padre de Jacques es secuestrado por Strélitz.
original English: In Nice Marius Bernard a former employee of Maritime Messaging who holds the proof of Jacques' father's death has been abducted by Strélitz.

original Spanish: - - Señor -dice Ricardo-. No se sorprenda por nada.
original English: Monsieur said Ricardo do not be surprised by anything.

original Spanish: No hace falta que se alarme por su fuga y propague la noticia.
original English: She must not be alarmed by your running off and she must not spread the news.

original Spanish: Mientras Varèse alquila una villa para todos los que le esperan.
original English: Meanwhile Varèse rented a large villa for his guests.

original Spanish: - - Ya previne a Strélitz que su dinero me serviría para combatirle.
original English: I warned Strélitz that his money would be used against him.

original Spanish: Si debo morir lego mi fortuna por cuartos a la señorita Laure d'Herigny y a mis amigos de París Jacques
original English: If I must die I bequeath my fortune in four parts to:

original English: How much would it take to deal with your commitments?

original Spanish: Que figura por error en la lista de pasajeros.
original English: That it was an error he was listed among the passengers.

original Spanish: Error que usted no rectificó tras el naufragio para evitar una sanción.
original English: An error that you did not rectify after the shipwreck to avoid the blame.

original Spanish: Perdió el barco por unos minutos.
original English: He missed the boat by a few minutes.

original Spanish: Como agotado por esa mentira el pobre hombre se desvanece.
original English: Exhausted by the lies the gentleman fainted.

original Spanish: - - Tengo un sérum que le aliviará para siempre.
original English: A few pricks of my serum will bring you permant relief.

original Spanish: Laugier al acecho lo ha visto todo por la ventana.
original English: Laugier remained on the lookout and saw everything through the window.

original Spanish: Redacto esta nota para mis herederos...
original English: Varèse having died in the shipwreck of the Guyenne I write this note for my heirs...

original Spanish: están por todas partes a nuestro alrededor.
original English: They are all around us...

original Spanish: Venía a solicitar el permiso para poder mostrar mi atracción en la feria...
original English: I wish to apply for a permit to present my spectacle at the fair...

original Spanish: Obtendré la autorización de la policía para examinar al sonámbulo...
original English: I will obtain police authorization to examine the somnambulist.

original Spanish: Intranquila por la larga ausencia del padre...
original English: Worried because her father has been away so long...

original Spanish: Yo no tengo nada que ver con los dos asesinatos... ¡Lo juro por Dios! ...
original English: I had nothing to do with the two murders... so help me God...

original Spanish: de una puñalada en el costado... con un puñal parecido para dirigir las sospechas hacia el misterioso asesino...
original English: I tried to kill her..." by stabbing her in the side with a similar knife...

original Spanish: ...induciendo a un sonámbulo al que había sometido por completo a su voluntad a ejecutar sus extravagantes planes.
original English: He had entirely subjugated to his mill a somnambulist named Cesare whom he did compel to carry out his nefarious schemes.

original Spanish: Jane... la amo... ¿no quiere ser por fin mi esposa?
original English: Jane I love you... won't you be my wife at last?

original Spanish: Desde tiempos inmemoriales hasta hoy la luz de esta estrella siempre se ha apagado diez horas en la tercera noche para volver a brillar la cuarta noche.
original English: From time immemorial to this day the star dims every third night at 10 and shines again the fourth night.

original Spanish: ¡Un día que nunca llega para nosotros María Obal!
original English: Never comes the day Maria Obal!

original Spanish: Mi prioridad será con aquellos que trabajan bajo tierra para mí.
original English: My first priority will be those who are working for me far from the light of day.

original Spanish: He bajado aquí abajo para estar con vosotros como si fuera una hermana.
original English: I come to you as a sister!

original Spanish: Al volver a casa quedé profundamente conmovida por lo que vi y viví en las profundidades. Todos los que trabajan para mí serán mis invitados mañana.
original English: All those who work for me will be my guests tomorrow a day of joy in the sunlight.

original Spanish: Al volver a casa quedé profundamente conmovida por lo que vi y viví en las profundidades. Todos los que trabajan para mí serán mis invitados mañana.

original Spanish: Al volver a casa quedé profundamente conmovida por lo que vi y viví en las profundidades. Todos los que trabajan para mí serán mis invitados mañana.
original English: All those who work for me will be my guests tomorrow a day of joy in the sunlight.

original Spanish: Tengo miedo por nosotros Robert.
original English: I fear for us Robert.

original Spanish: Con mi máquina las he captado por primera vez.
original English: With my little machine I detected them for the first time.

original Spanish: Voy para allá Robert Herne.
original English: I'm coming Robert Herne.

original Spanish: Su excelencia y el Ministerio de Estado están invitados urgentemente por medio de la presente a visitar mañana mi Bio-Central la cual pretendo inaugurar pronto dada la intención del Gobierno de aumentar su producción minera en contra de mis intenciones iniciales.
original English: Bios-City. Your Excellency and the State Department are invited to visit this morning my Bio-Factories given the intention of the Government to open new coal mines Robert Herne.

original Spanish: Me da miedo tu Central y temo por ti.
original English: Your machine frightens me and I worried about you.

original Spanish: Me da miedo tu Central y temo por ti.
original English: Your machine frightens me and I worried about you.

original Spanish: ¡Significa que vuestras minas se pararán para siempre y os quedaréis sin pan!
original English: This means that your mines would stop forever. And you are without bread!

original Spanish: Desde esta sala mi motor distribuirá su energía por cables a todo el mundo.
original English: From this hall my engine will distribute its energy through a thousand cables across the world.

original Spanish: hoy después de 20 años todos los países excepto uno trabajan para el nuestro utilizando la energía eterna que mi central proporciona a sus industrias.
original English: Today after 20 years all the countries work for ours. Using the eternal energy that my factories churn out to power their industries.

original Spanish: Voy a anunciar el nombre del hombres que dirigirá el próximo año la Bio-Central para nuestro país y para todos los pueblos del mundo.
original English: I will announce the names of the twelve men chosen at random to operate the Bio-Factories the next year for the good of our country and for all peoples of the world.

original Spanish: ¡Y como último eslabón de la cadena nos unimos al mundo por el bien de nuestro país!
original English: As the last link in the chain we joined the world for the good of my country!

original Spanish: Si Reginald Herne aún tiene un minuto libre para una mujer que le sigue amando que se presente esta noche a las nueve en el vestíbulo del Grand Hotel.
original English: If Reginald Herne have an hour for a woman who loves him he should meet me tonight at 9 in the lobby of the Hotel Grant.

original Spanish: Que a partir de mañana tendrá que trabajar como un obrero por este mundo.
original English: - who from tomorrow on shall toil as a worker for this world!

original Spanish: ¡Seguid! ¡Cada día miles de máquinas trabajan para Robert Herne el usurero del mundo!
original English: Every day thousands of machines are working for Robert Herne the world's greatest usurer!

original Spanish: La mitad de la tierra cosecha es para Robert Herne y su país.
original English: Half the world for Robert Herne and his country!

original Spanish: ¡Lisiado por Robert Herne!
original English: Crippled by Robert Herne!

original Spanish: ¿Quién es él para jugar así con la vida de la gente?
original English: Who can play with human lives?

original Spanish: He venido a exigirle a Robert Herne que libere su central para bien de toda la humanidad.
original English: I've come to Robert Herne to urge him to free his Central to all mankind.

original Spanish: Soy Peter Hell y vengo del país de mi madre para instarle a liberar su central para la humanidad.
original English: I'm Peter Hall and I've come from my mother's country to urge you to free your Central for humanity!

original Spanish: Los señores que ha convocado para la conferencia están reunidos en el gabinete de trabajo señor.
original English: The presentation to the gentlemen who have gathered at the Department of Labor.

original English: The drainage of the Val River from the neighboring country to the branch of our maritime border and through the marsh-lined coast can be completed with current projections of work in 15 years by building dykes.

original Spanish: El Estado Libre debe poner inmediatamente a su disposición la mitad de sus hombres aptos para el trabajo de construcción. Robert Herne.
original English: The Free State must provide half of its able-bodied men for the work immediately.

original Spanish: ¡Tengo miedo por ti y por tu central!

original Spanish: El Estado Libre debe poner inmediatamente a su disposición la mitad de sus hombres aptos para el trabajo de construcción. Robert Herne.
original English: The Free State must provide half of its able-bodied men for the work immediately.

original Spanish: No podemos esperar a que un día muera llevándose consigo su secreto para siempre.
original English: We can't wait until the day of his death or his secret will be lost forever!

original Spanish: El duque de Norfolk vuestro tío me envía para que os conduzca a su casa.
original English: The Duke of Norfolk your uncle sends me to accompany you to him.

original Spanish: Al menos hoy podríais haber tenido un poco más de consideración aunque sólo fuera por mi séquito.
original English: For this day at least I expected a little more attention given the company I'm entertaining.

original Spanish: Vendré envuelto en una capa negra para oír de tus labios que me perdonas.
original English: I shall come wearing a black cloak to hear a word of pardon from you. - Henry Norris

original Spanish: ¡Tenéis que ser mía aunque sólo sea por la corona de Inglaterra!
original English: You must be mine - even if it costs the crown of England!

original English: Are you aware that I need only say YES to become the Queen of England? -

original English: Lord Chancellor Wolsey I command you immediately to call the whole of England's church leaders to annul my marriage!

original English: ...We hereby call upon England's high church leaders to annul the marriage of King Henry to Catherine of Aragon who has failed to bring any benediction to the land -

original English: ...We hereby call upon England's high church leaders to annul the marriage of King Henry to Catherine of Aragon who has failed to bring any benediction to the land -

original English: Who moves to annul King Henry's marriage.

original Spanish: Clemente VII Papa por la gracia de Dios
original English: Clement VIII Through the Providence of God the Pope.

original English: Now I shall compose a wedding poem for Anne Boleyn.

original Spanish: ¿De qué cielos tomaré los divinos sonidos para cantar a la reina de la belleza?
original English: From which heavens shall I plunder sounds of the spheres To regale the Queen of Beauty?

original Spanish: ¡Que se rece en todas las iglesias del país para que el cielo bendiga al trono de Inglaterra con un heredero varón!
original English: Prayers shall be offered in every church in the land that Heaven bless England with a male heir to the throne!

original Spanish: ¡Te lo ruego por mi hija deja al Rey en paz!
original English: For my child's sake stay away from the King!

original Spanish: He de arrestar a Su Majestad por orden del Rey.

original Spanish: ¡Miente para vengarse porque yo no respondí a sus desvergonzados intentos!
original English: He's lying out of vengeance - for I rejected his shameful advances!

original English: But Satanas found easy ears with the priests and the scribes   who feared the favour Jesus had won with the people for is miracles.

original English: After the raising of lazarus from the dead - - Jesus is hailed everywhere as if he were a king.

original English: If we let him go on in this manner everybody will believe him in the end   and our temples will stand empty.

original Spanish: y está unido por el poder diabólico
original English: and you have been tied by the power of the devil.

original English: Judas had spent a sleepless night   harassed by the doubts put in his head by the Pharisee. But towards noon he felt   as if a will stronger than his own   directed his steps towards the Golden Gate.

original Spanish: para detener a Jesús por orden de Caifás y soldados romanos les seguían.
original English: but at the same hour   men of the Jewish temple guard went out at the bidding of caiphas   to seize Jesus and Roman soldiers accompanied them.

original English: Swear that you will be ready to serve God   and will be prepared to give up anybody   even your father and mother sister or brother   to the holy punishment of the Inquisition.

original English: these itinerant tribunals   with authority to pass and execute death sentences on the spot   were presided over by a people"s commissar   whose only qualification was that he must know and show no mercy.

original English: Joseph had succeeded in obtaining a forged passport   made out to citizeness Grandet and her son and daughter   by which they hoped to be admitted undetected into Paris.

original English: Erneste durand   up to quite recently a footman in the service of count de chambord   is now heart and soul engrossed in the new political ideas.

original English: This letter to you my dear sister will be my last.

original English: Of the miserable clothes left to Marie Antoinette   at one time the most beautiful lady in France   she had dressed this morning as if for an occasion.

original English: I amputated both legs above the knee.

original English: - Model to pose of "Satan After the Fall".

original English: Since Dame Margarete insists on her right we have asked her to come here tonight so the candidate may have a look at her.

original Spanish: Fue atraído por él como por arte de magia.
original English: He was drawn to it as if by a magic power.
