original English: I've tricked you into loving me -- when you know the truth - - I'm afraid you won't care for me any more.

original Spanish: He intentado todo para evitarlo pero no puedo y todavía me arrodillo para decir mis oraciones cada mañana antes de irme a la cama.
original English: I've tried my best to get over it -- but I can't -- and I still kneel down   and say my prayers every morning -- before I go to bed.

original Spanish: Tienes que salir y valerte por ti mismo ¡este es el último cheque que recibirás por mi parte!
original English: You've got to get out and shift for yourself -  this is the last check you'll get from me!

original Spanish: He comprado un asiento en la Bolsa por cien mil dólares.
original English: I bought a seat on the Stock Exchange for a hundred thousand dollars.

original Spanish: ¿Cien mil dólares por un asiento?
original English: A hundred thousand dollars for a seat?

original Spanish: Si papá no permite que nos casemos quizás lo quieras guardar para acordarte de mí.
original English: If father won't let us marry perhaps you'll keep it to remember me by.

original Spanish: Leon nos casaremos en secreto el martes por la noche por favor encárguese de prepararlo.
original English: Leon we're to be married secretly Tuesday evening -  please make all the arrangements.

original Spanish: Sería una maravillosa sorpresa para ella... si pudiéramos prepararlo todo a tiempo.
original English: It would be a wonderful surprise for her -  if we could only get it ready in time.

original Spanish: ...y por lo que a Agnes se refiere me ha desobedecido...
original English: -- and as for Agnes she has disobeyed me --

original Spanish: Siento que tengas que pasar por esto Rose he intentado alejarlo de ti.
original English: I'm sorry this blow has come Rose - - I've tried to keep it from you --

original Spanish: El ayuda de cámara de Bertie había planeado una gran sorpresa... para la pareja de novios.
original English: Bertie's valet had planned a great surprise for the bridal couple.

original Spanish: Torturado por los pensamientos de Agnes
original English: Tortured by thoughts of Agnes -

original Spanish: Flint está ahora en el parquet sacándole el último aliento a Henrietta... ¡y puedo comprar tu empresa por casi nada!
original English: Flint's on the Floor now knocking the last breath out of   the 'Henrietta' -- and I can buy your holdings for next to nothing!

original Spanish: Rechaza a Lio Sha una de las líderes de las Arañas y le confiesa su amor por Naela.
original English: He rejected the romantic advances of Lio Sha one of the Spider's leaders... and proclaims his love for Naela.

original Spanish: De vuelta de una falsa misión Kay encuentra el cuerpo sin vida de Naela asesinada por las Arañas.
original English: Returning home from a false mission... he finds the dead body of Naela murdered by the Spiders...

original Spanish: Esta pieza de marfil es la llave para entrar.
original English: This piece of ivory is the entrance key.

original Spanish: Los diamantes no eran valiosos para nosotros.
original English: The diamonds were of no value ti us.

original Spanish: El abogado Baker tiene poco respeto por la ley.
original English: Attorney Baker has little respect for the law.

original Spanish: He oído que el Storm Bird está navegando por Sudamérica. ¿Es cierto?
original English: I heard that the Storm Bird is sailing for South America. Is that true?

original Spanish: Encuentra la piedra de Buda para que Asia sea grande y libre sin leyes extranjeras.
original English: Find the Buddha stone so that Asia can become great and free itself from foreign rule.

original Spanish: Ahí está descifrado el contenido del documento secreto. Hace unos 400 años la dinastía Ming en China poseía un diamante que por su peculiar forma se asemejaba a la cabeza de Buda.
original English: Here are the decoded contents of the secret document About four hundred years ago the Ming dynasty in China has in possession a diamond which because of its peculiar shape resembled the head of Buddha.

original Spanish: Debo marcharme por un asunto importante.
original English: I must leave at once on important business.

original Spanish: Lucharé por lo que es mío.
original English: I hold my hand upon what is mine.

original Spanish: Te retendremos durante 48 horas para que no sabotees nuestros planes. Después serás libre.
original English: We will keep you here for 48 hours to prevent sabotage of our plans Then you are free.

original Spanish: Piedra posiblemente en Islas Falkland. Kay Hoog en camino para encontrar el diamante.
original English: Stone possibly on Falkland Islands Kay Hoog on his way to find the diamond.

original Spanish: Debemos ser prudentes para no despertar sospechas. Puede observar su habitación desde aquí.
original English: We must be careful not to arouse suspicion You can observe their room from here.

original Spanish: La piedra se ha perdido para siempre.
original English: The stone is lost forever.

original Spanish: Adaptada por Hanns Kräly y Ernst Lubitsch Dirección:
original English: Adapted by Hanns Kräly and Ernst Lubitsch Director:

original Spanish: Es el traficante de esclavos más respetado de Oriente muy apreciado por el poderoso jeque.
original English: He is the most respected Eastern salve trader highly appreciated by the great Sheik.

original Spanish: ¡No estaría mal para el harén del poderoso!
original English: That one is someething for the harem of the great Sheik!

original Spanish: ¡Juro por Alá que soy el único culpable!
original English: I swear by Allah I am the only one who is guilty!

original Spanish: El gran jeque me ha mandado llamar para que esta noche le lleve a ver a la bailarina.
original English: The great sheik asked me to bring the dancer to him this evening. The great sheik asked me to bring the dancer to him this evening.

original Spanish: No por menos de 10.000.
original English: Not less than 10 000.

original Spanish: ¡Qué intento infantil para engañar!
original English: What a childish attempt at deception!

original Spanish: ¡Ahora nos toca a los gordos!" - 500.000 para la promotora.
original English: Now it's the fat ones' turn!" - 500 000 for the building society.

original Spanish: - ¡Un poco de respeto por favor!
original English: - A little respect!

original Spanish: ¡Quiero pasión por mi dinero!
original English: I want passion for my money!

original Spanish: Ese fuego ardiente extinguido por una bota de Su Alteza.
original English: This blaze stamped out by His royal Highness's leather boot.

original Spanish: Aún te debo decir que nunca tuve la satisfacción de conocer a mi primo fallecido y mucho menos a su esposa por tanto.
original English: I must say I never had the satisfaction of knowing your late cousin much less if wife so.

original Spanish: Un telegrama para Irmgard Vanderheit.
original English: A telegram for Irmdard Vanderheit.

original Spanish: Mándeme este telegrama con la nota de urgente y el resto del dinero es para usted por su trabajo
original English: Send me this telegram with the urgent note and the rest of the money is for you for your work.

original Spanish: Mándeme este telegrama con la nota de urgente y el resto del dinero es para usted por su trabajo
original English: Send me this telegram with the urgent note and the rest of the money is for you for your work.

original Spanish: El carruaje para la señora Karen Svenden.
original English: The carriage for Lady Karen Svenden.

original Spanish: Acabo de dar a otros pasajeros el cuarto que estaba reservado para esta señora.
original English: I've just given the room that was reserved to this lady to other passengers.

original Spanish: Un hombre que asegura una monstruosidad acaba de preguntar por Su Excelencia y por eso vine donde usted
original English: A man that is sure of a monstruosity just asked for your Excelency and for this I came in front

original Spanish: La señora necesita partir de inmediato porque él viene cruzando el lago y sólo hay una salida por las montañas.
original English: You need to go immediately because he is already crossing the lake and you can only escape to the mountains.

original Spanish: Le estaré eternamente agradecida por su ayuda y ofrecimiento pero necesito llevar mi cruz sola.
original English: I'm forever grateful for your help Am I lying then? Then look for yourself

original Spanish: No sé donde está la perdí por Nuestro Señor.
original English: I dont know where is it. I lost it for the love of god.

original Spanish: Ahora usted sigue de frente después gira a la izquierda para llegar a la piedra del infierno pero lleve cuidado porque allí arriba están trabajando en las canteras para la construcción de la nueva carretera.
original English: Now you go front and then turn left to arrive at the stone from hell but be careful because up there they are working in the quarrys For the construction of the new road.

original Spanish: Un paso más y me tiro por el precipicio
original English: One more step and i'll throw myself over the edge.

original Spanish: No tenemos tiempo para alcanzar la aldea antes de caer la noche por eso nos vamos a resguardar en la primera cabaña de abrigo porque el tiempo está amenazando
original English: We dont have time to reach the village before nightall let us find shelter in the first hut we find the weather is threatening.

original Spanish: No tenemos tiempo para alcanzar la aldea antes de caer la noche por eso nos vamos a resguardar en la primera cabaña de abrigo porque el tiempo está amenazando
original English: We dont have time to reach the village before nightall let us find shelter in the first hut we find the weather is threatening.

original Spanish: Iba ahora mismo a buscar la casa en la que anuncian necesitar una empleada pues necesito ganarme la vida para mantener a mi vieja madre.
original English: I was just going to search for a house that put an annoucement saying they need a servant because I need to earn life to take care of my old mother.

original Spanish: La campaña para casarme me ha traído innumerables molestias ¿Quieres ser mi ayudante?
original English: My campaign to marriage has brought me countless problems. Would you like to be my assistant?

original Spanish: Es por nuestro hijo Jorge déjame ser tu mujer también ante la ley.
original English: It's for our son Jorge let me be your wife also in law.

original Spanish: Agradezco a Dios que tú aún vivas y que yo aun pueda vivir para puedas saber toda la verdad.
original English: I thank God that you still live and that I can still live so you know the truth.

original Spanish: No quiero que me tengas por una estafadora que quería conseguir por este método sustento para un futuro
original English: I do want you to think that I am a crook that I want to have a mean of support for the future.

original Spanish: No quiero que me tengas por una estafadora que quería conseguir por este método sustento para un futuro
original English: I do want you to think that I am a crook that I want to have a mean of support for the future.

original Spanish: No quiero que me tengas por una estafadora que quería conseguir por este método sustento para un futuro
original English: I do want you to think that I am a crook that I want to have a mean of support for the future.

original Spanish: La casualidad hizo que te descubriese y lo guardé para mi en consideración a mi cuñada...
original English: Casualty made me find you and I what I kept in relation to my sister-in-law...

original Spanish: Y para huir a la persecución de John lo intenté con mi nombre de familia y para poder hacerlo con sosiego llevé a mi hijo a casa de mi madre.
original English: And to run of John's prosecution I tried to run away with my family name so I could make it in peace I took my son to my mother's home.

original Spanish: Y para huir a la persecución de John lo intenté con mi nombre de familia y para poder hacerlo con sosiego llevé a mi hijo a casa de mi madre.
original English: And to run of John's prosecution I tried to run away with my family name so I could make it in peace I took my son to my mother's home.

original Spanish: Yo voy a ver si consigo echarle mano a aquel bandido y ustedes sigan para la cabaña
original English: I'll see if I can set hand on that bandit you go to that cabin.

original Spanish: Irmgard mandó buscar a la madre y al hijo para las montañas.
original English: Irmgard sent for her mother and son to the mountains.

original Spanish: Si la Sra. no fuese la mujer del fallecido Vanderheit que por su fe no admitía el matrimonio toda su fortuna me pertenecería.
original English: If you weren't the wife of the late Vanderheit that by his fate didn't admit marriage all his fortune would revert to me.

original Spanish: Tendría yo por destino el derecho de no socorrer a una mujer en la mayor de sus angustias.
original English: Would have the right of not helping a woman in the biggest of her aflictions.

original Spanish: El ideal de un hombre para una mujer.
original English: He gave of One Man for One Woman.

original Spanish: Si de alguna manera esta historia hace ver a los hombres... El sufrimiento causado por nuestro egoísmo entonces no será un esfuerzo inútil.
original English: If there is anything in this story that brings home to men the suffering caused by our selfishness perhaps it will not be in vain.

original Spanish: El apuesto Lennox Sanderson que depende para vivir de un padre rico.
original English: An occasional interloper in Society - The dashing Lennox Sanderson who depends go his living upon a rich father.

original Spanish: Os conocía por las fotos.
original English: I knew you both from your pictures.

original Spanish: El vestido que Anna y su madre hicieron para las fiestas de sociedad.
original English: Anna's dress that she and her mother had made in case she should go out in Society.

original Spanish: Sólo para picar a las hermanas de las cuales no está demasiado orgullosa la tía dispone algo diferente para Anna.
original English: Solely to pique the sisters of whom she is not over-fond the aunt makes different arrangements for Anna.

original Spanish: La prima Emma apresura a Anna para que se vaya a la cama. Tal vez temiendo que sus propias hijas queden eclipsadas.
original English: Cousin Emma hurries Anna off to bed - perhaps in fear of her own daughters being outshone.

original Spanish: El susceptible Sanderson obsesionado por un nuevo deseo.
original English: The susceptible Sanderson obsesed by a new desire.

original Spanish: Sanderson después de verla en varias reuniones atrae a Anna finalmente a sus aposentos para que conozca a una supuesta tía.
original English: Sanderson after managing several meetings finally lures Anna to the apartment to meet a mythical aunt.

original Spanish: La antigua vida demasiado placentera para dejarla.
original English: The old way too pleasant to give up.

original Spanish: Cada vez son menos frecuentes sus reuniones secretas hasta que por fin...
original English: Less and less frequent their secret meetings until at last...

original Spanish: Ella le indica una nueva razón muy tierna... por la que el secreto no puede guardarse más tiempo.
original English: She tells him of a tender new reason why the secret cannot be kept any longer.

original Spanish: El matrimonio hubiera significado para mí perderlo todo.
original English: Marriage would have meant my losing everything...

original Spanish: Sola en las tenebrosas horas de la noche y conmovida de horrible temor por el alma de su hijo ella misma realiza el sagrado rito.
original English: Helpless and alone in the dreadful hours of the night and stricken with a terrible fear for her baby's soul... she herself performs the sacred rite.

original Spanish: Holler el criado de Barlett se está acicalando... para ver a Kate la sobrina de Squire.
original English: Hi Holler the Barlett's chore boy sprucing op in the barn to meet Kate the Squire's niece.

original Spanish: No pareces tener fuerzas para trabajar.
original English: You don't 'pear to have no strength to work.

original Spanish: Por lo que sabemos podría ser una perdida vagando por ahí.
original English: For all we know she might be some loose woman wandering' 'round.

original Spanish: Lo siento jovencita no tengo nada para ti.
original English: Sorry young lady but I ain't got nothing for yet.

original Spanish: Todo lo que hagáis por el más ínfimo lo hacéis por mí.
original English: Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these... ye have done it unto me!

original Spanish: Fue establecido por los Squire y su familia... desde la infancia que Kate y David se casarían.
original English: It has been settled by the Squire and David's childhood that they are to marry

original Spanish: Un corazón para un corazón un alma para un alma Un amor para un amor Juntos para la eternidad.
original English: One heart for one heart One soul for one soul One love for one love Even through Eternity.

original Spanish: Un corazón para un corazón un alma para un alma Un amor para un amor Juntos para la eternidad.
original English: One heart for one heart One soul for one soul One love for one love Even through Eternity.

original Spanish: Un corazón para un corazón un alma para un alma Un amor para un amor Juntos para la eternidad.
original English: One heart for one heart One soul for one soul One love for one love Even through Eternity.

original Spanish: Un corazón para un corazón un alma para un alma Un amor para un amor Juntos para la eternidad.
original English: One heart for one heart One soul for one soul One love for one love Even through Eternity.

original Spanish: Por fin el gran amor. Solo detenido por el pasado.
original English: At last the freat over- whelming love - only to be halted by the stark ghosts of her past.

original Spanish: Por fin el gran amor. Solo detenido por el pasado.
original English: At last the freat over- whelming love - only to be halted by the stark ghosts of her past.

original Spanish: El corazón enamorado del profesor lo trae a estas tierras para ver a Kate.
original English: The Professor's love... burdened heart brings him down to the country to see Kate.

original Spanish: Anna va al almacén a por unos dulces que se le habían olvidado... para la gran fiesta prevista para la noche.
original English: Anna goes ton the store after forgotten goodies for the big party planned for the evening.

original Spanish: Anna va al almacén a por unos dulces que se le habían olvidado... para la gran fiesta prevista para la noche.
original English: Anna goes ton the store after forgotten goodies for the big party planned for the evening.

original Spanish: Supongamos Squire que yo hubiera sido... como usted sospechaba cuando me vio por primera vez.
original English: Suppose Squire I had been like you suspected when you first saw me?

original Spanish: De camino a la gran fiesta paran para calentarse en casa de los Squire y danzan a la antigua usanza.
original English: On their way to the big party they stop to warm up at the Squire's with an old- fashioned dance.

original Spanish: David por alguna razón no se muestra interesado en la fiesta.
original English: David for some reason suddenly discovers he is not interested in the party.

original Spanish: Cada vez mas preocupado por la presencia de Anna
original English: Moro and worried by Anna's presence...

original Spanish: ¿Significa Lennox Sanderson algo para ti?
original English: Does Lennox Sanderson mean anything to you?

original Spanish: Iré a Belden por la mañana.
original English: I'll go to Belden in the morning...

original Spanish: ¡Por favor por favor no!
original English: Please! Please don't!

original Spanish: Fui una chica ignorante traicionada por un falso matrimonio.
original English: That I was an ignorant girl betrayed through a mock marriage.

original Spanish: Un hombre para una mujer unidos por un sacramento.
original English: The one man for the one woman Between them the Sacramental bond...

original Spanish: Un hombre para una mujer unidos por un sacramento.
original English: The one man for the one woman Between them the Sacramental bond...

original Spanish: Helene tengo mucho trabajo para hacer de nuevo.
original English: Helene I have a lot of work to do again.

original Spanish: Cada vez está logrando una mejor posición como médico y científico como he deseado alguna vez para él desde nuestra niñez.
original English: More and more he is attaining a position as a physician and scientist that I've desired for him ever since our childhood together.

original Spanish: Esto sólo importa para conocerlo en la plenitud de la fama se ha puesto más intenso incluso después de nuestro compromiso.
original English: This only concern about knowing himself at the height of fame has even become more intense after our engagement.

original Spanish: Y todavía mientras más se acerca esa meta más inhibida se vuelve mi pasión por él sobre la cual probablemente él no sepa nada porque siempre tengo miedo que mi amor podría llevarlo por un mal camino.
original English: And yet the more auspiciously he approaches that goal the more inhibited my passion for him becomes about which he probably knows nothing because I'm always afraid that my love might lead him astray.

original Spanish: Por favor venga mañana de nuevo para verme!
original English: Please do come again tomorrow to look in on me!

original Spanish: He venido... para fijar un día...
original English: I've come... to fix a day...

original Spanish: Y por eso nunca debo verle de nuevo.
original English: And that's why I must never see you again.

original Spanish: Una oración de acción de gracias por la gracia de la visión.
original English: A thanksgiving prayer to God for the grace of vision.

original Spanish: ... pero una campesina enferma ha estado esperando por media hora.
original English: ... but a sick peasant woman has been waiting for half an hour.

original Spanish: Cuando te vi por primera vez supe que te amaría eternamente.
original English: When I first saw you I knew that I would love you endlessly.

original Spanish: A las seis el profesor quiere sacar al hombre ciego a la luz por primera vez desde la operación.
original English: At six o'clock the professor wants to bring the blind man out into the light for the first time since the operation.

original Spanish: Como doctor tengo que exigir por lo menos este tiempo para su tratamiento".
original English: As a doctor I have to demand at least this time for your further treatment.

original Spanish: Como doctor tengo que exigir por lo menos este tiempo para su tratamiento".
original English: As a doctor I have to demand at least this time for your further treatment.

original Spanish: Lily... podrías...estar...muy... triste... mañana... quizás por un día...
original English: Lily... would you... be... very... sad... tomorrow...perhaps for a day...

original Spanish: Profesor Doctor EIGIL BORNE quién como es bien sabido se ha dedicado durante meses completamente a la oftalmología y quién ha sido bendecido por centenares de personas sanadas recientemente...
original English: Professor Doctor EIGIL BÖRNE who as is well known has dedicated himself for months entirely to ophthalmology and who is blessed by hundreds of healed persons has recently...

original Spanish: Ojo por ojo diente por diente.
original English: What you do to me I'll do to you!

original Spanish: Yo lo curaré por más que me cueste.
original English: I will cure him however difficult it will be!

original Spanish: Adaptada para el cine por E. A. Dupont
original English: Adapted for the film by E. A. Dupont.

original Spanish: Adaptada para el cine por E. A. Dupont
original English: Adapted for the film by E. A. Dupont.

original Spanish: Producida por Gloria-Film G.m.b.H. - Berlín
original English: Produced by the Gloria-Film GmbH Berlin.

original Spanish: ¿Ninguno de vosotros tiene agallas para retorcerle el pescuezo al buitre?
original English: None of you has the heart to break the vulture's neck?

original Spanish: Entonces susurró por los aires...
original English: There it rushed through the air...

original Spanish: ... tanto si me tratas bien como si me matas... me da igual... para vos ya no tengo corazón...
original English: whether you treat me well or strike me dead - it's all one to me... I have no heart left for you...

original Spanish: Tienes que haber hecho alguna barbaridad para que el viejo te mande aquí arriba...
original English: You must have done something terrible if the old one sent you up here...

original Spanish: ...pero no para casarme...
original English: but not enough to marry you...

original Spanish: Sólo queríamos preguntarte si nos vas a echar por haber sido tan malas contigo cuando Stromminger vivía...
original English: We only wished to ask you if you intend to send us away because we treated you so badly while Stromminger was alive...

original Spanish: Joseph me envía y os invita atentamente al baile por S. Pedro y S. Pablo.
original English: Joseph sends you friendly greetings and asks you to the dance on St. Peter's Day.

original Spanish: ¿Por qué te fuiste Wally el buitre por culpa de Afra?
original English: Why did you leave Wally? Was it because of Afra?

original Spanish: Y porque tú la has difamado te hice yo la jugarreta por S. Pedro y S. Pablo... pero después me arrepentí...
original English: And because you sullied her I played that prank on you on." "St. Peter's Day... but I felt bad about it afterwards...

original Spanish: Hamlet fue representado por primera vez el 4 de febrero de 1921 en Berlín sin que sobreviva negativo original alguno.
original English: Hamlet was performed for the first time on the 4th of February 1921 in Berlin; no original negative survives.

original Spanish: La clave para Hamlet era hasta hoy un profundo secreto - - ¡Hamlet era en realidad una mujer!
original English: The key to Hamlet was until now a deep secret - - Hamlet was a really woman!

original Spanish: ¡Guarde Dios nuestro secreto por el bien del país!
original English: God keep our secret for the good of the country!

original Spanish: ¡Mi padre fue muerto por una espada danesa!
original English: My father fell by a Danish sword!

original Spanish: Su deseo lujurioso por el trono real lleva a Claudio a ejecutar acciones temerarias.
original English: His lust for the King's throne drives Claudius to reckless deeds.

original Spanish: Es un día feliz para nosotros.
original English: It is a happy day for us.

original Spanish: ¡Padre en todo vuestro imperio soy el único que queda para guardaros luto!
original English: Father in your whole empire I am the only one left to mourn you!

original Spanish: ¡Encontré también la serpiente mi príncipe y para mí que parecía una de las serpientes venenosas de las mazmorras del castillo!
original English: I found the snake also Prince and to me it looked like one of the venomous snakes from the Castle Dungeon!

original Spanish: ¡Quiero que la gente crea que he perdido el sentido para poder investigar inadvertidamente!
original English: I want people to think that I have lost my senses so I can investigate unnoticed!

original Spanish: ¡Padre! ¡Padre! ¡Dadme una señal para vengar vuestra muerte!
original English: Father father give me a sign to avenge your death!

original Spanish: ¡Ahora dadme la fuerza para vengaros!
original English: Now give me the strength to avenge you!

original Spanish: Demasiado débil para matar e incluso demasiado débil para morir.
original English: Too weak to kill and too weak even to die.

original Spanish: ¡Recordar que quería salvar el trono de nuestros padres para vos!
original English: Remember that I wanted to save the throne of our father for you!

original Spanish: ¡Esto era para mí!
original English: This was meant for me!

original Spanish: Tengo un importante mensaje para el Rey Fortinbrás.
original English: I have an important message for King Fortinbras.

original Spanish: El pesar por la muerte de su padre enloquece a Ofelia.
original English: Grief over the death of her father drove Ophelia mad.

original Spanish: ¡Orden para nuestro vasallo el Rey Fortinbrás!
original English: Order to our vassal King Fortinbras!

original Spanish: Una decreto terminante para el bienestar de Noruega y Dinamarca.
original English: A strict command for the welfare of Norway and Denmark.

original Spanish: La palabra "Hamlet" es cambiada por "mensajeros".
original English: The word "Hamlet" is changed to "escorts

original Spanish: El Rey Fortinbrás decidió ayudar a su amigo para librar a Dinamarca de su criminal monarca.
original English: King Fortinbras decided to help his friend and to free Denmark from its criminal king.

original Spanish: ¡La iglesia no consiente rezos para una suicida!
original English: The Church has no prayers for a suicide!

original Spanish: ¡Demasiado tarde para amaros demasiado tarde!
original English: Too late to be lovers too late!

original Spanish: El cajero del banco y su banda de falsificadores tienen una buena razón para hacer creer a la gente que esta casa está encantada.
original English: The bank cashier and his band of counterfeiters have a strong reason for making people believe this house is haunted.

original Spanish: Después de buscar por todas partes la policía encontró donde estaba
original English: After searching everywhere else the police found him where he was.

original Spanish: Navega una barca por el río.
original English: There sails a ship over river and sea.

original Spanish: Se necesitaban trabajadores pues había que drenar el pantano y cavar un canal para conducir el agua hacia Stora Sjöträsket.
original English: The swamp were to be dried - a canal to be dug and lead the water to Sjöfallet.

original Spanish: Las granjas cercanas brindaban a los trabajadores un lugar para comer y dormir.
original English: The nearby farms gave the workers a place to eat and sleep.

original Spanish: Mucha gente se había reunido ese día para presenciar la destrucción de la presa.
original English: Many people were gathering as the dam was to be broken.

original Spanish: Así terminó su aventura aunque esta vez y por primera vez se fue con las manos vacías.
original English: It was his way of ending an adventure empty handed for the first time.

original Spanish: Marit trabajaba duro en la granja mientras sufría reprimendas por parte de su patrona.
original English: Marit worked hard. Toiling and suffering under the old ones command.

original Spanish: Desde aquella mañana de Navidad hace dieciocho años yo siempre he sido como un padre para ella.
original English: Since that Christmas morning 18 years ago I have been like a father to her.

original Spanish: Yo no la voy a obligar a irse pero siempre intentaré que tengamos un hogar para ambos.
original English: I don't mean to push you around. I'll always try to get a home for her and me.

original Spanish: Ofreced cobijo a un viajero por una noche.
original English: A room for the night you lend me!

original Spanish: Chica ¿se ofrece aquí habitación a un viajero para pasar la noche?
original English: Hey girl. Could you offer a traveler a room for the night?

original Spanish: ¿Y todo para quién?
original English: Who are you toiling for?

original Spanish: Parece que la suegra no es una invitada bienvenida para su nuera.
original English: It seems the mother in law is not a welcome guest to her daughter in law.

original Spanish: ¿Y por qué no hay pan en la mesa cuando llega una visita?
original English: And why isn't there any bread left when she comes visiting?

original Spanish: ¡Estoy huyendo de tu madre por si quieres saberlo!
original English: I'm fleeing your mother if you need to hear it.

original Spanish: Él no la obligó. ella se fue por propia voluntad.
original English: She went freely.

original Spanish: Todo aquello había sucedido como en un sueño: el descenso por los rápidos la llegada al islote...
original English: Everything had happened like in a dream: The ride down the rapids and the arrival to the island.

original Spanish: Él no me dejaba en paz me perseguía me acosaba... Y cuando me pidió que me fuera con él lo hice sin ni siquiera saber por qué lo hacía ni a dónde iba.
original English: She wouldn't give me any peace - he pushed me around - and when she asked me to leave

original Spanish: ¡Yo no me la llevé! ¡Ella vino por voluntad propia!
original English: I didn't steal her - she came on her own...

original Spanish: ¿Te fuiste tú por voluntad propia?
original English: You went willingly?

original Spanish: Enhorabuena por su actuación de anoche
original English: Congratulations on your performance last night.

original Spanish: La caridad... para algunos un deber para otros una alegría
original English: Charity — to some a duty to others a joy.

original Spanish: No me cobrará por un bebé de pecho.
original English: You don't charge for a baby in arms?

original Spanish: Ha hecho mucho por ellos.
original English: You have done enough for them.

original Spanish: ¡En este lugar sabremos seguro la hora de brindar por el Año Nuevo!
original English: Well we will certainly know when it's time to toast the New Year!

original Spanish: Venía de buena familia estudió en la Universidad de Uppsala por eso era algo más sabio que el resto de nosotros.
original English: He came of a good family and had studied hard at Uppsala University so he knew a bit more than the rest of us.

original Spanish: Ahora puedes comprender por qué temo tanto que me suceda algo fatal la Víspera de Año Nuevo.
original English: Now you know why i'm afraid of something fatal happening on New Year's Eve.

original Spanish: Cuando llego ya es demasiado tarde para llamar a los médicos.
original English: By the time I arrive it is too late for a doctor.

original Spanish: ¡Mañana terminarás de cumplir tu sentencia por abusar del alcohol.
original English: By tomorrow you will have served your time for drunken behaviour.

original Spanish: Pero creemos que tú deberías cumplir su sentencia puesto que sólo tú fuiste quien le llevó por el mal camino y le hizo un asesino.
original English: But we feel that you ought to serve the sentence instead since you and you alone led him astray and made him a killer.

original Spanish: ¿No es eso suficiente razón para que endereces tu vida David Holm?
original English: Does this not make you turn from your wicked ways David Holm?

original Spanish: ¡Les daré una razón para dejar de reír!
original English: l'll wipe those smiles off your faces.

original Spanish: ¡No deseo recordarte los viajes que emprendiste para encontrar a tu esposa mientras el odio y la venganza crecían dentro de ti!
original English: l'll refrain from reminding you of your search for your wife during which your feelings of hatred and revenge waxed stronger.

original Spanish: Hermana María ¿No comprendes lo feliz que soy al ser capaz de hacer algo por el primer invitado que el Señor nos ha enviado?
original English: Don't you realise Maria how it pleases me to help the first guest God sent us?

original Spanish: Cuando por fin fue a acostarse la penetrante helada del invierno había ocupado la habitación.
original English: By the time she went to bed the chill of winter had thoroughly penetrated the room.

original Spanish: Esa noche recé para que nuestro primer invitado tuviera un buen año y me gustaría saber si mi plegaria fue escuchada.
original English: You see I prayed that our first guest would have a good year." "And I wanted to find out if my prayers were answered.

original Spanish: Vendré para que veas que Dios no ha prestado atención a tus absurdos murmullos.
original English: l'll come to show you God didn't give a fig for you or your twaddle.

original Spanish: Te seguiré con gusto pero debes indultarme hasta mañana y dejarme persuadir a alguien para que haga lo correcto.
original English: l will gladly heed your summons but grant me a day's grace for there is someone I must talk sense into.

original Spanish: Preferiría que te quedaras para volver a desafiarte.
original English: l would rather you stayed so I may challenge you again.

original Spanish: Ya ves hermanita estoy viajando por toda Suecia buscando a alguien debo encontrarle a toda costa.
original English: You see little missy i'm on a journey throughout Sweden in search of a person I must find at all costs.

original Spanish: ¡Cuando la encuentre ten por seguro que te lo diré!
original English: You'll know that when I find the person in question

original Spanish: Ella había sacrificado lo mejor de si misma y nunca había pedido nada en este mundo para sí.
original English: She had got the better of herself and asked for none of the things that belonged to this world.

original Spanish: ¡Su pecado no habría sido tan grande si no hubiese sido por mí!
original English: His sin would be of less magnitude if not for me.

original Spanish: Será suficiente para los niños y para mi.
original English: It will suffice for the children and myself.

original Spanish: ¡David ahora puedo ver que no necesito sufrir más por ti!
original English: David I see that I no longer need to grieve for you!

original Spanish: Quiero convertirme en un hombre bueno pero nadie me cree. ¿No es razón para llorar?
original English: l want to be good but no one believes me. ls it any wonder I cry?

original Spanish: Cada primavera un grupo de gitanos se alojaba en los bosques de Caddam cerca de Thrums en Escocia para gran alarma de los piadosos aldeanos.
original English: Every spring in the Caddam Woods near Thrums in Scotland a troup of gypsies settles: Every spring again to the fright of the pious villagers.

original Spanish: Sanders Webster un anciano reunió el sustento para su madre con sus esfuerzos.
original English: Sanders Webster himself already an old man earned with arduous work the dry bread for his mother.

original Spanish: No me sorprendería si nuestros tejedores recurren a luchar por sus derechos.
original English: I deem our weavers capable of fighting for their right if need be.

original Spanish: ¡Por lástima y vergüenza por tu violencia y crimen!
original English: In compassion and shame for your violence and crime!

original Spanish: -- ¡Expulsémoslos de Camman Woods de una vez por todas!
original English: Let's chase them out of the Cammam Woods for once and for all!

original Spanish: -- ¡Es demasiado joven para estar cerca de esas hermosas chicas gitanas!
original English: He's a bit young though. To be walking alone between all those pretty gypsy girls.

original Spanish: - - No habrá paz en Thrums a menos que sea restaurada por los soldados.
original English: Lord Rintoul there will be no order in Thrums before it's been brought in by the soldiers.

original Spanish: -- ¿Por qué no usas tu influencia para aumentar los salarios?
original English: Why don't you use your power to bring the wages up again?

original Spanish: -- ¡Si no me creéis usaré esto para advertiros!
original English: If you don't believe me: Here is the horn with which I've warned you!

original Spanish: Mi esposo está haciendo todo lo posible para ejercer la autoridad.
original English: My husband does all that's in his power to maintain the legal authority...

original Spanish: - - La niñera dice que es por mi educación...
original English: Nanny says it's because of the way in which I was raised!

original Spanish: - - Babbie por favor no te burles de mí cuando trato de ser serio.
original English: Babbie please don't tease me when I'm trying to be serious.

original Spanish: Es una tarea triste para nosotros tener que dejar ir a un hombre tan joven.
original English: It's sad work for the council of elders to have to fire such a boy.

original Spanish: Tocó el cuerno para advertir a los tejedores.
original English: She blew the horn and warned the weavers.

original Spanish: - - Sólo vengo a traer bayas para los caballeros ministro.
original English: I've come to bring berries for the gentlemen sir.

original Spanish: - - Lo dijiste para salvarme.
original English: You've said that to save me!

original Spanish: - - Me temo que lo hice por esa razón.
original English: I am also afraid that I've done it because of that.

original Spanish: - - Me atrevería a cualquier cosa Babbie para convertirte en la dueña de la parroquia.
original English: I would dare everything Babbie to make you mistress at the vicarage.

original Spanish: ¿Qué es esto para ti?
original English: What concern is that of yours?

original Spanish: - - Hay una reunión especial sobre nuestro ministro quien por su mala conducta ha manchado su traje de vicario.
original English: There's a special meeting concerning our minister who through his conduct has cast a stain on the cloth of god's servant...

original Spanish: - - Hendry por favor lee la acusación.
original English: Read the charge Hendry.

original Spanish: La gitana no podía tocar el cuerno así que lo hice por ella.
original English: The gypsy girl couldn't blow... then I've done it for her.

original Spanish: - - En primer lugar que este Gavin Dishart se ha sentado con la mencionada gitana en la pared que rodea el jardín de Nanny Webster con apenas la distancia suficiente para que quepa una pequeña biblia.
original English: ...firstly that he said Gavin Dishart sat with said gypsy girl upon the wall of Nanny Webster's garden with a space not as big as the width of a small bible between them.

original Spanish: Jeanne ha sido testigo de que Gavin se sentó con la rosa antes mencionada en su mano por lo tanto concluyendo que sus pensamientos estaban lejos de su santa vocación.
original English: ...and that said Jeanne has seen that said Gavin sat with said rose in his hand so that she reasonably supposed that his thoughts were far away from his sacred calling.

original Spanish: ¡Vienen a por mí!
original English: They seek ME!

original Spanish: - - Me ocuparé de que sus salarios mejoren por encima del promedio anterior.
original English: ...ik will also see that the wages are raised again;

original Spanish: Cuando Binoclard entra para devolver el uniforme robado a Cogolin para perpetrar su crimen es sorprendido por el regreso de Parisette y su tío y es testigo de una conversación en la que
original English: While Binoclard comes to put back in place the uniform borrowed from Cogolin to perpetrate his crime he is surprised by the return of Parisette and her uncle and witnesses a conversation where Cogolin reveals to Parisette his origins:

original Spanish: Cuando Binoclard entra para devolver el uniforme robado a Cogolin para perpetrar su crimen es sorprendido por el regreso de Parisette y su tío y es testigo de una conversación en la que
original English: While Binoclard comes to put back in place the uniform borrowed from Cogolin to perpetrate his crime he is surprised by the return of Parisette and her uncle and witnesses a conversation where Cogolin reveals to Parisette his origins:

original Spanish: Un botón de su uniforme encontrado en casa de la víctima acusa a Cogolin que confiando en la justicia para probar su inocencia huye para no traicionar el secreto de su amiga la señora Stéfan:
original English: A button from his suit found at the victim's home accuses Cogolin. Confident in the justice system which would soon prove his innocence Cogolin fled so as not to betray the secret of his friend Madame Stéfan:

original Spanish: Llegó para cenar y luego me acompañó a casa del señor Stéfan donde pasamos la velada.
original English: He came home for dinner then accompanied me to Mr. Stéfan's where we spent the evening.

original Spanish: - - Si nadie ha venido entonces su tío los ha reemplazado por estas joyas.
original English: If no one came here then it was your uncle who replaced them with these jewels?

original Spanish: - - Debería estar aquí para decírselo él mismo.
original English: He should be here to say it himself!

original Spanish: ¿Cuándo lo ha visto por última vez?
original English: When was the last time you saw him?

original Spanish: Maria pon flores por todas partes para recibirla.
original English: Maria put flowers everywhere to receive her.

original Spanish: Maria pon flores por todas partes para recibirla.
original English: Maria put flowers everywhere to receive her.

original Spanish: Recomendada por el Ministerio de Educación Producida por Shochiku Kinema
original English: Recommended by the Ministry of Education Produced by Shochiku Kinema

original Spanish: Supervisada por Kaoru Osanai
original English: Supervised by Kaoru Osanai

original Spanish: Dirigida por Minoru Murata
original English: Directed by Minoru Murata

original Spanish: Hay tiempo para ser piadosos.
original English: Jesus Christ showed us mercy and told us to be merciful too.

original Spanish: Ve por Taro.
original English: Go fetch Taro.

original Spanish: En una calle de la ciudad había gente alrededor de los bailarines Yagibushi. Taro pasó por allí y se unió a ellos.
original English: In the street there was a crowd around some Yagibushi dancers.

original Spanish: Sin dinero ni comida y cansado por el largo viaje hasta las rocas del barranco.
original English: With no money and no food being tired from the long journey they lay behind the rocks of the ravine.

original Spanish: Lamentablemente no tiene la edad para vivir sin sus padres.
original English: Poor thing.

original Spanish: Koichiro ha llegado a la puerta de su casa por los ánimos de su esposa e hija.
original English: Koichiro has arrived at the gate of his house encouraging his wife and daughter.

original Spanish: Señora salga por favor. La están buscando.
original English: My lady come out please.

original Spanish: Padre te pido un favor. Un hombre con su esposa e hija no tienen lugar para dormir ni qué comer... Por eso preguntan por ti.
original English: Father a man with his wife and daughter who have no place to sleep and nothing to eat are asking you a favour.

original Spanish: Padre te pido un favor. Un hombre con su esposa e hija no tienen lugar para dormir ni qué comer... Por eso preguntan por ti.
original English: Father a man with his wife and daughter who have no place to sleep and nothing to eat are asking you a favour.

original Spanish: El primer verso es para ti.
original English: The first verse is for you.

original Spanish: Abrázala por favor padre.
original English: Father embrace her please.

original Spanish: Gracias por venir.
original English: Thank you for coming.

original Spanish: Como no puedo ir por algunos motivos por favor llévelos.
original English: As I can't go please take them.

original Spanish: Di que sí por favor.
original English: Say yes please.

original Spanish: Producida por la sociedad Rexfilm Lupu Pick
original English: Produced by Rexfilm Lupu Pick Society

original Spanish: La reconstrucción fue realizada en 2002... por Luciano Berriatúa y Camille Blot-Wellens... por encargo de la Friedrich-Wilhelm- Murnau-Stiftung de Wiesbaden.
original English: The reconstruction was carried out in 2002 by Luciano Berriatúa and Camille Blot-Wellens on behalf of the Friedrich-Wilhelm- Murnau-Stiftung in Wiesbaden.

original Spanish: Los títulos añadidos se reconocen... por el logo de la Friedrich-Wilhelm- Murnau-Stiftung (FWMS).
original English: The newly appended titles are recognisable by way of the Friedrich-Wilhelm- Murnau-Stiftung (FWMS) logo.

original Spanish: El negativo maestro de esta reconstrucción se utilizó en 2013 para la versión digital 2K.
original English: The master negative of this reconstruction was used in 2013 for the 2K digital version.

original Spanish: Adaptado por Carl Mayer.
original English: adapted by Carl Mayer.

original Spanish: Vestuario masculino confeccionado por la Hause S. Adam.
original English: The gentlemen's wardrobes bespoke are credited to Hause S. Adam.

original Spanish: Esperando por la Baronesa.
original English: Awaiting the Baroness.

original Spanish: Ya que esta jornada de caza se ha estropeado por la lluvia ¿podría decirnos usted si al menos podremos disparar algún tiro?
original English: Would you care to reveal then in light of this rain-drenched hunt whether any of us will be able to get off a shot?

original Spanish: Iré en los próximos días a Vogeloed... para poder conoceros en persona mis queridos amigos.
original English: In the days ahead I will come to Vogelöd to finally see all of you my dear friends face to face...

original Spanish: Su Reverencia el Padre Faramund acaba de anunciar su llegada para esta noche.
original English: His Reverence Father Faramund has just reported he'll be arriving this evening.

original Spanish: Él sabrá por qué quiere evitar estar aquí... cuando llegue su pariente el cura.
original English: Of course he would know to stay out of the way of his kin the Father!

original Spanish: Por favor excúseme por hoy.
original English: If you'll excuse me for the rest of the day

original Spanish: ¡No nadie salió por aquí!
original English: No! No-one left through here!

original Spanish: ¡Hemos mirado por todo el castillo!
original English: We've looked around the entire castle...!

original Spanish: ¡cometido por el Conde Oetsch!
original English: Maybe it was... Count Oetsch? !

original Spanish: Está actuando de esa manera para ocultar su culpa.
original English: He's putting on airs in order to conceal his latest crime.

original Spanish: Tendrá que disculparse por hacer bromas inoportunas... en presencia de los invitados.
original English: He needs to apologise to you in front of all the guests for his inappropriate jokes!

original Spanish: El Barón Safferstätt loco de amor por mí me entendió mal y eso trajo graves consecuencias...
original English: Baron Safferstätt consumed by passion for me had misunderstood me in a gruesome way! ...

original Spanish: ¡Unidos por la culpa!
original English: Bound through our guilt!

original Spanish: ¡Hemos de implorarle perdón por tantas cosas!
original English: We have much to apologise to you for!

original Spanish: El cuento "El castillo Vogeloed" de Rudolf Stratz... fue publicado por la editorial Ullstein.
original English: The story Schloss Vogelöd by Rudolf Stratz is published by Ullsteinbuch.

original Spanish: Novias elegidas para el mercado del matrimonio...
original English: Maidens chosen for the marriage market.

original Spanish: Una antigua costumbre en que las esposas eran obtenidas por los ricos hijos de Alá.
original English: An ancients custom by which. Wives are secured for the wealthy sons of Allah.

original Spanish: Zilah uno de los premios destinados por la lotería del matrimonio.
original English: Zilah one of the prizes destined for the marriage lottery. Ruth Miller

original Spanish: Un jefe de tribu protesta por la venta de su novia.
original English: A tribal chieftain protests the sale of his sweetheart. Youseef... George Waggener

original Spanish: Camino a los harenes de los ricos comerciantes para obedecer y servir como si se tratara de esclavas.
original English: On the way to the harems Of the rich merchants. To obey and serve like chattel slaves.

original Spanish: ¡La idea de Diana Mayo es un viaje por el desierto solo con conductores de camellos nativos y árabes!
original English: The idea of Diana Mayo planing a tour alone into the desert with only native camel-drivers and Arabs!

original Spanish: Mademoiselle estará desilusionada... el Casino solo está abierto para los árabes.
original English: Mademioselle will be disappointed- the Casino is closed to all except Arabs.

original Spanish: ¿Y por qué podría dejarnos fuera de un lugar público un salvaje bandido del desierto?
original English: And why should a savage desert bandit keep us out of any public place?

original Spanish: Es la mujer inglesa a la que tengo que guiar por el desierto mañana.
original English: It is the English woman whom I am to guide into the desert tomorrow.

original Spanish: Amanece... con el árabe atraído por el encanto de la desafiante chica inglesa.
original English: Dawn- with the Arab under the lure of the defiant English girl.

original Spanish: ¿No es lo bastante mujer para saberlo?
original English: Are you not woman enough to know?

original Spanish: Vístase para la cena.
original English: You will dress for dinner.

original Spanish: No la echarán de menos hasta que sea demasiado tarde  demasiado tarde para encontrarla. El desierto es un gran lugar para esconderse.
original English: You will not be missed until it is too late... too late for anyone to learn your whereabouts- the desert is a great hidingplace

original Spanish: En el monótono sopor de la desesperación por la mañana vuelve el deseo de vivir.
original English: Through the dull slumber of despair. Until morning tempts back. A desire to live.

original Spanish: ...que puedo por fin hacerte otra visita en el desierto.
original English: That I can at last make another visit to you in the desert.

original Spanish: ¿El pasado significa tan poco para ti que ahora robas mujeres blancas y les haces el amor como un salvaje?
original English: Does the past mean so little to you that you now steal white women and make love to them like a savage?

original Spanish: No tuve valor para enfrentarme al extranjero. ¡Oh Ahmed sé amable conmigo!
original English: I did not have the courage to face the stranger. Oh be kind to me Ahmed please!

original Spanish: Y la mujer paga por la belleza que Dios le ha dado.
original English: And the women pays for the beauty God has given her.

original Spanish: Será material interesante para su próximo libro.
original English: It will make interesting material for your next book.

original Spanish: Una razón más para que ella vuelva con los suyos.
original English: One more reason for restoring Mademoiselle to her people.

original Spanish: ¡La quieres para ti!
original English: You want her for yourself!

original Spanish: Su mano es tan grande para un árabe.
original English: His hands is so large an Arab.

original Spanish: Hace 25 años el viejo Caíd Ben Hassan encontró a los padres de Ahmed abandonados por su escolta...
original English: Twenty-five years ago the old Sheik Ben Hassan found Ahmed's mother and father deserted by their escort.

original Spanish: Creciendo como un árabe fue enviado a París para ser educado y a la muerte del Caíd volvió al desierto para asumir el liderazgo de la tribu.
original English: Growing to manhood as an Arab he was sent to Paris to be educated and upon the Sheik's death returned to the desert to assume leadership of the tribe.

original Spanish: Ruego a Dios que salve su vida. ¡Si Él aceptara cambiar mi vida por la suya!
original English: Pray God dear friend to save his life. Oh if He would only accept my life in exchange for his!

original Spanish: ...Quiere que telefonee al señor para avisarle de que su excelencia...
original English: ... He wants to phone you of his love Madam to let your Excellency ...

original Spanish: Es absolutamente necesario que hoy por la noche tenga un anillo igual a este!
original English: It is absolutely necessary that I get a ring like this one tonight!

original Spanish: Desgraciadamente tengo que salir por negocios... y no regresaré hasta mañana. Querida:
original English: Dear:

original Spanish: Desgraciadamente tengo que salir por negocios... y no regresaré hasta mañana. Querida:
original English: Dear:

original Spanish: Los nuevos huéspedes han de pagar la habitación por adelantado
original English: The new guest will pay for the room in advance

original Spanish: Puede mientras tanto esperar aquí por el sr. Krafft
original English: You may meanwhile wait here for Mr. Krafft

original Spanish: Es bonito hija. ¿Pero para qué todo esto?
original English: It's a beautiful my friend. But why all of this?

original Spanish: El sr. Krafft salió hace cosa de una hora pero dejó recado para que a las 10 horas tenga preparada una cena para dos.
original English: Mr. Krafft departed an hour but left instructions

original Spanish: Amo a mi marido por encima de todo Margot.
original English: I love my husband above all Margot.

original Spanish: Ahora me entusiasmas con tu verborrea y estoy ansiosa por saber ¿Y luego?
original English: And then?

original Spanish: Florence alegando una jaqueca se había retirado y su padre y yo inquietos por su estado subimos a su cuarto...
original English: Florence claiming to have a headache had withdrawn and her father and I anxious about her state went up to her room ...

original Spanish: Quiero un coche para dentro de cinco minutos.
original English: I want a car in five minutes.

original Spanish: De una vez por todas:
original English: Once and for all:

original Spanish: Esto tal vez baste para hacerla cambiar de opinión
original English: This may be enough to change your mind

original Spanish: Pero entonces esta carta era también para mi hermano Werner
original English: But then this letter was also for my brother Werner

original Spanish: Tengo una deuda para con el portador de esta carta.
original English: I am indebted to the bearer of this letter.

original Spanish: ¡Olvídala para siempre!
original English: Forget them forever!

original Spanish: ¡Su señora está amenazada por un gran peligro!
original English: Your lady is in great danger!

original Spanish: Pero... para mí la única persona que puede haber dado el cambiazo es aquel elegante Sr. Krafft...
original English: But ... As far as I know the only person who may have given me the fake Was the elegant Mr. Krafft ...

original Spanish: El Sr. Krafft pasó hace poco en automóvil para la calle del Jardín Zoológico 245
original English: Mr. Krafft left recently in a car for Zoological Garden Street 245

original Spanish: ¿Estás por aquí mi niño?
original English: Are you here my child?

original Spanish: ¡Mató por defender mi honor!
original English: He had to defend my honor!

original Spanish: Le traeré su coartada corroborada por el diario que tengo allí en la estufa
original English: He will bring his alibi corroborated by the newspaper that I have for him.

original Spanish: ¡Werner alabado sea Dios por traerte aquí!
original English: Werner thank God you are here!

original Spanish: Fue confeccionada por la Televisión checoslovaca Bratislava Redacción principal de los programas fílmicos 1975
original English: Produced by the Czechoslovak Television Bratislava Main Office of Film Programs 1975.

original Spanish: ! Está bien que el cura este aquí se ahorran gastos para el entierro!
original English: It is good the monk is here we can save on the funeral.

original Spanish: Perseguido por los esbirros seòoriales se escondió Jánošík en una cueva.
original English: They chase him so Jánošík hides in a cave.

original Spanish: Mama mía mama mía detrás de dos montaòas la cabeza me duele de llorar por Usted
original English: Oh mother mother dear A long way from here. I cry longing for you Want to be near.

original Spanish: He bosque arriba bosque abajo por un sendero arriba mi padre era bueno yo tengo que ser bandolero.
original English: Hey there's a grove up the way. There's a path up the way. My father was a good fellow.

original Spanish: Que todo nuestro trabajo sea para buena suerte de nuestro pueblo!
original English: Let the serfs benefit from all our doings!

original Spanish: Pero no no por qué ese daòo yo se lo compro!
original English: Oh no it would be much waste I shall buy it.

original Spanish: Creame compay por mi fe de hidalgo si estuviera la cosecha en la pajera yo la saldaría enseguida pero de este modo ?
original English: Believe me sir upon my squire word if the crop was in the barns I would pay you immediately.

original Spanish: Mire por lo general simplemente! ! Que cada campesino pague 50 piezas por cabeza!
original English: Each peasant will pay 5O pennies.

original Spanish: Si por casualidad alguien se opone será golpeado a latigazos y metido en el cepo!

original Spanish: ! Ya no tendrás que deslomarte en esta choza yo he venido por ti tú vendrás al castillo!
original English: You will not work hard in this cabin any more you will come with me to my manor-house.

original Spanish: Sin embargo por este daòo Jánošík les envía algunos ducatos a cada uno.
original English: Here Jánošík is sending you some ducats for the damage.

original Spanish: Si debiera sufrirse para que esos peones bandidescos nos ordenasen que deberiamos hacer y que no?
original English: Should we let these dirty bandits order us what to do and want not to do?

original Spanish: ? Bueno viejito no tienes el vino para el visitante?
original English: Well old man is there some wine for your guest?

original Spanish: ! He venido para una confesión!
original English: I came to confess.

original Spanish: ! Para que diga el paradero de ese bandolero!
original English: So she can tell me where the bandit is.

original Spanish: - puesto que el acusado culpado está y sus ya castigados compaòeros por muchos crimenes pesantes cometiendose de mentira bandolerismo sí y de muerte... se condena a la pena de muerte! - Sentencia...
original English: As the accused and his already punished companions are found guilty having been accused of many felonies:

original Spanish: Para que el castigo ese difiera de los castigos otros para advertencia de todos se castiga Jánošík a este castigo:
original English: Arson robbery and even murder he is sentenced to death! So as to warn others the punishment differs from others and Jánošík is sentenced to be hung by his left rib on a hook and quartered after his death!

original Spanish: Vivo por la costilla en el lado izquierdo a un gancho colgado será y despues de la muerte descuartizado será! ! El veredicto que sea ejecutado sin demora!
original English: Let the sentence be carried out without delay!

original Spanish: Así terminó Jánošík el primer luchador por la libertad y los derechos del pueblo eslovaco.
original English: Such was the death of Jánošík the first fighter for freedom of the Slovak people.

original Spanish: Pip las pocas personas que se preocupaban por su pequeña vida solitaria. Pip... Martin Herzberg.
original English: Pip by the few people who cared about his lonely little life.

original Spanish: - Anoche hicieron disparos de advertencia por un prisionero fugitivo.
original English: - Last night they fired warning shots for an escaped prisoner.

original Spanish: Como era de esperar los ojos de Pip se deslizaron maravillados por esa extraña habitación.
original English: - Get in there boy!

original Spanish: Tras jugar una hora Pip perdió repetidamente y se le permitió irse pero en la puerta se encontró con un hombre extraño que iba a significar mucho para él.
original English: Once they had played for an hour and Pip had been beggared repeatedly he was allowed to go but down at the gate he met a strange man who was to mean a great deal to him.

original Spanish: El único consuelo para la angustia de Pip era el noble Joe y sus momentos más pacíficos En las horas del crepúsculo se sentaban juntos en la pequeña posada del pueblo.
original English: The only comfort to Pip's distress was noble Joe and his most peaceful moments were the twilight hours when they sat together in the town's little inn.

original Spanish: - Una persona cuyo nombre nunca debes investigar hará algo inusual por Pip. - Me han depositado una gran suma de dinero ¡y con él
original English: - A person whose name you must never investigate will do something unusual for Pip.

original Spanish: Cuando Joe y el pequeño Pip aturdidos por la extraordinaria revelación del extraño se acercaron a la fragua vieron que algo había sucedido.
original English: When Joe and little Pip dazed by the stranger's extraordinary revelation approached the forge they saw that something had happened.

original Spanish: Joe oró a Dios por la vida de su esposa y se le permitió conservarla.
original English: Joe prayed to God for his wife's life and she was allowed to keep it.

original Spanish: Pero el espantoso golpe infligido en su cabeza por un criminal desconocido le había robado la mente.
original English: But the frightful blow inflicted on her head by an unknown criminal had robbed her of her mind.

original Spanish: Iré a Londres mañana de camino a Richmond donde me quedaré por el momento.
original English: I'm coming to London tomorrow on my way to Richmond where I shall stay for the present.

original Spanish: - - Hombre infantil ¿nunca serás más sabio que cuando quisiste besarme por primera vez?
original English: - You childish man will you never be wiser than when you first wanted to kiss me?

original Spanish: Ese día si bien fue alegre para Pip fue de tristeza para Joe y Biddy.
original English: This day while a day of joy for Pip was a day of sorrow for Joe and Biddy.

original Spanish: El débil sol de la señora Gargery se puso para siempre.
original English: As the sun rose Mrs. Gargery's faint sun set forever.

original Spanish: Suele deambular por aquí después del anochecer. Y me mira tan extraño...
original English: He often roams around here after dark and he looks at me so strangely!

original Spanish: -- ¡Pagaría lo que fuese para que echen a ese sinvergüenza de aquí!
original English: - I would pay whatever it takes to get that scoundrel driven away from here!

original Spanish: - Ay señor ¿no ves que lo estoy tomando por tonto que estoy tomando por tontos a todos menos a ti? - ¿También así te parezco ridícula Pip?
original English: - Good lord can't you see I'm making a fool of him that I'm making a fool of everybody except you.

original Spanish: ¡Me deportaron de por vida y hay pena de muerte por regresar!
original English: I was deported for life and there's a death penalty for returning!

original Spanish: ¡He viajado muchos miles de millas de mar tormentoso por ver a mi caballero!
original English: - I traveled many thousands of miles of stormy sea to see Pip my gentleman!

original Spanish: ¡Lo recogí para Pip quien le dio pan a un diablo miserable y lo apoyó!
original English: I collected it for Pip who gave a miserable devil a crust and stood by him!

original Spanish: Olvidé cómo era la gente pero tenía a mi caballero tenía algo por lo que vivir.
original English: I forgot what people looked like but I had my gentleman I had something to live for.

original Spanish: He ido a ver a la señorita Havisham por un recado importante. Saludos Pip.
original English: Have gone out to Miss Havisham on important errand.

original Spanish: Antes de ir a su reunión con el anónimo de la carta Pip fue a casa de la señorita Havisham para ver una vez más a la mujer que amaba con locura.
original English: Before Pip went to his lonely meeting with the threatening letter-writer he visited Miss Havisham to see once more the woman he madly loved.

original Spanish: --- ¡Por Dios! ¿Quién soy yo para comportarme con virtud?
original English: - Who am I for God's sake that I should behave virtuously!

original Spanish: Oró para que Dios bendijese a la que le había roto el corazón.
original English: He prayed for God to bless her who had broken his heart.

original Spanish: He ido a ver a la señorita Havisham por un recado importante.
original English: Have gone out to Miss Havisham on important errand. Regards Pip.

original Spanish: -- ¿No puedo hacer nada por ti querido Pip?
original English: - Can I do nothing for you dear Pip?

original Spanish: ¡Haré cualquier cosa por ti!
original English: I'll do anything for you!

original Spanish: Sin embargo Pip no podía ver más allá del mundo extraño que sufría por la fiebre.
original English: ...yet Pip couldn't see out from the strange world to which his fever had taken him.

original Spanish: Unos días después Pip estaba bien como para levantarse.
original English: A few days later Pip was well enough to get up.

original Spanish: Sé todo lo que has hecho por mí y tus buenas obras han dado tanto fruto que tú mismo...
original English: - I know all that you have done for me and your good deeds have borne so much fruit that you yourself

original Spanish: Hablaron durante mucho tiempo y cuando estuvieron de nuevo en la puerta donde de niños se habían visto por primera vez...
original English: They talked together for a long time and when they stood at the gate again where as children they had seen each other for the first time...

original Spanish: Antes de que te vayas de aquí por última vez te diré:
original English: - Before you leave here for the last time I will say to you:

original Spanish: Vaya Teodora ¿no querrás decir que dudarías en hacer una pequeña cosa como ésa por papá?
original English: Why Theodora you don't mean to say that you would   hesitate to do a little thing like that for dear papa?

original Spanish: Yo haría cualquier cosa por papá.
original English: Oh I'd do anything for dear papa.

original Spanish: Bueno no hay motivo por el que tú no puedas venir querida niña.
original English: Well there's no reason why you should not come dear girl.

original Spanish: ¿No fue una suerte para el atrevido enamorado que el corazón de la marquesa fuese tan cálido...
original English: Wasn't it fortunate for the bold lover that the heart   of the Marquise was as warm as her eyes were tender?

original Spanish: Te quiero demasiado como para hacerte infeliz.
original English: - I love you too much to make you unhappy.

original Spanish: Tal vez no pero significa mucho para mí sólo el verla.
original English: Perhaps not but it means so much to me just to see her.

original Spanish: Qué devoción Morella se atreve con una fiesta familiar para estar cerca de ti.
original English: What devotion Morella - he has braved a house party to be near you!

original Spanish: Voy a proporcionar los fondos para el viaje de Sir Lionel y estoy casi tentado de ir con él.
original English: I'm furnishing the funds for Sir Lionel's trip   and d'you know I'm half tempted to go with him.

original Spanish: Llévame contigo Josiah por favor no me dejes aquí sola.
original English: Take me with you Josiah - please don't leave me here alone.

original Spanish: Volveré por ti en cuanto nuestro nido de amor esté preparado.
original English: I'll return for you - just as soon as our love nest is ready.

original Spanish: Me desentendería de esta absurda representación de los disfraces y todo eso si no fuera por la perspectiva de tomar a la atractiva Teodora en mis brazos.
original English: I'd chuck this pageant rot - dressing up and all that   except for the prospect of holding the alluring Theodora in my arms.

original Spanish: ¿Entonces por qué luchar por qué sufrir más?
original English: Then why struggle - why suffer more?

original Spanish: Nos hemos dicho adiós y yo dejo Inglaterra por una larga temporada.
original English: We have said good-bye and I am leaving England for a long time.

original Spanish: ¿Qué le hizo cambiar de idea para irse a ese peligroso viaje?
original English: What made him change his mind and go on this dangerous trip?

original Spanish: Oh Héctor pretende sacrificarse por nosotros ¡debemos detenerle! .
original English: Oh Hector he means to sacrifice himself for us - we must stop him!

original Spanish: Telegrafía a tu padre para que se una a nosotros.
original English: Wire your father to join us -

original English: A most interesting find - an account of the punishment   meted out by the ancient Egyptians to an unfaithful wife.

original Spanish: ...a escuchar la leyenda del Campo del Diablo por enésima vez?
original English: To hear the story of Devil's Field for the umpteenth time?

original English: By night ten horses were not enough to make me move in front of the damned chapel.

original Spanish: Todo aquel que pasa por allí se santigua.
original English: And whatever happens there you make the sign of the cross.

original Spanish: Cuida de Johannes para ser granjero es demasiado ambicioso.
original English: As to Johannes you are too ambitious to be a peasant.

original English: Don't you think Gerda that your bridegroom will have resentment about your quotidian exits with Johannes?

original English: If this performance is taken care of in 24 hours we will be ready to bargain with you.

original Spanish: Es poco probable que alguien de por aquí quiera comprar el Campo del Diablo.

original Spanish: Por la presente certifico vender al Sr. Peter Rog mi terreno llamado 'Campo del Diablo' por la suma de 12.000 marcos.
original English: I bear witness by this means having sold my lot called the Devil's Field to Peter Rog for the sum of twelve thousand marks.

original Spanish: Le vendí el Campo del Diablo a Peter por doce mil marcos.
original English: I have sold Devil's Field for twelve thousand marks to Peter!

original Spanish: ¡Has vendido por una miseria un terreno que vale millones!
original English: You have sold for 4 bitches a lot worth a million!

original Spanish: Te lo suplico Peter por el amor de Dios toma tu dinero y devuélveme el contrato.
original English: I beg you Peter for God's sake take the money and return the contract to me.

original Spanish: Después habrá tiempo de sobra para hablar.
original English: We'll talk later.

original Spanish: ¡Este hombre tiene que lidiar con su conciencia por lo sucedido!
original English: This man must examine his conscience.

original Spanish: Tu habitación siempre estuvo lista para ti.
original English: Your room was always prepared.

original English: Justice is the means by which established injustices are sanctioned.

original English: The carts of the gardeners loaded with fruits and vegetables begin to file into Paris.

original Spanish: Se dirigen hacia el Mercado Central pasando por los barrios residenciales donde duerme el honesto ciudadano.
original English: They make their way towards the Central Market passing through the residential quarters where the honest citizen sleeps.

original English: They roll on through the fashionable areas where people are just now thinking about getting home to bed.

original Spanish: Continúan por los barrios de mala reputación donde la gente vive más de noche que de día.
original English: They continue through the disreputable neighbourhoods where people live more by night than by day.

original English: But she was a well-mannered person respected by her concierge.

original Spanish: ...y por la noche duermo en una tienda que está de reformas.
original English: ...and at night I sleep in a shop under renovation.

original English: I think the way you systematically deny everything is incredibly inept.

original English: Summons to appear in court

original Spanish: Su majestad la justicia está presente en toda sentencia pronunciada por el juez en nombre del pueblo soberano". Anatole France
original English: The majesty of justice is entirely contained in each sentence pronounced by the judge in the name of the sovereign people.

original Spanish: Aunque Crainquebille estaba firmemente convencido de su inocencia estaba aterrorizado y por lo tanto no podía ver las cosas con claridad.
original English: Though firmly convinced of his innocence Crainquebille was terrified and thus unable to see things clearly.

original Spanish: Yo ya trabajaba para ganarme la vida cuando tenía 14 años.
original English: I was working for a living by the time I was fourteen.

original Spanish: Ven Uds. aquí a un hombre entumecido por 60 años de pobreza.
original English: You see here a man numbed by sixty years of poverty.

original English: A benevolent person who's concerned about you asked me to give you one hundred francs which I deposited with the court clerk.
