original English: I agreed under false pretenses to sound out Miss Carozza in prison. I thought that I would find the paid tout of a notorious criminal -- only to find a woman full of love before whose simple and unconditional feelings...

original Spanish: No sirvo para ser su aliada.
original English: I am not suitable to be your ally

original Spanish: Perdóneme por tener que decepcionarle...
original English: Please forgive me if for that reason I have to disappoint you

original Spanish: No sivo para ser su aliada.
original English: I am not suitable to be your ally

original Spanish: Perdóneme por tener que decepcionarle...
original English: Please forgive me if for that reason I have to disappoint you.

original Spanish: A partir de hoy no estoy para nadie ni personalmente ni por teléfono.
original English: As from today I am not available to anyone neither personally nor by telephone

original Spanish: A partir de hoy no estoy para nadie ni personalmente ni por teléfono.
original English: As from today I am not available to anyone neither personally nor by telephone

original Spanish: A los que pregunten por mí o por la condesa les dice que estamos de viaje por tiempo indefinido.
original English: Tell everybody asking for me or the Countess that we have gone away for an indefinite time!

original Spanish: Si por una maldita casualidad alguien me descubre huiré por este pasadizo.
original English: If by some damned coincidence they got on my track I'll get away through this tunnel.

original Spanish: ¡Desde abajo basta con un dedo para levantar la puerta!
original English: From underneath a gentle push will lift the door!

original Spanish: Se está sacrificando por un canalla que la deja abandonada...
original English: You are sacrificing yourself for a scoundrel who has simply abandoned you

original Spanish: Y se está sacrificando por nada porque ya estamos sobre su pista.
original English: -- and in vain -- for we are already on his tail!

original Spanish: Usted está aquí por un hombre que la ha arrojado de su lado...
original English: The man for whose sake you are here has thrown you away like a squeezed fruit.

original Spanish: Sabe perfectamente que su cabeza está en juego... y no mueve un dedo por salvarla...
original English: He knows very well that it might cost you your head - and he does not lift a finger to help you--

original Spanish: ¡Hay que ir por un camino diferente al habitual!
original English: You should go down a road different from usual !

original Spanish: ¡Johannes Gutter ha trabajado toda su vida por nuestras cosas!
original English: All his life Johannes Gutter has devoted himself to our just cause!

original Spanish: ¡No van por el camino habitual!
original English: They are not taking the usual route!

original Spanish: ¡Van por la calle Miller!
original English: They are going through Mueller Street!

original Spanish: Por última vez condesa ¿me seguirá por propia voluntad... o como prisionera?
original English: For the last time Countess will you follow me of your free will -- or as a prisoner?

original Spanish: ¿Y por qué me dijo por teléfono que los señores estaban de viaje?
original English: hen why did you tell me on the telephone that the Master and Mistress had gone away?

original Spanish: El caso de Told es tan insólito desde el principio hasta el final que estoy convencido de que el conde actuaba tanto al hacer trampas como al cometer suicidio obligado por una voluntad sumamente poderosa y enemiga.
original English: The case of Count Told is so unusual from beginning to end that I have become convinced that both as card-cheat and as suicide the Count acted under the compulsion of some overpowering but to him hostile mind!

original Spanish: Si va se convencerá por sus propios ojos de que gracias a su inaudita habilidad para sugestionar Weltmann es capaz de obligar a las personas a que actúen de un modo totalmente opuesto a su esencia natural...
original English: You would there see with your own eyes how Weltmann due to his tremendous suggestive powers is able to compel people to act in a way diametrically opposite to their nature ... ...

original Spanish: Si va se convencerá por sus propios ojos de que gracias a su inaudita habilidad para sugestionar Weltmann es capaz de obligar a las personas a que actúen de un modo totalmente opuesto a su esencia natural...
original English: You would there see with your own eyes how Weltmann due to his tremendous suggestive powers is able to compel people to act in a way diametrically opposite to their nature ... ...

original Spanish: Después vuelves aquí por el camino más rápido.
original English: Then you come back here as quickly as possible!

original Spanish: Y eso para ustedes significa que deberán actuar por iniciativa propia...
original English: That means you'll just have to act on your own initiative--

original English: You conduct the lady to her seat leave the auditorium get into the car number 3825 waiting outside the door and drive at full speed over the mountain road into the quarry. Melior!

original English: But to me!

original English: One who is at the point of pining away... mocked harassed abused by tortures which...

original Spanish: La incomprendida no derrama ni una lagrima por su esposo inexperto en el amor!
original English: The misunderstood woman weeps not for the husband inexperienced in love!

original Spanish: Salen del cuarto estrecho para entrar en la mistica del gran saln...
original English: Out of cramped rooms into wide mystic spaces...

original Spanish: Cuando penetran danzando por la ventana.
original English: Through open windows it came in dancing.

original Spanish: Y tuve que salir sacudido por fiebres a las calles desiertas.
original English: And I had to leave tossed by a fever out into lonely lanes.

original Spanish: la he donado para la eternidad a la ciudad.
original English: as a donation I left it for perpetuity to the city.

original Spanish: Pase a caballo por delante del ayuntamiento cuando salian hacia algun convite o festividad de la ciudad los padres en aureas carrozas.
original English: I came past the town hall when the city elders drove up in their coaches for some festivity.

original Spanish: expresaros nuestra gratitud y grata sorpresa por esta excelsa reunin.
original English: want to bring to you the gratitude and the joyful amazement of the noble assembly.

original Spanish: No habria valido la pena por una mirada mia?
original English: A glance from my eyes isn't it worth it for you?

original Spanish: Gustosamente ofreceria mi vida por vos mas...
original English: I'd gladly give my life for you yet...

original Spanish: Sois tan alto corpulento y fuerte mucho mas alto que yo... He de estirarme ved slo para miraros a esos ojos tan seguros de vencer.
original English: You are so great so mighty and strong so far above me... I have to stretch myself look just to look into your eyes oh so sure of victory.

original Spanish: Y me gustaria veros enjuto bajo y pobre muy por debajo de mi cerca de mis pies...
original English: And I'd like to see you small and low and poor far beneath me reachable to my feet...

original Spanish: Y yo amo el alma que lucha y se afana se sacrifica y sufre por un sueldo de amor.
original English: I love the soul that fights and struggles that sacrifices itself and suffers for love's reward.

original Spanish: Debeis tomarme por un torpe inexperto ingenuo y tonto.
original English: You must take me for a dolt ignorant of life naive and silly.

original Spanish: Ved y... por mucho que cavilara y me afanara reaparecia una y otra vez.
original English: Look there... and ponder and try as I would it appeared again and again.

original Spanish: Cuando creia haberla desterrado por siempre de improviso reaparecia surgia del pincel con insidia
original English: Already I thought it gone and banished for ever. There all of a sudden insidiously it crept out of the brushes and took root!

original Spanish: Tal vez de bufn en un retrato entre bellos hombres y mujeres un contraste efectivo con un sombrerete de cascabeles la joroba iria bien con el sarcasmo de la gente inmortalizado para siempre!
original English: Perhaps as a fool in a painting among pretty men and women an effective contrast with a fool's cap the hump would fit in quite well for the people to jeer at for all time!

original Spanish: tengo una casita por estudio.
original English: there I have a cottage for a studio.

original Spanish: se me antoja la hora mas idnea para trabajar.
original English: then to me it seems the right time for work.

original Spanish: Delante de mi casita pasa un camino bordeado por altos cipreses.
original English: A road goes past my cottage lined by tall cypresses.

original Spanish: Querreis venir a mi taller para que pueda completar el cuadro?
original English: Will you come to my studio so that I can complete the painting?

original Spanish: Por un lado seria una alegria para el pueblo genoves por otro la nobleza habria de lamentar la perdida de unas tierras tan valiosas.
original English: On the one hand it would be welcome for the people of Genoa on the other hand the aristocracy would regret if it were to lose a valuable property.

original Spanish: Por un lado seria una alegria para el pueblo genoves por otro la nobleza habria de lamentar la perdida de unas tierras tan valiosas.
original English: On the one hand it would be welcome for the people of Genoa on the other hand the aristocracy would regret if it were to lose a valuable property.

original Spanish: Con esto la ha ganado por asalto.
original English: Now he has taken her by storm.

original Spanish: amado adorado por las mujeres dispuesto siempre a las mas insensatas travesuras.
original English: beloved idolized by the women constantly in the mood for the most incredible pranks.

original Spanish: Cuando le hable por primera vez creo que no acabe de entenderla.
original English: When I spoke to her the first time I think I did not understand her right.

original Spanish: Palabras inconexas enloquecido por el instante me esforce por averiguar descifrar segun las normas que rigen los usos de la corte.
original English: a lot of nonsense madness born at that moment I tried to understand to interpret following the rules of courtly manners.

original Spanish: Cabalgue por la ciudad ensonado daba forma al cortejo y vi cmo la bella dichosa se ruborizaba aturdida y emocionada por tan alto honor!
original English: And I rode through the town and lost in dreams I drew up the courting and I saw the beauty flush happily stunned and moved by the honour!

original Spanish: Mas por ocultar mi corazn medroso me las di de orgulloso aspero y arrogante le hable del sacrificio que le ofrecia pero que la mutilacin o la muerte...
original English: But to guard timid heart I behaved haughtily arrogant and gruffly I talked about the sacrifice I would make for her more evil than self-mutilation and death...

original Spanish: Te prevendria por muchas razones si no supiera que seria inutil y que odioso es el que advierte a un amante desdichado.
original English: I'd like to warn you for some reasons but I know the futility of such an action and how he who warns is detested by him who loves unfortunately.

original Spanish: Ah si pudieras... Abogare por ti.
original English: Ah if you could... I will court for you.

original Spanish: Mis amigos me enviaron a ti para pedirte que impidas que la isla de Alviano
original English: My friends sent me to appeal to you: you may prevent that Alviano's island Elysium

original Spanish: Magnificas estancias subterraneas creadas ex profeso para celebrar el amor
original English: On that island an artificial grotto makes wonderful rooms accessible

original Spanish: Salvago cercenara sus ansias de generosidad por mucho tiempo.
original English: Salvago ought to restrain his urge for donation for a long time.

original Spanish: Habladme de vuestra juventud o de la razn que hoy enturbia o enoja vuestro animo... o bien por que vuestra mirada rehuye temerosa la mia!
original English: Tell me of your youth or why you are so gloomy and in such a bad mood today... or rather why your eyes so fearfully evade mine.

original Spanish: Os ruego por lo que mas querais no me guardeis rencor!
original English: I implore you don't be angry with me!

original Spanish: Sois un hombre que carece por completo de autoestima.
original English: You are a man and totally without any self-confidence.

original Spanish: Tan impensable es que una mujer sienta verdadero afecto y amistad por vos?
original English: is it so unthinkable that a woman should find herself in love and friendship for you?

original Spanish: En este vasto mundo entre tantas almas palpitantes no habria de hallarse una que sintiese amor por vos?
original English: Should there be on this earth among millions of beating hearts not to be found one that strives for you in love?

original Spanish: Por mi... por alguien que se odia y huye de si mismo que ha desterrado los espejos de todas sus estancias!
original English: For me... me who hates himself who flees from himself who banished the mirrors out of his rooms!

original Spanish: En dias soleados nunca saliais triste y compungido sin que supieras por que?
original English: Did you never go out on a sunny day gloomy and sad without knowing why?

original Spanish: Necesito esa mirada para mi cuadro.
original English: I need your eyes for my painting.

original Spanish: Desde ayer oigo voces por doquier.
original English: Since yesterday I have been hearing voices everywhere.

original Spanish: Cuando ayer os di mi  para el conde Vitelozzo me sentia grande y fuerte y dichosa.
original English: Yesterday when I answered you ""No"" for Count Vitelozzo I felt proud and secure grand and joyful.

original Spanish: Como si hubiera tomado un vino fuerte y mezclado con hierbas que hechizaran los sentidos o aquel extrano brebaje hervido de sangre de un corazn de mujer enloquecida por amor!
original English: As if I had drunk wine heavy and mixed with enchanting herbs or that strange drink brewed with the blood from the heart of a love-stricken virgin!

original Spanish: No es el hombre noble por el que lo teneis.
original English: He is not the noble man you think he is.

original Spanish: Se halla poseido por viles apetitos y aun hoy lo asalta... No quiero oirlo.
original English: He is obsessed by evil desire and today it befalls him... I won't hear anything.

original Spanish: Llega de las cuevas de las simas multiplicada por mil!
original English: It resounds to me from heights and chasms a thousand times!

original Spanish: Sera devastada por el fuego por ser un semillero del vicio y del pecado demoniaco.
original English: It shall be devastated by fire as a breeding ground of vices and devilish sin.

original Spanish: Ya lo veis esta poseido por su boca habla el demonio!
original English: You see he is obsessed the demon speaks through him!

original Spanish: Ginebra raptada por el conde Vitelozzo?
original English: Count Vitelozzo kidnapped Ginevra?

original Spanish: Y mira para mi ha significado mucho.
original English: And see for me it meant so much.

original Spanish: La he raptado tomado por la fuerza  no lo pude evitar porque la amaba...
original English: l kidnapped her I took her by force

original Spanish: tendre que odiarte y maldecirte por haberle a un infeliz como yo destruido quitado todo lo que tenia.
original English: l couldn't do otherwise because I loved her..."" then I must hate you I must curse you since you took from a miserable one like me what he possessed and you destroyed it.

original Spanish: Esa mujer se me rindi desde el dia en que la vi por primera vez segun las palabras que tu mismo Alviano pronunciaste:
original English: this woman became a slave to me from the first day I saw her Alviano according to your saying once

original Spanish: Atrozmente marcado por el destino te viste aliquebrado cautivo acobardado.
original English: Too bitterly branded for life you became by fate broken-winged inhibited self-conscious.

original Spanish: Pues yo veo profundidades insospechadas para ti porque soy un ser humano. Y tu que eres?
original English: Because I look into depths you can't even imagine since I am a man and you?

original Spanish: Vivir sin alegria consumirse lentamente o una muerte en el delirio y la transfiguracin morir dichoso embriagado por la pasin!
original English: a joyless life a gradually wasting away or a death in rapture and transfiguration in passionate embrace a blissful dying!

original Spanish: Por la fotografía estoy agradecido al Sr. Johan Ankerstjerne y al Sr. Richard Louw por la dirección artística.
original English: For the photography I am grateful to Mr. Johan Ankerstjerne and to Mr. Richard Louw for the art direction.

original Spanish: Los antiguos egipcios creían que altas montañas rodeaban la tierra y los océanos por todas partes.
original English: The ancient Egyptians believed that high mountains surrounded land and water on all sides.

original Spanish: El cielo estaba hecho de acero y soportado por fuertes pilares que se apoyaban en las altas montañas.
original English: The sky was made of steel and supported by strong pillars that stood on the high mountains.

original Spanish: De acuerdo con las creencias de otras civilizaciones antiguas el cielo era una bóveda y la Tierra estaba formada por terrazas.
original English: According to the beliefs of other ancient civilizations the sky was vaulted and the earth shaped into terraces.

original Spanish: Los espíritus malignos de las épocas antiguas se transformaron en el folklore medieval en demonios husmeando por ahí y tentando a los niños.
original English: The evil spirits of ancient times changed in the medieval folklore to devils sneaking around and tempting children.

original Spanish: Y fuera de las esferas planetarias estaban las estrellas fijas distribuidas en un cielo para ellas.
original English: And outside the planetary spheres were the fixed stars arranged in a sky of their own.

original Spanish: En lo más profundo del corazón de la Tierra se hallaba el Infierno dónde aquellos tentados por el Diablo sufrirán para siempre.
original English: Deep down in the earth's core lies Hell where those tempted by the Devil shall suffer forever.

original Spanish: En lo más profundo del corazón de la Tierra se hallaba el Infierno dónde aquellos tentados por el Diablo sufrirán para siempre.
original English: Deep down in the earth's core lies Hell where those tempted by the Devil shall suffer forever.

original Spanish: Un demonio vierte rezumando con un cuerno el repulsivo azufre por la garganta de un hombre.
original English: A devil pours the nasty sulfur oozing from a horn down a man's throat.

original Spanish: He encontrado una extraña y antigua representación mecánica del Infierno que sirve para comprender bien las creencias en la Edad Media.
original English: I have found a strange old mechanical presentation of Hell which offers a good understanding of the beliefs in the Middle Ages.

original Spanish: Se pensaba que las brujas habían firmado un pacto ilegítimo con el Diablo y por tanto eran quemadas en la hoguera.
original English: Witches were thought to have signed an unlawful pact with the Devil and therefore they were burned at the stake.

original Spanish: La figura flotante es un demonio que viene a coger a la bruja levantándola por los aires.
original English: The floating figure is a devil coming to get the witch by lifting her up into the air.

original Spanish: Y tras el encuentro podían por ejemplo entrar a escondidas en un granero y embrujar una vaca.
original English: And after the gathering they might for instance sneak into a barn and bewitch a cow.

original Spanish: Se creía que la bruja estaba desnuda cuando por la noche durante el llamado Sabbath de las brujas danzaba con los demonios.
original English: It was a general belief that the witch was naked when at night during the so-called Witch Sabbath she danced with the devils.

original Spanish: La brujería del ungüento les permitiría volar por el aire.
original English: The witchcraft of the ointment would allow them to fly through the air.

original Spanish: Deprisa ábreme Karna para que no me vea la gente.
original English: Hurry and open up Karna so that the passers-by won't see me.

original Spanish: Oh Santa Madre perdónanos por abrir el cuerpo de un cadáver con un cuchillo!
original English: Oh Holy Mother forgive us for cutting open a person's dead body with a knife!

original Spanish: No pecamos gravemente por una inoportuna curiosidad
original English: lt is not from untimely curiosity that we so badly sin...

original Spanish: La paz del cementerio ha sido profanada por dos brujas.
original English: The peace of the cemetery has been desecrated by two witches.

original Spanish: Y por ello las cosas más inusuales se tomaban como verdad.
original English: And that is why unusual things were believed to be true.

original Spanish: No te vas a tumbar aquí para hechizar las piernas de la gente honesta.
original English: You shall not lie here and bewitch the legs of honest people.

original Spanish: ¿Es por el miedo atávico a la hogurera por lo que te emborrachas cada noche pobre vieja de la Edad Media?
original English: Is it from the eternal fright of the pyre that you get drunk every night you poor old woman of the Middle Ages?

original Spanish: Cuando la campana de la tarde resuena en la noche y todas las hogueras de la ciudad están cubiertas con cenizas el Diablo va a buscar a Apelone para sus aventuras.
original English: When the evening bell tolls in the night and all fires in town are covered with ashes the Devil fetches Apelone for his adventures.

original Spanish: Una mujer sospechosa de brujería es lanzada al agua para averiguar si es culpable o no.
original English: A woman suspected of witchcraft is thrown into the water to find out whether she is guilty or not.

original Spanish: Dos verdugos usan remos para mover a la acusada en el agua hacia donde no haga pie.
original English: Two executioners use oars to move the accused in the water where she has no support.

original Spanish: Si se hunde los jueces darán gracias a Dios por su inocencia.
original English: If she sinks the judges thank God for her innocence.

original Spanish: Ilustraré un juicio por brujería de principio a fin que tuvo lugar en la época en la que el Papa envió curas de la Inquisición a Alemania.
original English: I will now illustrate a trial for witchcraft from beginning to end taking place at the time when the Pope sent traveling inquisition priests out to Germany.

original Spanish: ¡Oh doncella por favor ten piedad de mí una pobre mujer que tiene que mendigar de puerta en puerta!
original English: Oh maiden please have mercy on me a poor woman who has to go begging from door to door!

original Spanish: ¡Juro por la Cruz que no sois enemigos mortales!
original English: Swear by the cross that you are not deadly enemies!

original Spanish: Las noches de la sospechosa ahora son dictadas por los jueces.
original English: The suspect's nights are now dictated by the inquisition judges.

original Spanish: Dos hombres honorables intentan amablemente persuadirla para que confiese.
original English: Two honorable men try amiably to persuade her to confess.

original Spanish: Se situa a la acusada de espaldas en la cámara de tortura para que no hechice al juez cuando entra.
original English: The accused is taken backwards into the torture chamber so as not to bewitch the judge when entering.

original Spanish: Pregunto por última vez:
original English: For the last time I ask:

original Spanish: Que empiece a sufrir para poner fin a la dureza de su corazón.
original English: Let her suffering begin so that we might put an end to the harshness of her heart.

original Spanish: Confieso que he dado a luz a muchos niños engendrados por el Diablo.
original English: I confess that I've given birth to many children fathered by the Devil.

original Spanish: Y más de una mujer que no había realizado suficientes males fue tratada miserablemente por el Diablo.
original English: And many a woman who had not accomplished enough evil deeds was treated miserably by the Devil.

original Spanish: Y una comida de sapos y niños sin bautizar fue preparada por Karna.
original English: And a meal of toads and unchristened children was cooked by Karna.

original Spanish: Ella pasó por la puerta de Martin el Escritor con su hermana una noche de luna llena.
original English: She passed Martin the Writer's door one moonlit night with her sister.

original Spanish: Una bruja aparece en su celda para tentarle.
original English: A witch appears in his cell to tempt him.

original Spanish: Y le ha agarrado por la muñeca.
original English: And she has grabbed him by the wrist.

original Spanish: ¿Conoces el castigo para aquéllos que se niegan a dar testimonio contra una bruja?
original English: You know the punishment for those who refuse to witness against a witch?

original Spanish: Mire está llorando por lo tanto no puede ser una hechicera.
original English: Look she cries hence she cannot be a sorceress.

original Spanish: ¡Muchacho estúpido! ¿No sabes que las brujas se untan en secreto con saliva para que creamos que son lágrimas?
original English: Don't you know that witches secretly smear themselves with spittle so that we might believe it to be tears?

original Spanish: como ejemplo para los hombres como dulce aroma para Dios.
original English: as edification for man as sweet scent for God.

original Spanish: En unos pocos siglos más de ocho millones de mujeres hombres y niños fueron quemados por brujería.
original English: In the arc of a few centuries over 8 million women men and children were burned as witches.

original Spanish: Muchas mujeres por ejemplo confiesan que transformadas en gatos ensuciaban el altar durante la noche mientras dos diablos con forma de animales montaban guardia en la puerta de la iglesia.
original English: Many women for instance confess that - transformed into cats - they soiled the altar during the night while two devils in the shape of animals stood guard at the church door.

original Spanish: El Doctor Regnard muestra otra imagen que habla por sí misma...
original English: Doctor Regnard shows another picture which speaks for itself.

original Spanish: el retuerce-pulgares por ejemplo.
original English: the thumbscrew for example.

original Spanish: No revelaré las terribles confesiones que saqué por la fuerza a la joven en menos de un minuto.
original English: I will not reveal the terrible confessions I forced from the young lady in less than a minute.

original Spanish: La mayoria de las brujas de la antiguedad eran mujeres pobres aquellas que hoy en día son aceptadas por organizaciones pías y asilos.
original English: The majority of witches in the old days were poor women; those who are taken in by pious organizations and nursing homes nowadays.

original Spanish: Cualquier rasgo que pudiera hacer a una anciana diferente era suficiente para llevarla a la corte en la epoca de la brujería.
original English: One or more traits that might make an old woman noticeable was enough to bring her to court during the witchcraft era.

original Spanish: Como una bruja poseída por el Diablo esta mujer tanto dormida como despierta... cede a un misterioso deseo de encender cerrillas.
original English: Like a witch forced by the devil this woman   both when sleeping and awake - gives way to a mysterious craving to strike matches.

original Spanish: ¿No hay nada brujesco en esta sonámbula que se mueve por la aletargada casa con sus cerillas?
original English: Isn't there something "witch-like" with this sleepwalker who moves through the slumbering household with her matches?

original Spanish: ¿No nos recuerda a la monja que pasea por la capilla con su cuchillo forzada por el Diablo?
original English: Doesn't she remind us of the nun who walks through the chapel with her knife forced by the Devil?

original Spanish: Recordemos por ejemplo que la bruja recibía visitas nocturnas del Diablo.
original English: We remember for instance that the witch received nightly visitations by the Devil.

original Spanish: Y la mujercita a la que llamamos histérica sola y triste ¿no es aún un misterio para nosotros?
original English: And the little woman whom we call hysterical alone and unhappy isn't she still a riddle for us?

original Spanish: Consecuencias infernales de una bomba lanzada por anarquistas en la sala del Comité de Moscú del Partido Comunista Ruso.
original English: Hellish consequences of a bomb thrown by anarchists in the hall of the Moscow committee of the Russian Communist Party.

original Spanish: Desarme de anarquistas en Moscú por Las tropas soviéticas. 11/12 de abril 1918.
original English: Disarmament of Moscow anarchists by Soviet troops. April 11/12 1918.

original Spanish: Defensores del poder soviético son enviados por el cuartel general de emergencias a lugares tomados por los anarquistas.
original English: Defenders of Soviet power are dispatched by emergency headquarters to locations taken over by anarchists.

original Spanish: Se requirióde tropas montadas para aislar el área donde los anarquistas estaban ocultos.
original English: Mounted troops were called in to block the area where the anarchists were hiding.

original Spanish: Un camión blindado equipado con ametralladoras y cañones de 76 mm Fue enviado para ayudar a la infantería.
original English: An armored truck equipped with machine guns and 76mm cannons is sent to help the infantry.

original Spanish: Las tropas soviéticas dieron un ultimátum a los anarquistas para que se rindieran.
original English: Soviet troops gave the anarchists an ultimatum to surrender.

original Spanish: Las unidades de voluntarios que surgieron al comienzo de la Guerra Civil Fueron siempre una gran ayuda para un Ejército Rojo joven y aún no endurecido por la batalla que libra contra los ataques enemigos.
original English: The volunteer units that emerged at the beginning of the Civil War supported by the center provided assistance to a young and not yet hardened Red Army for battle fighting against enemy attacks.

original Spanish: Las unidades de voluntarios que surgieron al comienzo de la Guerra Civil Fueron siempre una gran ayuda para un Ejército Rojo joven y aún no endurecido por la batalla que libra contra los ataques enemigos.
original English: The volunteer units that emerged at the beginning of the Civil War supported by the center provided assistance to a young and not yet hardened Red Army for battle fighting against enemy attacks.

original Spanish: El envío de una unidad del partido tras las líneas checas mandada por el camarada Kozhevnikov y bajo la autoridad del Comité Ejecutivo Central de todas las Rusias.
original English: The expedition of a partisan unit behind Czechoslovak lines headed by Comrade Kozhevnikov under the authority of the All-Russian Central Executive Committee.

original Spanish: La presentación de una pancarta para una unidad militar del partido.
original English: The presentation of a banner to a departing military unit.

original Spanish: La expedición sale por la noche.
original English: The expedition leaves at night.

original Spanish: Una unidad militar frente a un pueblo ocupado por el enemigo.
original English: A military unit in front of an enemy-occupied village.

original Spanish: Después de que los checos fueran derrotados por las tropas rojas las unidades del partido del camarada Kozhevnikov son redistribuidas por el Don donde formarán una unidad especial .
original English: After the Czechoslovaks were defeated by the Red troops Comrade Kozhevnikov's partisan units are redeployed to the Don where they formed a special unit.

original Spanish: Rodeado y desarmado por la unidad budennyi fue enviado a Balashov para ser juzgado.
original English: Surrounded and disarmed by the Budenny unit he was sent to Balashov for trial.

original Spanish: Rodeado y desarmado por la unidad budennyi fue enviado a Balashov para ser juzgado.
original English: Surrounded and disarmed by the Budenny unit he was sent to Balashov for trial.

original Spanish: El Tribunal Extraordinario para el caso Mironov.
original English: The Extraordinary Court for the Mironov case.

original Spanish: Las explicaciones dadas por el acusado Mironov.
original English: The explanations given by the accused Mironov.

original Spanish: Mironov condenado a muerte por el Tribunal Extraordinario fue perdonado por una orden especial del Comité Ejecutivo Central de Rusia debido a sus importantes servicios anteriores a la Revolución.
original English: Mironov sentenced to death by the Extraordinary Court was pardoned by a special order of the Central Executive Committee of Russia due to his significant service prior to the Revolution.

original Spanish: Casas dañadas por el bombardeo.
original English: Houses damaged by bombing.

original Spanish: El barco checoslovaco "Labour" dañado por la artillería soviética.
original English: The Czechoslovak ship "Labour" damaged by Soviet artillery.

original Spanish: Quién cayó en los puestos revolucionarios será recordado para siempre.
original English: Those who fell in revolutionary positions will be remembered forever.

original Spanish: Las fábricas pronto se reabren en las áreas ocupadas por fuerzas rojas.
original English: Factories are soon reopened in areas occupied by red forces.

original Spanish: El ataque es apoyado por el tren blindado " Camarada Sverdlov" y grupos de campo.
original English: The attack is supported by the armored train"Comrade Sverdlov"and field groups.

original Spanish: Estación de Vladislavskaia destruida por los royectiles de 12" de barcos aliados .
original English: Vladislavskaia station destroyed by 12" shells from Allied ships.

original Spanish: El trabajo de los ejércitos para restaurar el puente volado sobre el río Kuban.
original English: The work of armies to restore the blown-up bridge across the Kuban River.

original Spanish: Trofeos incautados por las unidades rojas.
original English: Trophies seized by red units.

original Spanish: Además por una resolución del Ejecutivo Central de la Nación Rusa el tren "Cosaco Rojo" partió para realizar su trabajo de propaganda en Kuban.
original English: In addition to a resolution of the Central Executive Committee of the Russian Nation the  train "Red Cossack"left for its propaganda work in Kuban.

original Spanish: Además por una resolución del Ejecutivo Central de la Nación Rusa el tren "Cosaco Rojo" partió para realizar su trabajo de propaganda en Kuban.
original English: In addition to a resolution of the Central Executive Committee of the Russian Nation the  train "Red Cossack"left for its propaganda work in Kuban.

original Spanish: Preparativos para un ataque a Vrangel en el Frente Sur.
original English: Preparations for an attack against Vrangel on the Southern Front.

original Spanish: El final victorioso de la Guerra Civil condujo a una tentativa desesperada de rebelión. por los contrarrevolucionarios de Kronstadt.
original English: The victorious end of the Civil War led to a desperate attempt at rebellion by the Kronstadt counter-revolutionaries.

original Spanish: Las puertas de Petersburgo por donde las fuerzas rojas irrumpiran en Kronstadt.
original English: The gates of PetROGRAD through which the Red forces burst into Kronstadt.

original Spanish: Un agujero en la presa causado por un proyectil de 12
original English: A hole in the dam caused by a 12" shell

original Spanish: Hielo camino a Kronstadt roto por una bomba de 3".
original English: Ice towards Kronstadt broken by a 3" bomb.

original Spanish: Hielo roto por una bomba de 12.
original English: Ice broken by a 12" bomb.

original Spanish: Deliberadamente dañada por un proyectil de Krasnaia Gorka la barcaza proporcionó cobertura para las líneas rojas que avanzaban.
original English: Deliberately damaged by a shell from Krasnaia Gorka the barge provided cover for the advancing red lines.

original Spanish: Deliberadamente dañada por un proyectil de Krasnaia Gorka la barcaza proporcionó cobertura para las líneas rojas que avanzaban.
original English: Deliberately damaged by a shell from Krasnaia Gorka the barge provided cover for the advancing red lines.

original Spanish: Daños en la cubierta del "Petropavlovsk" causado por un proyectil de 6".
original English: Damage to the deck of the "Petropavlovsk" caused by a 6" shell.

original Spanish: Una brecha causada por un proyectil de 12 " de Krasnaia Gorka.
original English: A breach caused by a 12" shell from Krasnaia Gorka.

original Spanish: Después de pasar por las dos cubiertas el proyectil explotó en la sala de máquinas.
original English: After passing through the 2 decks the projectile exploded in the engine room.

original Spanish: Haré todo lo posible para intentar pagarlo.
original English: I'll do everything possible to pay it.

original Spanish: Marizza ¿es un adiós para siempre?
original English: Maritza must this be goodbye forever?

original Spanish: Tu hija por la noche... debería ocuparse del guardia.
original English: Your daughter in the middle of the night... must take care of the guard.

original Spanish: ¡Decídase de una vez por todas!
original English: Decide once and for all!

original Spanish: Y ella acuciada por la necesidad aceptará.
original English: And she burdened by necessity accepted.

original Spanish: Adaptada de motivos de "Nathan el sabio" de Lessing por Hans Kyser.
original English: Written by Hans Kyser based on the play "Nathan the Wise" by Gotthold Ephraim Lessing.

original Spanish: No la hagas pagar porque yo por su voluntad renegué de la fe de mis padres...
original English: I for her belief denied the faith of my fathers ...

original Spanish: ¡No alcéis las manos para la violencia!
original English: No hand may be raised in violence!

original Spanish: Cualquiera de los capturados por las armas podrá pagando diez piezas de oro disfrutar de la libertad junto con su esposa e hijos y todos sus bienes.
original English: Whoever took up arms against us may pay a ransom of ten pieces of gold to enjoy freedom along with his wife and children and all their property.

original Spanish: No habrá clemencia sin embargo para los caballeros templarios para que su disidencia infame llegue a su fin.
original English: There will be no leniency for the Knights Templar who will suffer at our nefarious ends.

original Spanish: ¡Gracias por mi vida!
original English: Saladin! You give me life.

original Spanish: ¡Todavía suspira por él!
original English: She still longs for him!

original Spanish: Su salvador fue un caballero templario indultado por Saladino.
original English: Her savior was a Templar knight pardoned by Saladin.

original Spanish: ¡Nathan está dando un festín para los pobres!
original English: Nathan is giving a feast for the poor!

original Spanish: Dadme esta capa para Recha pues quiere sin conseguirlo abrazar agradecida las rodillas de su salvador.
original English: Give me this coat for Recha. She wants to go down on her knee to thank her savior.

original Spanish: ¿No os había concedido su gracia y por ti a mí también siete veces?
original English: Hasn't he pardoned you and though you Pardoned me seven times over?

original Spanish: Traed las ollas de las monedas de la cámara del tesoro para recibirle dignamente.
original English: Bringing pots of coins to the treasure chamber.

original Spanish: Nada más morir el padre llegaron los hijos cada uno con su anillo a reclamar el dominio de la casa pero por más pruebas que se hicieron no consiguieron encontrar al auténtico.
original English: Just as the father was dying the children arrived each with his ring to claim the estate. More tests were made but they failed to find the authentic ring.

original Spanish: ¡El rescate de los más pobres para el más rico!
original English: The ransom of the poor for the rich!

original Spanish: ¡Estamos preparados! ¡Buscad un motivo para asestar el golpe!
original English: Look for a reason to strike!

original Spanish: ¡Dame a Recha por esposa!
original English: Give me Recha as a wife!

original Spanish: ¡Dadle al Templario a Recha por esposa!
original English: Give Recha to the Templar as his wife!

original Spanish: ¡De acuerdo con nuestra carta de derechos exigimos del Sultán Saladino que nos entregue al judío para juzgarle según nuestro derecho canónico e imperial!
original English: According to the rights under our Charter we demand that Sultan Saladin Deliver Nathan to our courts to be judged according to civil and canonical law!

original Spanish: Por nuestra Carta de Derechos obtenida tras la captura de la ciudad exigimos al Sultán Saladino que capture al judío para que podamos juzgarle según nuestro Derecho Canónico e Imperial. Heraclio
original English: According to our Charter rights which Saladin granted us after the capture of the city anyone who has a claim against a Jew may have the Patriarch judge him according to civil and canonical law.

original Spanish: ¡Clemencia para Nathan!
original English: Clemency for Nathan!

original Spanish: El Sultán Saladino os ruega que presenciéis la promulgación de la sentencia delante de la ciudadela y os dará rehenes por cada hombre que os acompañe a Jerusalén.
original English: Sultan Saladin asks you to attend the execution of the sentence At the citadel. He will give you a hostage

original Spanish: Leu Von Filneck supera ahora la prueba más dura para tu corazón:
original English: Leu von Filneck now comes the hardest test of your heart: This is your sister!

original Spanish: y el joven Hutter viajó por muchos caminos polvorientos pero finalmente los picos de los Cárpatos brillaron ante él.
original English: and young Hutter travelled many dusty roads but at last the peaks of the Carpathians loomed before him.

original Spanish: ¡El hombre lobo ronda por los bosques!
original English: the Werewolf roams the woods.

original Spanish: Falta mucho para el amanecer... y de día duermo amigo mío verdaderamente duermo el sueño más profundo...
original English: It is a while still till sunrise - and in the daytime I sleep my dear fellow I sleep the deepest of sleeps -

original Spanish: El peligro para Wisborg se acercaba.
original English: The danger for Wisborg drew nigh.

original Spanish: Mercancía en bultos: de Varna a Wisborg 6 cajones conteniendo tierra para fines experimentales
original English: Cargo: 6 crates of earth (experimental purposes)

original Spanish: La gente joven cae masivamente. Todas las víctimas presentan las mismas curiosas heridas en el cuello cuyo origen sigue siendo un enigma para los médicos.
original English: All victims exhibit the same peculiar stigmata on the neck the origin of which still puzzles the doctors.

original Spanish: Como una epidemia se extendió por todo el barco.
original English: It spread through the ship like an epidemic.

original Spanish: Es difícil saber cómo el joven Hutter con sus pocas fuerzas logró superar las dificultades de su vuelta a casa mientras que henchidas las velas del barco por el aliento mortal de Nosferatu volaba con rapidez fantasmal hacia su destino.
original English: It's quite difficult to say how despite his depleted strength young Hutter succeeded in surmounting the obstacles on his voyage home - - meanwhile Nosferatu's deadly breath swelled the sails of the ship which flew on toward its destination with ghostly haste.

original Spanish: Mucho medité acerca de por qué se contó que Nosferatu viajara con ataúdes llenos de tierra.
original English: Long have I pondered why Nosferatu was said to have travelled with earth-filled coffins.

original Spanish: Luego encontré anotado que los vampiros sólo obtienen su poder sombrío de la tierra maldita por Dios donde fueron sepultados.
original English: I found it recorded that vampyres can only draw their shadowy strength from the accursed earth in which they were buried.

original Spanish: Se notifica a los ciudadanos y se hace saber que el ilustre Concejo Municipal de esta ciudad prohíbe el traslado de posibles afectados o víctimas de la peste a hospitales para prevenir la propagación de la plaga en las calles.
original English: It is hereby decreed that the honourable magistrate of this town forbids the populace to transport the ill or plague-stricken to the hospital lest the plague spread through the streets.

original Spanish: La ciudad sacudida por el pánico buscaba una víctima: era Knock.
original English: The panic-stricken town was looking for a victim: it was Knock.

original Spanish: En esa misma hora la Peste cesó como barrida por los victoriosos rayos del sol vivo se disipó la sombra del pájaro de la muerte.
original English: at that very hour the Great Death came to an end and as if confronted by the victorious radiance of the living sun the shadow of the Deathbird was dispersed.

original Spanish: Se te paga por hora no por onzas!
original English: You're working by the hour -- not the ounce.

original Spanish: Su boleto por favor
original English: Fare please.

original Spanish: La mayoría de las cartelas existen en el negativo original aunque fueron alargadas para la presente reconstrucción.
original English: The basis was a camera negative and a dupe negative from the Bundesarchiv-Filmarchiv Berlin.

original Spanish: Y se llevó a cabo por Luciano Berriatúa y Camille Blot-Wellens por encargo de la Friedrich-Wilhelm-Murnau-Stiftung.
original English: In 2008 an export copy was discovered in the Cineteca Nacional de Chile in Santiago.

original Spanish: Decorados: según los diseños de Hermann Warm llevado a cabo por Hermann Warm y Erich Czerwonski
original English: Sets based on designs by Hermann Warm executed by Hermann Warm and Erich Czerwonski

original Spanish: ¡Melanie no parece tener tiempo para esto! ¿Verdad?
original English: Melanie doesn't have any time for this - does she?

original Spanish: ¡El señor sabe que no ganas lo suficiente como para permitírtelos!
original English: With the amount of money you earn even God doesn't know how you could be able to afford them!

original Spanish: ¡Se ha hecho rica por su negocio usurero!
original English: She's gotten fat and rich off her cutthroat business!

original Spanish: Los poemas son bastante bonitos... ¡pero esto no es para publicarse!
original English: The poems are nice enough... but they are certainly not and never will be publishable material - !

original Spanish: No no buen hombre... ¡Debemos brindar por el comienzo de una prometedora carrera literaria!
original English: No no - my good fellow - we must drink to the beginning of this promising literary career!

original Spanish: ¿... y por qué aún no ha llegado Melanie?
original English: ...and why on earth isn't Melanie here yet?

original Spanish: Nos gustaría aclarar por qué el empleado del ayuntamiento Lubota ha faltado al trabajo sin excusar su ausencia.
original English: We would like to enquire as to why the town clerk Lubota has been away from work without an excused absence!

original Spanish: Hemos recibido quejas contra el "indispuesto" Sr. Lubota que ha estado callejeando por bares y causando un escándalo frente a la casa de Harlan.
original English: We have received complaints against the 'sickly' Mr Lubota who's been carousing in bars and making a scandalous scene in front of the Harlan residence!

original Spanish: Bien por el amor de Dios Lorenz ¿qué pasa entre tú y los Harlan?
original English: Now for God's sake Lorenz what's going on with Harlan - ?

original Spanish: ¡Es demasiado bueno para esto!
original English: He's above all of this!

original Spanish: Sin embargo por amor de Dios...
original English: Nevertheless - for God's sake...

original Spanish: ¡pero no puedo vivir sin la esperanza de ganarla para mí!
original English: But I can't go on any longer - without the hope of someday acquiring her for myself!

original Spanish: ¡Cómo puede dudar de Lorenz... ni por un minuto madre!
original English: How can one have doubts about Lorenz even for a minute Mother!

original Spanish: ¡Perdóneme... por favor... un parecido increíble...!
original English: Forgive me... please... an almost unbelievable resemblance...

original Spanish: podría ir por mal camino?
original English: that Lorenz could go astray?

original Spanish: ¡Así que por favor no te metas en mis negocios!
original English: be so good as not to interfere with my business affairs!

original Spanish: ¡El mundo está cerrado para los que llegamos con las manos vacías!
original English: The world is closed to those who come with empty hands!

original Spanish: En vista de todo esto está despedido de inmediato de su trabajo para la ciudad y sin derecho a reclamar el salario.
original English: As such you are dismissed from this day forward without claim to further wages.

original Spanish: ¡Quiero comprar esta tela para mi madre!
original English: I'd like to buy this piece for my mother!

original Spanish: ¡He traído algo para ti madre!
original English: I brought something for you Mother!

original Spanish: Estuvo aquí... preguntó por ti...
original English: She was here... she was asking about you...

original Spanish: ¡Te doy tres días para aclarar por completo este asunto ni un minuto más.
original English: I'll give you three days to clear the matter up completely; not an hour longer.

original Spanish: ¡Te doy tres días para aclarar por completo este asunto ni un minuto más.
original English: I'll give you three days to clear the matter up completely; not an hour longer.

original Spanish: ¡Cuando teme por su dinero no conoce perdón esta vieja zorra!
original English: When she thinks her money's in danger the old beast knows no pity!

original Spanish: ¡La tendrás que sablear por segunda vez si es necesario a la fuerza!
original English: You'll just have to pull the wool over her eyes a second time - and if you have to - with force!

original Spanish: ¡Céntimo por céntimo!
original English: I'll pay back every last penny!

original Spanish: ¿Acaso de tus ingresos como secretario expulsado... o de tus honorarios por tus poemas?
original English: From your income as a discharged clerk - or from the royalties from your poetry?

original Spanish: Si te pudiese redimir... entonces se apagaría mi amor por ti...
original English: then I wouldn't love you anymore...

original Spanish: ¡Nadie me daría ni siquiera 50 marcos por mis diez miserables poemas!
original English: Nobody would even give me 50 marks for my ten measly poems!

original Spanish: De acuerdo... mañana por la tarde...
original English: Agreed then... tomorrow night...

original Spanish: ¿Quién camina por allí tan desasosegadamente?
original English: Who's making so much noise going back and forth?

original Spanish: ¡Te hemos esperado Lorenz para llevarte a casa!
original English: We've been waiting Lorenz to bring you home!

original Spanish: Herodes lleno de supersticioso temor encerró al Profeta en un pozo abandonado para protegerle contra la violencia de la chusma y el odio de Herodias.
original English: Herod full of superstitious fear locked the Prophet in an abandoned pit to protect him from the violence of the rabble and the hatred of Herodias.

original Spanish: Mata todo lo que ama; ama todo lo que mata ya en su alma brilla un rayo de la Luz y ella parte hacia lo Desconocido para intentar resolver el misterio de sus propias palabras...
original English: Love everything that kills already in your soul shines a ray of Light and she leaves for the Unknown to try to solve the mystery of his own words...

original Spanish: ¿Harás eso por mí Narraboth lo harás?
original English: Will you do that for me Narraboth will you do it? And tomorrow when it happens

original Spanish: ¡Harás eso por mí Narraboth!
original English: You will do that for me Narraboth!

original Spanish: ¡Ve pídele que venga para que pueda arrepentirse de sus iniquidades!
original English: Go ask him to come so he can repent of his iniquities!

original Spanish: Pon en el vino tus pequeños labios rojos para que yo pueda agotar la copa.
original English: Put your little red lips in wine so that I can exhaust the cup.

original Spanish: ¡Muerde un poco de esta fruta para que yo pueda comer el resto!
original English: Bite some of this fruit so I can eat the rest!

original Spanish: Salomé baila para mí y te daré el trono de tu madre.
original English: Salomé dance for me and I will give you the throne of your mother.

original Spanish: ¡Salomé Salomé baila para mí!
original English: Salomé Salomé dance for me!

original Spanish: Si bailo para ti Tetrarca ¿me darás lo que te pida?
original English: If I dance for you Tetrarch will you give me what I ask?

original Spanish: Por mi vida por mi corona por todo!
original English: For my life for my crown for everything!

original Spanish: Bailaré para ti Tetrarca.
original English: I will dance for you Tetrarca.

original Spanish: Lo siento señor pero por la Prohibición no podemos permitir.
original English: I realise you don't like it Sir but what with prohibition...

original Spanish: El trabajo es placer cuando está motivado por el amor.
original English: Work is a pleasure when it is motivated by love.

original Spanish: El mar tiene juegos muy duros para jugadores inexpertos.
original English: The sea plays very hard games with inexperienced players.

original Spanish: ¡Te enviaré a la cárcel por asesino!
original English: I could be sent to jail for murder!

original Spanish: La inactividad es ideal para personas ociosas pero cuando se aplica es más difícil que el trabajo duro.
original English: Inactivity is ideal for idle people but when it becomes a necessity it is worse than hard work.

original Spanish: Mi sombrero no es el mismo que el usado por las damas del barco.
original English: My hat isn't like the ones worn by the ladies on the ship.

original Spanish: Un viaje que podría durar para siempre.
original English: A trip that could last forever.

original Spanish: Tirar los dados por mí.
original English: Roll the dice for me.

original Spanish: John por favor...!
original English: John please...!

original Spanish: Trabajar en el mar es duro pero más duro para mí ver como partes
original English: Working on the sea is hard but it is even harder to say goodbye to it.

original Spanish: Por el brillo de sus ojos que alguien amó pero ahora cerrados por la muerte.
original English: ...by the shine of the eyes that one once loved but that have been closed forever by death. ...by the shine of the eyes that one once loved but that have been closed forever by death.

original Spanish: Sr. Cartaret la madre de este niño me ha dado esta carta para usted.
original English: Mr. Cartaret the mother of this child here has given me this letter for you.

original Spanish: Puede que el amor que experimentes por ella te ayude a llevar y olvidar tu gran dolor.
original English: May the love that you will experience from her help you to carry and forget your great pain.

original Spanish: Quizás para empezar podría olvidar el odio que siente por el nombre Wayne ...porque ese odio ha causado una grieta infranqueable ente él y Mónica.
original English: Perhaps but to start he should forget the hatred that he carries for the name Wayne ...because that hate has caused an unbridgable gap between him and Monica...

original Spanish: Quizás para empezar podría olvidar el odio que siente por el nombre Wayne ...porque ese odio ha causado una grieta infranqueable ente él y Mónica.
original English: Perhaps but to start he should forget the hatred that he carries for the name Wayne ...because that hate has caused an unbridgable gap between him and Monica...

original Spanish: Aún no se puede hacer nada por él.
original English: Nothing can be done about him yet.

original Spanish: Como su madre moribunda predijo Kathleen desarrolló si no un olvido total por la vida de su tío al menos consuelo para su tristeza ...y así empezó el verano de 1914.
original English: Like her dying mother had already foreseen Kathleen had brought if not total oblivion to the life of her uncle then at least given consolation in his sadness and so the summer of 1914 had begun.

original Spanish: Como su madre moribunda predijo Kathleen desarrolló si no un olvido total por la vida de su tío al menos consuelo para su tristeza ...y así empezó el verano de 1914.
original English: Like her dying mother had already foreseen Kathleen had brought if not total oblivion to the life of her uncle then at least given consolation in his sadness and so the summer of 1914 had begun.

original Spanish: Tras ser criado en América éste regresa a Dunstable para establecerse definitivamente.
original English: After being raised in America this young man returns to Dunstable to settle there permanently.

original Spanish: Willy Ainley se preparó como un joven Romeo para la llegada de Kathleen.
original English: Willy Ainley prepared himself for the arrival of Kathleen as a young Romeo!

original Spanish: eso es bastante para mí.
original English: that is enough for me.

original Spanish: Piensa en ello qué terrible sería para mí si los viejos lazos de la amistad entre vosotros fueran rotos por mis acciones.
original English: Think about it how terrible it would be for me if old ties of friendschip between you were broken by my actions.

original Spanish: Piensa en ello qué terrible sería para mí si los viejos lazos de la amistad entre vosotros fueran rotos por mis acciones.
original English: Think about it how terrible it would be for me if old ties of friendschip between you were broken by my actions.

original Spanish: Esta noche te dejaré quizás para siempre.
original English: Tonight I will leave you perhaps for ever.

original Spanish: No podía pensar en pedir la mano de nadie en momentos tan inseguros para mí. ¿Quién sabe?
original English: I couldn't think of asking the hand of a young girl at a moment when the future seems so insecure to me as now.

original Spanish: No sé cuáles son los motivos del odio que usted profesa por mí ...pero me gustaría decirle esto:
original English: I do not know the causes of the hate that you carry for me but I'd like to tell you this:

original Spanish: Creo que es necesario que te cuente por qué odio a quien se llame Wayne.
original English: I think it necessary to tell you why I hate all who carry the name "Wayne".

original Spanish: Parece estar fuera de sí por la envidia.
original English: He seems to be beside himself with envy.

original Spanish: Escoges muy mal momento para eso.
original English: You choose a very bad time for that.

original Spanish: Dejemos la reunión para otro día.
original English: Let us rather postpone this meeting for another day.

original Spanish: Un amor como el nuestro dura para siempre.
original English: A love like ours is everlasting.

original Spanish: Cumplió su promesa y vino a reconfortarme y a menudo la vuelvo a ver por las noches.
original English: She kept her promise and came to comfort me and very often afterwards I saw her again at night...

original Spanish: Pero mi amor por Kenneth va antes que todo.
original English: But my love for Kenneth comes before everything.

original Spanish: Hace justo ahora seis meses que supe por última vez de Ken.
original English: It's now already six months ago that I last heared from Ken.

original Spanish: Uno debe tener un corazón de piedra para consentir un sacrificio tal.
original English: One must have a heart of stone to condone such a sacrifice.

original Spanish: Sí mi viejo amigo he enviado a por ti porque te necesito.
original English: Yes my old friend I've sent for you because I need you.

original Spanish: ¿Crees que es suficiente con decir "Te necesito" para que olvide todo?
original English: Do you think that it is enough for you to say "I need you" to make me forget everything?

original Spanish: Kathleen me ha dejado para siempre.
original English: Kathleen has let me for ever.

original Spanish: Kenneth Wayne el sobrino de Jeremiah Wayne. ¿Ya no albergas odio por él?
original English: Kenneth Wayne... that nephew of Jeremiah Wayne... Do you not carry bad feelings for him anymore?

original Spanish: No quiero que Kathleen se case conmigo por compasión.
original English: I don't want for Kathleen to marry me out of pity.

original Spanish: ¿Es ese el único motivo por el que realmente renuncias?
original English: Is that really the only reason that you forsake?

original Spanish: Palabra por palabra.
original English: Word by word.

original Spanish: Constantemente estaba a tu lado mi querido John pero solo visible a los ojos de la ternura y el amor y tus ojos estaban cegados por el odio.
original English: Constantly I was with and around you my dear John but only visible for eyes of kindness and love and your eyes were veiled by hatred.

original Spanish: Somos pobres criaturas ¿por qué no ir sonriendo por el sendero de la vida?
original English: Poor creatures that we are why not go smiling along our life's path?

original Spanish: ¿Debo sacrificar mi felicidad y anhelos para eso?
original English: I shall sacrifice my happiness and all my hopes of my youth for that?

original Spanish: Miss Mary Conway saborea la nueva moda mientras posa como modelo para el famoso escultor Harry Lighton.
original English: Miss Mary Conway who is paying tribute to a new kind of fashion poses as a model for the well-known sculptor Harry Lighton.

original Spanish: Harber se siente atraido por la belleza de la chica a la que intenta ganarse a cualquier precio.
original English: Harber is drawn to the beauty of the girl in such a huge way that he tries to win her at any price.

original Spanish: Querida madre he ganado 20.000 libras para ti.
original English: Dearest mother-in-law I have won 20000 pounds for you.

original Spanish: Hoy no tengo tiempo para ti.
original English: I also don't have any time for you today.

original Spanish: Solo quería trae una invitación a Harber para esta noche.
original English: I just wanted to bring you an invitation to Harber's for tonight.

original Spanish: Un cigarrillo para empezar...
original English: But first a cigarette for the moment...

original Spanish: Esa tarde el jóven Eduard hijo de Harber acompañado por su tutor un cura ascético regresa a casa de su padre
original English: On the same evening Eduard the young son of Harber accompanied by his tutor an ascetic priest returned to the home of his father.

original Spanish: Pero por favor no se preocupe un joven así...
original English: But please don't worry...a young man like that...!

original Spanish: Eduard está encandilado por Maryquien intenta seducir al inocente muchacho con todas sus prácticas amorosas.
original English: Eduard is smitten with a raging passion for Mary who tries to seduce the innocent young boy with all her love skills.

original Spanish: ¡La mano que será bendecida es aquella que limpia este triste mundo presto para aniquilar!
original English: The hand shall be blessed that sweeps away this pitiful world which is ripe for annihilation!

original Spanish: Puede que sea así de mala por no encontrar alguien que me guiara un hombre como tú... un santo...
original English: Maybe I'm only so bad because I haven't found anyone who was willing to guide me a man like you... a saint... you might be able to save me from the gutter.

original Spanish: El último intento para que Eduard volviera al camino virtuoso.
original English: A last attempt to lead Eduard back to the path of righteousness.

original Spanish: Ayúdame por favor...
original English: Please help me...

original Spanish: ¡Lo ves no existe ayuda para ella!
original English: You see there is no help for her!

original Spanish: ¡La corte de apelación ha denegado la petición de clemencia para Mary Conway y Eduard Harber!
original English: The court of cassation has denied the petitions for clemency for Mary Conway and Eduard Harber!

original Spanish: ¡Ten piedad de tu madre y perdónala por favor!
original English: Please have pity on your mother and forgive her!

original Spanish: ¿No creerás que te he llamado para una confesión?
original English: You don't really think that I have sent for you to make a confession? No not at all!

original Spanish: Te he hecho venir para mirar en tus ojos una vez más y decirte  cuanto te quiero...
original English: I have sent for you - to look into your eyes once again and to tell you how much I love you...

original Spanish: Lista para ser destruida. En tus palacios el vicio está celebrando orgías como en la ciudad de Lot...!
original English: In your palaces vice celebrates orgies as once in the city of Lot...!

original Spanish: La esposa de Lot se prepara para la fiesta de Astarté.
original English: Lot's wife is preparing herself for the feast of Astarte.

original Spanish: ¿Por qué debo ir? ¿Para ser abrazado por extraños?
original English: Why watch complete strangers embrace you in their arms?

original Spanish: ¿Señor envíanos tu ángel para que esta ciudad sea castigada!
original English: Lord please send your angel so that this sinful city can be punished!

original Spanish: De un país extraño... Miradlo para llevarme... Solo por mí...
original English: Out of a far-away country...

original Spanish: De un país extraño... Miradlo para llevarme... Solo por mí...
original English: Out of a far-away country...

original Spanish: ¡El Señor me envía para castigar a ete pueblo por sus pecados!
original English: The Lord has send me here so that I can punish this town for its sins!

original Spanish: ¡El Señor me envía para castigar a ete pueblo por sus pecados!
original English: The Lord has send me here so that I can punish this town for its sins!

original Spanish: ¡Cuidado extraño una órden mía es suficiente para sacrificarte en el templo de Astarté!
original English: Know stranger that one hint from me is enough to have you sacrificed in the temple of Astarte!

original Spanish: ¡La reina ordena ejecuciones para poseer más oro y plata!
original English: The queen gives an order to turn in all silver and gold on pain of capital punishment!

original Spanish: Poco después el muchacho se convierte en orfebre de la corte y arde de pasión por ella.
original English: Soon after this the youth becomes a goldsmith at the court of the queen and is inflamed with passion for her.

original Spanish: Las murallas de la ciudad soportan el asedio por un tiempo.
original English: The city wall withstands the onslaught for a time.

original Spanish: Tras la invasión por los Amonitas solo se salva el palacio de la reina.
original English: After the army of the Ammonites has invaded the city only the queen's palace has been spared.

original Spanish: Por voluntad de la reina el muchacho recibe su recompensa por su amor y devoción: Sentenciado a muerte.
original English: At the will of the queen the youth now receives his "reward" for his unconditional love and devotion: he is sentenced to death.

original Spanish: En la huida ella se gira para ver la ciudad pecadora y se convierte en una columna de sal.
original English: On the run she once again turns around and takes one last look at the city of sins and turns into a pillar of salt.

original Spanish: ¡Espera un momento por favor y sé paciente cualquier emoción puede ser mala para él!
original English: Please wait a moment and be patient; any excitement might be bad for him!

original Spanish: ¡Espera un momento por favor y sé paciente cualquier emoción puede ser mala para él!
original English: Please wait a moment and be patient; any excitement might be bad for him!

original Spanish: La vida florezca para él. Salud y fuerza.
original English: Life gives him salvation and strength.

original Spanish: Vengo a tu Residencia a proponerte una alianza para la protección de la paz interior y exterior de nuestros reinos..
original English: I am visiting your residence to humbly offer you an alliance for the protection of the inner and outer peace of our Empires.

original Spanish: No pongáis en juego la apreciada vida de los trabajadores y dadme tiempo para la obra.
original English: Don't jeopardize the valuable lives of the workers and give me time for the construction.

original Spanish: ¿Estás preparado para hacer a los dioses un sacrificio matinal?
original English: Are you ready to offer the Gods a morning sacrifice?

original Spanish: ¡Señor del cielo padre de los dioses el Rey viene ante tu presencia para darte las gracias en estas horas matinales!
original English: Lord of the Heavens Father of the Gods the King is facing you to thank you in this morning hour.

original Spanish: El Rey Samlak de Etiopía hace adornar a su hija para su entrada en la capital de Egipto.
original English: King Samlak of Ethiopia gets his daughter decorated before her entrance into Egypts capital.

original Spanish: ¿Se considera demasiado importante para ayudarme en mi toilette?
original English: She thinks too highly of herself to assist me with my decoration.

original Spanish: Se la lleva en una balsa que transportaba madera y objetos de valor para la nueva cámara del tesoro del Faraón.
original English: He kidnaps her on his raft that transports wood and valuables for the Pharaoh's new Treasury.

original Spanish: Amenes queda menos impresionado por Makeda que por los tesoros de Etiopía.
original English: Amenes is less impressed by Makeda than by the treasures Samlak had brought with him.

original Spanish: ¿No vamos a bajar para ver la cámara del tesoro de cerca?
original English: Don't we want to go down there to see the Treasury from nearby?

original Spanish: Tienes motivo para ser precavido.
original English: You have good reasons to be cautious.

original Spanish: ¡Lo haré todo para conseguir tu amor!
original English: I will do anything to win your heart.

original Spanish: ¡... y todo esto por una muchacha extranjera!
original English: ...and all of this because of a foreign girl!

original Spanish: ¡... y todo por una esclava!
original English: ...and all of this because of a slave!

original Spanish: ¡No por la Reina!
original English: No because of a Queen.

original Spanish: ¡Qué valor tienen los ojos de un hombre si un Rey sufre por su mujer!
original English: What's the value of a person's eyes when a King is worrying about his wife?

original Spanish: ¡La mujer por cuya culpa te han cegado debe morir!
original English: The wife who's responsible for your blindness must die.

original Spanish: ¡Perdóname por haber querido salvarte!
original English: Forgive me that I want to save you.

original Spanish: ¡El cuerpo del Rey ha sido robado por mano enemiga!
original English: The dead Kings body has been stolen by the enemy! These are his remnants.

original Spanish: ¿Tampoco tú Reina Theonis que por su deseo...
original English: No exception Queen Theonis for your sake...

original Spanish: Amenes eres culpable no haya luto por ti.
original English: Amenes you are guilty no grievance about you.

original Spanish: ¡Tu nombre sea olvidado para siempre!
original English: Your name will be obliterated forever.

original Spanish: ¡Tienes el deber de sanar las heridas del pueblo sufridas por tu culpa!
original English: You have the duty to heal the wounds of your people. They are suffering because of you.

original Spanish: ¿Es éste el duelo que llevas por mí?
original English: Are you lamenting me?

original Spanish: ¡Os ha traicionado por la voluntad de una mujer!
original English: He betrayed you for the woman's sake.

original Spanish: Lo que Cenicienta sufrió por culpa de sus dos hermanas y su madrastra como creció y fue una princesa de cuento de hadas aquí se verá contado por un par de tijeras en una pantalla.
original English: What Cinderella suffered because of her two sisters and stepmother how she grew up and was a fairytale princess here will be seen counted by a pair of scissors on a screen.

original Spanish: y tenemos el "Responda por favor" del rey.
original English: And we have the "Respond please" of the king.

original Spanish: no hay lugar en la Corte para una zarrapastrosa..." le dicen
original English: There is no place in the Court for a rag-tag..." they say.

original Spanish: y el baile las luces los trompetistas la noble Pavana el corazón del príncipe-todo para ella!
original English: And the dance the lights the trumpeters the noble Pavana the heart of the prince-everything for her.

original Spanish: y cuando el tiempo implacable la busca para llevársela volando se lleva su alma pero deja su zapato!
original English: And when the implacable time seeks her to take her flying he takes his soul but he leaves his shoe!

original Spanish: y qué puede hacer un amante real más que decir "Mi reino por un zapato
original English: And what a real lover can do More to say "My kingdom for a shoe".

original Spanish: Ella sale; hace una reverencia y entra para siempre en el reino de las hadas.
original English: She leaves;

original Spanish: Al señor cura le hice hablar claro y él me confesó que no podía por su vida celebrar este matrimonio.
original English: I compelled the Signor Curate to tell me the cause; and he confessed that he had been forbidden on pain of death to perform the ceremony...

original Spanish: Quiero que le digáis a fray Cristoforo que tengo prisa por hablarle." Cuando fray Cristoforo sale de su convento de Pescanerico... ... Enzo Biliotti.
original English: I would like you to tell Friar Cristoforo that I am in a great hurry to speak to him  when Friar Cristoforo left his cloisters in Pescarenico... (Friar Cristoforo:

original Spanish: Ciertos hombres de mala catadura han usado el nombre de vuestra ilustrísima señoría para asustar a un pobre cura y molestar a dos inocentes.
original English: Some dishonest men have hidden behind the name of Your Excellency to frighten a poor curate and overpower two innocents...

original Spanish: Podéis ver hijos míos que este lugar no es seguro para vosotros.
original English: You see my children this country is not safe for you! ...

original Spanish: Es la pobre joven por la cual vuestra señoría me ha hecho esperar vuestra válida protección.
original English: This is the poor girl for whom Your Excellency I have solicited your protection...

original Spanish: El canceller del ducado de Milán Antonio Ferrero quien para granjearse el favor del pueblo había rebajado arbitrariamente el precio del pan.
original English: Time ago the Chancellor of the Duchy of Milan Antonio Ferrero had arbitrarily lowered the price of bread in order to gain the people's favour.

original Spanish: Vengo para conducirlo a prisión.
original English: I am here to take him to prison! ...

original Spanish: Prepara una buen cama para este valiente joven.
original English: Prepare a good bed for this nice young man! ...

original Spanish: El por qué lo sabrás del señor capitán de justicia.
original English: Signor Captain of Justice will explain why! ...

original Spanish: Es mejor para ti.
original English: It is better for you...

original Spanish: ... Obediencia de fray Cristoforo para ir a Rimini donde predicará la cuagésima dejando todo pensamiento del país en que debe partir.
original English: It was an order for Friar Cristoforo to repair to Rimini for the purpose of preaching the Lent sermons giving up all thoughts of the business he has in the country he must leave...

original Spanish: Creo que las puertas de ese claustro de abren a veces para ti...
original English: I believe the doors of that cloister sometimes open for him...

original Spanish: Lucia asombrada más que convencida por la insistencia de sor Gertrude no se atreve a oponerse a su deseo.
original English: Lucia more astonished than convinced by Sister Gertrude's insistence... cannot defy her will... and moves on...

original Spanish: Rogaré por vos toda mi vida.
original English: I will pray for you all my life...

original Spanish: Dios perdona tantas cosas por un acto de misericordia...
original English: God pardons so many deeds for one act of mercy! ...

original Spanish: Dios perdona tantas cosas por una obra de misericordia...
original English: God pardons so many deeds for one act of mercy

original Spanish: Virgen santísima que habéis hecho tantos milagros por los pobres atribulados ayúdame.
original English: Most Holy Virgin you who have performed so many miracles for the afflicted help me!

original Spanish: Voto y renuncio para siempre a ese pobrecillo para no ser más de otro que vuestra.
original English: I make a vow to renounce that unfortunate fellow now and forever never to belong to anyone else but you.

original Spanish: Doña Prassese que aquellos días viajaba hacia Pescanerico por deseo del cardenal Borromeo toma bajo su protección a Lucia. ...
original English: Donna Prassede who was holidaying near Pescarenico took Lucia under her protection in accordance with Cardinal Borromeo's wishes.

original Spanish: Agnese sabedora con dolor de la partida de fray Cristoforo deja nuevamente su casa para volver al convento de Monza.
original English: Agnese aggrieved by Friar Cristoforo's departure left her home once again and returned to the convent in Monza.

original Spanish: Así Lucia se ve forzada a abandonar a su madre para seguir a doña Prassede. Mientras don Rodrigo al ver que su abominable empresa ha sido vana también parte hacia Milán.
original English: Thus Lucia was obliged to leave her mother and follow Donna Prassede whilst Don Rodrigo his loathsome deed having now proved futile he too set off for Milan.

original Spanish: El nombre del Innombrable animó a sus hombres no para acciones infames sino para liberar a los míseros oprimidos.
original English: The words of the Unnamed spurred his men no longer to commit villainous deeds but to free the oppressed!

original Spanish: Fuese por coindicencia fuese a propósito él siempre estuvo desarmado a la cabeza de aquella especie de guarnición.
original English: Whether from principle or that he had made a vow to that effect he remained unarmed at the head of that garrison.

original Spanish: Y la terrible epidemia se extendió como un relámpago entre la mísera población ya exhausta por la pobreza y el saqueo.
original English: ... ...And the terrible disease spread like lightning through the poor population already stricken by famine and plunder...

original Spanish: Renzo temeroso por la suerte de Lucia llegaba con el corazón roto a las puertas de Milán.
original English: Renzo anxious about Lucia's fate arrived heartsick at the gates of Milan...

original Spanish: ¿Preguntas por una persona viva en el hospital?
original English: Do you think a living person may be found in the lazaretto? ...

original Spanish: Prepárate para hacer un sacrificio...
original English: I will seek her in one place or another And if I do not find her! Be prepared to make a sacrifice...

original Spanish: Hago voto y renuncio para siempre a ese pobrecito para no ser nunca de otro antes que tuya.
original English: I make a vow to renounce that unfortunate fellow for ever never to belong to anyone else but you!

original Spanish: Oh Lucia por qué he venido me preguntas después de tantas promesas.
original English: Oh Lucia! ... You ask me why I am here?

original Spanish: Tú Lucia da a Renzo tus comisiones por tu madre.
original English: You Lucia entrust Renzo with your errands for your mother...
