original English: Hector has died for Helen's love.

original Spanish: ¡Paris por nuestro amor no dispares!
original English: Paris for our love do not shoot!

original Spanish: Paris con ese disparo cobarde has matado mi amor para siempre.
original English: Paris with this cowardly shot you have forever killed my love.

original Spanish: Sólo he venido por las súplicas de tu madre a traerte comida y agua.
original English: I've only come by the prayers of your mother to bring you food and water.

original Spanish: Qué me suplicas por mi amor reina Hécuba.
original English: What do you ask in the name of my love Queen Hecuba?

original Spanish: Mientras los troyanos descubrían al amanecer el caballo de madera vagaba el rey Príamo confuso por los sueños por sus habitaciones.
original English: While the Trojans discovered the wooden horse at dawn King Priam wandered the halls of his palace confused by his somber dreams.

original Spanish: Dioses por segunda vez os sacrificaré a mi hijo Paris si os apiadáis de la sagrada Troya.
original English: Gods I offer to sacrifice my son Paris for the second time if you save sacred Troy.

original Spanish: El cáliz con veneno para Paris y Elena.
original English: The chalice with poison for Paris and Helen.

original Spanish: Que oren por la suerte de la ciudad y que por ella mueran al alba.
original English: Let them pray for the happiness of the city for which they will die at dawn.

original Spanish: ¡La segunda flecha para Elena!
original English: The second arrow for Helen!

original Spanish: Reconstrucción y custodia: Museo cinematográfico de Munich para el festival: "Troya sueño y realidad
original English: Reconstruction and custody: the Munich Film Museum for the festival: "Troy Dream and Reality

original Spanish: El Senado y pueblo de Roma piden para ti el favor de los dioses.
original English: The senate and the people of Rome wish you the favour of the gods.

original Spanish: ¡Yo pido para César el favor de los dioses!
original English: I wish upon Caesar the favour of the gods!

original Spanish: Y Marco jefe de los pretorianos que por amor a Mesalina la bellisima y lujuriosa mujer de Claudio ha sido el alma de la conjura trae a la amada la gran noticia.
original English: And Marcus captain of the praetorians who was at the heart of the conspiracy for the love of Messalina the very beautiful and wanton wife of Claudius brings the great news to the beloved woman.

original Spanish: Tu belleza es una fiesta para Roma¡oh divina!
original English: Your beauty is the celebration of Rome divinity.

original Spanish: Esta vida no es para ti amor.
original English: This life isn't for you love.

original Spanish: Pero la felicidad no es para los esclavos.
original English: But happiness is not for slaves.

original Spanish: ¡Oh para el banquete!
original English: Oh for the banquet!

original Spanish: ¡Ah por fin!
original English: Ah finally!

original Spanish: Allí estáel circo donde correré y ganaré mi libertad para tí.
original English: There's the circus where I'll race and win my liberty for you oh!

original Spanish: El que volveráun día por ti.
original English: The one who'll return for you one day. Oh dear!

original Spanish: Aquel ingénuo rostro de muchacho le sonreía y por verle de nuevo se hace invitar con Claudio para admirar el nuevo carro de Apolonio.
original English: That honest boy's face smiled upon her and to see him again she invites herself and Claudius to admire Apollonius's new chariot.

original Spanish: Aquel ingénuo rostro de muchacho le sonreía y por verle de nuevo se hace invitar con Claudio para admirar el nuevo carro de Apolonio.
original English: That honest boy's face smiled upon her and to see him again she invites herself and Claudius to admire Apollonius's new chariot.

original Spanish: Una caravana cargada de ricos articulos persas llega a Roma pero bajo las ropas de los mercaderes se esconden los seguidores de Ennio quienes conducidos por su anciana madre intentan su liberación.
original English: A caravan rich with precious Persian goods arrives at Rome but under the guise of merchants hide the followers of Ennius who are lead by his old mother to attempt his liberation.

original Spanish: Esta alfombra tejida por manos de virgen conserva toda su juventud toda su suavidad
original English: This carpet woven by virgins' hands has all their youth softness!

original Spanish: Mirit para tener a Ennio con ella recurre a estratagemas.
original English: Mirit resorts to tricks to keep Ennius with her.

original Spanish: - No por favor.
original English: - No please!

original Spanish: Mirit furiosa por la desaparición de Egle y Tigranes continua su venganza contra Ennio.
original English: Mirit angered by the disappearance of Ela and Tigranes continues her revenge against Ennius.

original Spanish: La mezcla para los caballos de Ennio. ¡Dáselo todo!
original English: The mash to be given to the horses of Ennius. All of it!

original Spanish: - Esto es para tí.
original English: - This is for you.

original Spanish: Apuesto 20 por Ennio.
original English: I bet 20 on Ennius.

original Spanish: - Apuesta por Ennio. Ganarás.
original English: - Bet on Ennius you'll win!

original Spanish: Mirit para arrancar a Ennio de las manos de Mesalina trata de comprar a cualquier precio el esclavo a Apolonio.
original English: Mirit tries to buy the slave from Apollonius at any price.

original Spanish: - ¡Juralo por los dioses y aceptaré - ¡Lo juro!
original English: - Swear by your gods and I'll accept. - I swear!

original Spanish: Apoyada en sus derechos Mirit no pierde el tiempo en ir a Mesalina para llevarse a Ennio.
original English: Now that her right is secure Mirit wastes no time to go to Messalina to take Ennius away.

original Spanish: Hay un castigo para tí peor que la muerte.¡Argo!
original English: A punishment for you worse than death! Argo!

original Spanish: - Calmate volveremos para salvarla
original English: - Calm down we'll return to save her! Ennius!

original Spanish: Prepárate para el sacrificio.
original English: Get ready for the sacrifice.

original Spanish: Enloquecida por su esperanza de amor perdida herida en su orgullo Mesalina intenta reconquistar el corazón de Cayo Silo para convertirle en instrumento de su venganza.
original English: Messalina wounded in her pride and almost mad from losing the love that she hoped for seeks to reconquer the heart of Gaius Silius to make him an instrument for her revenge.

original Spanish: Enloquecida por su esperanza de amor perdida herida en su orgullo Mesalina intenta reconquistar el corazón de Cayo Silo para convertirle en instrumento de su venganza.
original English: Messalina wounded in her pride and almost mad from losing the love that she hoped for seeks to reconquer the heart of Gaius Silius to make him an instrument for her revenge.

original Spanish: Encomiendate a los dioses y prepárate para el sacrificio.
original English: Entrust yourself to the gods get ready for the sacrifice.

original Spanish: Han penetrado en la villa para salvar a la esclava.
original English: They have invaded the villa to free the slave. They are many!

original Spanish: ¡Bebe por tu imperio Silio!
original English: Drink to your empire Silius!

original Spanish: - Divina preparate para la boda.
original English: Divinity prepare yourself for the nuptials.

original Spanish: Romanos con mi espada combati por todos vosotros y vencí a vuestros enemigos por el bien del pueblo de Roma.
original English: Romans with my sword I fought for all of you! I defeated your enemy! For the good of the people of Rome!

original Spanish: ¡Ah por los dioses!
original English: Ah by the gods!

original Spanish: Los romanos se burlan del roble consagrado a los dioses por los germanos.
original English: The Romans mock the sacred oak consecrated to the gods by the Germans.

original Spanish: ¡Wodan danos fuerzas para la lucha contra Roma que presagio!
original English: Wotan give us strength in the struggle against Rome that I foresee!

original Spanish: ¡Dadme a Tusnelda por esposa y me ocuparé de que seáis rey!
original English: Give me Thusnelda as my wife and I'll see you made king!

original Spanish: No quiero honores para mí.
original English: I do not want honor for me alone.

original Spanish: ¡Qué deshonra para Roma!
original English: What a shame for Rome!

original Spanish: ¡Germania pagará por este sacrilegio!
original English: Germany will pay for this sacrilege!

original Spanish: Creo que Segimer se prepara para el Walhalla.
original English: I think Segimer is preparing for Valhalla.

original Spanish: Brindo por la joven pareja.
original English: Here's to the young couple.

original Spanish: ¡El Consejo me confirmará que estamos preparados para la lucha y la libertad!
original English: The "Council" gives me confidence that we are ready to fight for freedom!

original Spanish: ¡luchar por la libertad y la justicia!
original English: Fight for freedom and justice!

original Spanish: Los romanos se preparan para la guerra.
original English: The Romans are preparing for war.

original Spanish: ¡Si está en peligro lucha por él!
original English: If he is in danger fight for him!

original English: Directed by Paul Leni.

original Spanish: Escritor con imaginación para trabajo publicitario... en una exposición de figuras de cera.
original English: - An imaginitive writer for publicity work in a waxworks exhibition.

original Spanish: Sobre todo odiaba la monotonía por lo que tenía una esposa diferente para cada día del año...
original English: Above all he hated monotony So he had a different wife for every day in the year -

original Spanish: Sobre todo odiaba la monotonía por lo que tenía una esposa diferente para cada día del año...
original English: Above all he hated monotony So he had a different wife for every day in the year -

original Spanish: El humo de la chimenea de Assad... parecía burlarse de él por su mala suerte.
original English: The smoke from Assad's chimney seemed to be taunting him with his bad luck.

original Spanish: ¡Por eso voy a robar para ti el anillo de los deseos del Califa!
original English: For I shall steal the Caliph's wishing ring for you!

original Spanish: Flor mía ¿tienes un escondite para un hombre grueso?
original English: My pond-lily have you a hiding place for a fat man?

original English: In the gloom of night Ivan accompanied by his astrolger would steal into the cellars of the Kremlin to gloat over the dying agonies of his poisoned victims.

original Spanish: En la oscuridad de la noche Iván acompañado por su astrólogo se introducía en los sótanos del Kremlin... para jactarse de las postreras agonías de sus víctimas envenenadas.
original English: In the gloom of night Ivan accompanied by his astrolger would steal into the cellars of the Kremlin to gloat over the dying agonies of his poisoned victims.

original Spanish: Al día siguiente un noble llegó al Kremlin... para recordar a Iván su compromiso de asistir a la boda de su hija.
original English: The next day a noble came to the Kremlin to remind Ivan of his promise to attend his daughter's wedding.

original Spanish: ¡Has venido para sacarme del Kremlin!
original English: You came to lure me out of the Kremlin!

original Spanish: Quizás así sea ...en Marte han empezado a inquietarse por culpa de nosotros!
original English: Perhaps -- ...they on Mars got worried about you and I!

original English: A model of the apparatus built by Gol for observing life on other planets.

original Spanish: Spiridónov se pasaba todas las tardes en casa de su amigo inventando junto con él el aparato para el vuelo a Marte.
original English: Spiridonov spent his evenings at his friend's place working with him to build a spaceship to fly to Mars.

original Spanish: No prestamos vivienda vaya al departamento para asuntos femeninos.
original English: We don't provide quarters. Go to the women's section.

original Spanish: Los víveres que trajera Ehrlich permitieron organizar un festín raro para Moscú y recordar " el pasado hermoso" .
original English: The food Erlich brought made it possible to have a feast that was rare for Moscow and remember "the beautiful past".

original Spanish: Habrá que liberar el local del laboratorio para el nuevo vecino.
original English: You'll have to vacate your laboratory for a new tenant.

original Spanish: Kravtsov decidió investigar por cuenta propia la desaparición del azúcar.
original English: Kravtsov decided to investigate on his own the case of the lost sugar.

original Spanish: ? Cómo se atreve usted a ocultarme el aparato creado por Gor!
original English: How dare you hide from me the apparatus built by Gol?

original Spanish: Y bien por decisión de los Ancianos Notorios un tercio de la fuerza laboral será almacenada en refrigeradores.
original English: So by the decision of the Elders a third of the living workforce is put into cold storage for keeping.

original Spanish: La mayoría de la población trabajaba para los " ancianos notables" y nunca había abandonado sus subterráneos...
original English: All the workers - the population toiling for the "Elders" never left their dungeons.

original Spanish: Hace 2 meses que me fui de Rusia... para siempre.
original English: It's been 2 months now since I left Russia... -for good.

original Spanish: En ese sueno dorado Losi se disfraza haciéndose pasar por Spiridónov.
original English: In his dreams Los disguises himself as Spiridonov.

original Spanish: Lo arresto por haber...
original English: I'm arresting you on a charge of...

original Spanish: ! Spiridónov! Usted está arrestado por su regreso no autorizado a la RSFSR y el asesinato de la esposa del ingeniero Losi.
original English: Engineer Spiridonov you're under arrest for unauthorized return to the RSFSR and murder of Engineer Los' wife.

original Spanish: ! Rápido! Ve a recibir a los visitantes de la Tierra y tráelos para acá.
original English: Hurry to meet the guests from Earth and bring them to me.

original Spanish: El momento indicado por el astrónomo principal se acercaba.
original English: The moment indicated by Chief Astronomer was nearing.

original Spanish: Aelita por orden de los notables ese hombre de la Tierra debe ser arrestado.
original English: Aelita on the "Elders'" orders this Earthman is under arrest.

original Spanish: Falta 1 hora para la partida del tren.
original English: Our train will be in an hour.

original Spanish: Toda la vida agradeceré al destino por haber errado el tiro.
original English: I'll be thanking providence all my life for having missed.

original English: An adventures tale by Frank Heller adapted for motion pictures in six chapters by Thea von Harbou.

original English: And now begins the story.

original Spanish: ¡Su Alteza no aparece por todo el castillo!
original English: His Highness cannot be found anywhere in the castle!

original Spanish: La unión de su Alteza con la Gran Duquesa Olga sería la salvación para Abacco.
original English: Your Highness' marriage to the Great Duchess Olga would save Abacco.

original Spanish: ¿Tampoco por muchísimo dinero?
original English: A great sum of money wouldn't do the trick?

original Spanish: Me llamo Bekker y vengo Alteza para comprarle Punta Hermosa.
original English: My name is Bekker Your Highness and I am here to buy Punta Hermosa.

original Spanish: Si le doy cinco millones de francos por Punta Hermosa tendría que darle igual para qué la quiero.
original English: If I were to give you 5 million Francs for Punta Hermosa you shouldn't care what I want it for.

original Spanish: Si le doy cinco millones de francos por Punta Hermosa tendría que darle igual para qué la quiero.
original English: If I were to give you 5 million Francs for Punta Hermosa you shouldn't care what I want it for.

original Spanish: Sr. Bekker Su Alteza da por terminada la audiencia
original English: Mr Bekker His Highness has terminated this meeting

original Spanish: ¿Pretende en serio Paqueno que me convierta en un sinvergüenza para mis súbditos?
original English: ¿Paqueno do you really expect me to become a scoundrel to my subjects?

original Spanish: ¡No veo otra salvación para Abacco a no ser que baje del cielo!
original English: I see no other solution for Abacco unless it comes down from the sky!

original Spanish: ¿Qué Sr. Isaaks se le puede felicitar por su elección al Parlamento?
original English: Mr. Isaaks can I congratulate you for being elected?

original Spanish: Sr. Semjon Markowitz por la presente le comunico que tengo en mi poder una carta por la que ciertas personas pagarían mucho dinero.
original English: Mr. Semjon Markowitz I hereby let you know that I have come to own a letter for which certain people would pay great sums of money.

original Spanish: Así pues yo le doy el dinero para financiar la revolución y apoyo su Presidencia. A cambio obtengo Punta Hermosa tal y como está con plenos derechos.
original English: In exchange I get Punta Hermosa as it is.

original Spanish: Esta tarde se ha comprado en las Bolsas de Londres París y Roma el 80% de la Deuda Pública del Gran Ducado de Abacco por un comprador desconocido.
original English: Today at the Stock Markets in London Paris and Rome 80 % of the Grand Dukedom of Abacco's public debt was purchased by an unknown buyer.

original Spanish: Contesten por cable.
original English: Wire your answer.

original Spanish: Compra de bonos de Abacco por un desconocido.
original English: Stranger buys Abacco's stocks.

original Spanish: ¿Quiere Ud... quiere aceptar un anillo en prenda por sus gastos señor?
original English: Will you... will you accept a ring as surety for your expenses sir?

original Spanish: ¿No quiere decirme qué puedo hacer por Ud.?
original English: Will you not tell me what I can do for you?

original Spanish: ¡A las 7:45 sale el tren para el sur Alteza Imperial!
original English: The train for the South leaves at 7:45 your Imperial Highness!

original English: Chapter 4 wherein Mr. Philipp Collin meets the greatest problems caused by professor Pelotard whom he had taken under his wing unsensibly.

original Spanish: Mi 'Cigüeña' acaba de ser fletado para otro viaje a Abacco.
original English: My Stork has just been chartered for another trip to Abacco.

original Spanish: Philipp Collin ha tenido de nuevo una inspiración y decide por precaución tratar de 'Alteza'  en lo sucesivo a todos sus compañeros de viaje.
original English: Philipp Collin has had a new moment of inspiration and decides to address all his travel companions as "Highness" from then on.

original Spanish: ¿Es Ud. consciente de que su interés en Abacco tiene algo de peligroso para su vida?
original English: Are you aware that your interest in Abacco may be dangerous for your life?

original Spanish: ¡Estoy impaciente por llegar a Abacco!
original English: I can't wait to get to Abacco!

original Spanish: Es demasiado para sus nervios Alteza descanse un poco que ya encontraré yo el Pabellón Blanco.
original English: It's too much for your nerves Your Highness. Get some rest. I'll manage to find the White Pavilion.

original Spanish: ¿Cuánto vale para ti cariño?
original English: How much is it worth for you honey?

original Spanish: Un millón de francos... para cada uno ¿es suficiente?
original English: A million francs... each will it do?

original Spanish: ¡que pagaréis con vuestra vida por la suya!
original English: I tell you I'll take your lives if you take his!

original Spanish: ¿Quieres explicarme por qué?
original English: Will you tell me why?

original English: Will you be deceived by this ridiculous forgery of my handwriting?

original Spanish: ¡Brindo por que vuestra boda sea una operación tan feliz como la mía con la Deuda Pública de Abacco!
original English: A toast for your marriage to be as happy an operation as mine with Abacco's public debt has been!

original Spanish: ¡Solo me intereso por lo que conquisto!
original English: I am not interested in what I conquer!

original English: Concerned about Claire's departure "The Apostle" also proposes

original English: I am tired of fighting ... of arguing with you ... I need your strength ... you ... for myself alone

original English: a little farm girl an "innocent" one... Claire has just learned   The search was in vain.

original English: Einar Norse a young engineer who yesterday afternoon left Claire's house was found dead after crashing his car down a fatal slope.

original Spanish: ¿por miedo a las murmuraciones... por cobardía ante la hipocresía sentimental de la HUMANIDAD?
original English: for fear of the murmurings ... of cowardice before the sentimental hypocrisy of humanity?

original English: Einar Norse a young engineer who yesterday evening left Claire's house was found dead (voluntarily they say) thanks to a fall down a fatal slope.

original English: A young engineer commits suicide for an artist.

original Spanish: ...El público es numeroso agitado por el drama... el escándalo
original English: ... The audience is large shaken by the tragedy ... the scandal

original English: The entire room is passionate - feverish - for or against this "inhuman" woman   to boldly hold her head up  and achieve such a triumph

original Spanish: ¡no... para nadie!

original English: They just found his body horribly mutilated ... to legally identify the body two witnesses are required Please be the second witness ... in your home ... tomorrow ... at seven ...

original English: Claire ... fainting from shock   unexpected music ... hateful ... in this tortured atmosphere Claire is increasingly ... excited ... haunted ... suddenly the wind ... when she finally leaves to discover the Secret of her immense human suffering ...

original English: I did not leave your home to die but clearly I remembered your saying

original English: If you can destroy your life so easily it is not worth very much. And then I wanted them to think me dead in order to make you know - even more strongly KNOW - what you hid ...

original English: And that if not for this you would never have come here!

original English: And while the TSF radio voice will broadcast your voice everywhere on the same waves by a new process the image of your listeners will come back.

original English: And now the great laboratory beats with activity ... He tries a bold experience to try to save Claire

original Spanish: Hoy eres el primero respetado por todos un ministro un general quizás incluso un príncipe.
original English: Today you are the first respected by everyone a minister a general maybe even a prince —

original Spanish: Dados sus muchos años de servicio hemos creado un puesto para usted enviando al asilo al empleado más antiguo con efecto en el día de hoy.
original English: however due to your period of service of many years' standing we've created an open position for you by sending the oldest employee of our firm to a shelter effective today.

original Spanish: Pero el autor se preocupa por quien ha sido abandonado por todos y le concede un epílogo contando una historia que desafortunadamente no suele ocurrir en la vida real.
original English: But the author is looking out for him who has been abandoned by everyone and so he bestows upon him an epilogue telling a story that — unfortunately — usually doesn't occur in real life.

original Spanish: Un hombre no tiene tiempo para perderse en los sentimientos...
original English: A man doesn't have time to get lost in feelings...

original Spanish: Ya sabes... el médico me envía al sur para curarme quieres venir conmigo y cuidar de tu viejo tío...
original English: You know... the doctor is sending me to the south for a cure do you want to come with me and look after your old uncle...

original Spanish: no para Giovanni... él tiene ir con su ropa vieja...
original English: not for Giovanni... he has to go into his old clothes...

original Spanish: ¿Eso es todo... para mí...?
original English: Is that all... for me...?

original Spanish: Lo sacrifiqué todo por él...
original English: I sacrificed everything for him...

original Spanish: La gente lo ve... como un payaso para jugar.
original English: You look at him...

original Spanish: Esta cosa ahorrará un 25% en gasolina. Cuando se la venda a esa empresa de accesorios de Detroit todos vosotros trabajaréis para mí.
original English: This thing'll save twenty-five percent in gas - and when I sell it to that accessories company in Detroit you'll all be working' for me

original Spanish: Compré un vestido nuevo hace tres semanas y estoy esperando a que me lleves a algún sitio para ponérmelo.
original English: I've had this new dress ready for three weeks waiting for you to take me some place.

original Spanish: ¡Estar casado no es nada bueno no para gente como nosotros!
original English: Being married ain't any good not for folks like us!

original Spanish: - Pinkie Doran - Cree que el cielo protegerá a las chicas trabajadoras y les enviará brazaletes para adornar sus muñecas.
original English: Pinkie Doran who believes that heaven will protect the working girl and send bracelets enough to keep her wrists warm.

original Spanish: - Paul Garrettson - Novelista para quien una vendedora era un ser extraño pero interesante.
original English: Paul Garrettson novelist to whom a shop girl was a strange but interesting human being.

original Spanish: Quizá mañana por la noche...
original English: Maybe tomorrow night.

original Spanish: Ve al teatro Midtown y compra un par de buenos asientos para el espectáculo de esta noche.
original English: Run over to the Midtown Theatre and get a couple good seats for tonight's show.

original Spanish: ¿Le gustaría posar para mí?
original English: How would you like to pose for me?

original Spanish: Te pagaré sesenta dólares por cada sesión.
original English: I'll pay you sixty per!

original Spanish: ¡Eran para esta noche!
original English: They're for tonight!

original Spanish: He conseguido un trabajo mejor: voy a posar para un artista.
original English: I've got a better job I'm going to pose for an artist!

original Spanish: Esta noche salgo para Detroit nena.
original English: I'm going to Detroit tonight Kid.

original Spanish: Así Tessie dejó su trabajo en los almacenes pues se sentía feliz al pensar que estaba siguiendo los pasos de Jimmy en su lucha por ascender.
original English: So Tessie climbed out of Thorndyke's basement happy in the thought that she was keeping pace with Jimmy in his struggle to rise in the world.

original Spanish: Es la obra menos sincera que jamás haya creado. ¡Un albañil lo hubiese hecho mejor! ¡Y todo por tu culpa!
original English: It's the most insincere piece or work I ever turned out a bricklayer could do better" And it's all your fault!

original Spanish: ¡Qué suerte para mí que fuera a visitar al Sr. Brant!
original English: It's lucky for me you dropped in to see Mr. Brant!

original Spanish: Setenta y cinco a la semana para empezar.
original English: Seventy-five a week to start.

original Spanish: Lo hace espléndidamente condesa pero debe ver un poco más de la vida. Debe dejarme sacarla por ahí de vez en cuando.
original English: You're doing splendidly Countess but you must see a little more of life you must let me take you out occasionally.

original Spanish: En la fiesta de Riccardi Tessie se dio cuenta por primera vez de que Jimmy tenía razón cuando le dijo que estaba jugando con fuego.
original English: At Riccardi's party Tessie realized for the first time that Jimmy was right she couldn't play with fire.

original Spanish: Querida Tessie te recogeré para ir a cenar a la fiesta de Riccardi.
original English: Dear Tessie will pick you up for dinner Riccardi's party Chip.

original Spanish: ¿No es un poco tarde para mostrarse así de arisca después de haber estado con Garrettson Brandt y Riccardi?
original English: Isn't it pretty late in the game to be getting so particular? After Garrettson and Brandt and Riccardi?

original Spanish: ¡Todo lo he hecho por ti!
original English: Detroit I was thinking of you doing it all for you!

original Spanish: Esto es para mañana.
original English: That's for tomorrow.

original Spanish: Estoy impaciente por verte de nuevo y que conozcas a mi marido. Tú y tu marido tenéis que llamar pronto.
original English: I'm so anxious to see you again and have you meet my husband You and your husband must call soon...

original Spanish: HELIOS AGENCIA DE DETECTIVES Firmo contrato con la Agencia Helios para que reúnan pruebas contra mi esposa y acepto pagar la tarifa habitual por adquirir evidencias suficientes para conseguir el divorcio.
original English: HELIOS VIENNESE INTERNATIONAL DETECTIVE AGENCY I hereby employ the Helios Detective Agency to collect evidence against my WIFE and agree to pay the usual bonus for sufficient proof of misconduct to procure a divorce.

original Spanish: HELIOS AGENCIA DE DETECTIVES Firmo contrato con la Agencia Helios para que reúnan pruebas contra mi esposa y acepto pagar la tarifa habitual por adquirir evidencias suficientes para conseguir el divorcio.
original English: HELIOS VIENNESE INTERNATIONAL DETECTIVE AGENCY I hereby employ the Helios Detective Agency to collect evidence against my WIFE and agree to pay the usual bonus for sufficient proof of misconduct to procure a divorce.

original Spanish: Tuve otro ataque por mi enfermedad del corazón.
original English: I had another attack of my heart trouble.

original Spanish: El Dr. Gustav Mueller llama a casa de los Braun todas las mañanas aparentemente por su compañero pero realmente por la esposa.
original English: Dr. Gustav Mueller calls at the Braun's every morning ostensibly for his partner but really for a glimpse of his partner's wife.

original Spanish: Estoy convencido de que no soy el médico adecuado para tratar su caso. Por favor consulte a otro.
original English: I am convinced that I am not the right physician to treat your case so please consult another.

original Spanish: Estoy convencido de que no soy el médico adecuado para tratar su caso. Por favor consulte a otro.
original English: I am convinced that I am not the right physician to treat your case so please consult another.

original Spanish: Con mis mejores deseos por su pronta recuperación atentamente Franz Braun.
original English: With best wishes for your speedy recovery Sincerely Franz Braun

original Spanish: ¡Vaya suerte... ser tan amado por tu propia esposa!
original English: Lucky Devil... to be so loved by your own wife!

original Spanish: Quiero enseñarle a no tirar mis rosas por ahí.
original English: I want to teach him not to throw my roses away.

original Spanish: Cambió las tarjetas de lugar para poder sentarse al lado de Miss Hofer pero yo las volví a poner en su sitio.
original English: He changed the place cards so he could sit by Miss Hofer but I put them back.

original Spanish: ¡Ve por él Mizzi... baila con él... habla con él... no le pierdas de vista!
original English: Get him Mizzi... dance with him... talk to him don't let him out of your sight!

original Spanish: Ven arriba... y pide otro taxi por teléfono.
original English: Come upstairs... and phone for another taxi.

original Spanish: Sería mejor ir por atrás.
original English: We had better go in the back way.

original English: Already I have been offered 30000 dollars for these sketches but I could not bring myself to let go of them.

original Spanish: Todavía una de estas princesas rusas que quieren a toda costa ser pintadas por el maestro.
original English: So one of these Russian princesses whom at all costs love to be painted by the Master.

original Spanish: ¿Tienes pues el monopolio de ser pintado por el dueño?
original English: have they for instance a monopoly on being painted by the Master?

original Spanish: ¿Puede posar para mí?
original English: Would you model for me?

original Spanish: su gloria nació de las pinturas por las que usted posó.
original English: His glory was born on the paintings in which you modelled.

original Spanish: No puedo imaginar más bello final que morir para ser adorado
original English: I cannot imagine a more beautiful end than to die for being adored

original Spanish: Voy a pintar a Cesar asesinado por Brutus su hijo adoptivo.
original English: I want to paint Caesar assassinated by Brutus his adoptive son.

original Spanish: Switt toma notas de nuestra conversación espiritual para la obra que escribe sobre el maestro
original English: Switt takes notes from our table conversation for the work that he is writing on the Master

original Spanish: Posiblemente espera aumentar su crédito haciéndose pintar por el maestro.
original English: Possibly she hopes to increase her credit by being painted by the Master.

original Spanish: ¿Puedo pues venir desde mañana para la primera pose?
original English: I can come in the morning for the first pose?

original Spanish: Las visitas de Michael al maestro se hicieron cada vez más raras Dictadas solamente por la última conciencia del deber
original English: The visits of Michael to the Master were made more and more rarely only dictated by the last conscience of having to

original Spanish: El efecto es tan poco realista que juraríamos que los ojos han sido pintados por otra mano
original English: the effect is so unrealistic that we would swear that the eyes have been painted by another hand

original Spanish: Cómo decir por fin... Un ambiente puede ser tibio ¿es este paso?
original English: How to say I mean... an atmosphere can be cool not true?

original Spanish: Claude Zoret cerró la puerta a todo el mundo para crear su obra maestra en total soledad... y cuando esta fue terminada
original English: Claude Zoret closed the door to everybody to create his masterpiece completely alone and when this was finished

original Spanish: Hoy para la fiesta de regreso de Michael beberemos en vidrios ingleses
original English: Today for the celebration of return of Michael we will drink in English glasses

original Spanish: Quiero por fin ser un hombre libre no depender más de tus buenas gracias
original English: I want finally to be a free man Not to depend anymore on your good thanks

original Spanish: La princesa Zamikow pregunta por el señor Michael al teléfono.
original English: Princess Zamikow asks for Mr. Michael to the telephone.

original Spanish: Llegó por fin el día en el que el maestro expuso su obra.
original English: finally came the day in which the Master exposed his work.

original Spanish: Di a Alice que el último Monthieu pagó por su felicidad
original English: Tell Alice that the last Monthieu has paid for his happiness

original Spanish: Ahora te proponemos 60 000 dólares por los bocetos
original English: Now we propose to you 60000 dollars for the sketches

original Spanish: El señor Michael no está para nadie
original English: Mr. Michael will not be spoken to

original Spanish: ¿Velarás por eso?
original English: Swear that for me?

original English: Nobody would believe for instance that the entire lives of a peaceful American boy and girl   could be changed by a funny little war between two small countries far across the sea.

original English: Rollo Treadway - Heir to the Treadway fortune - a living proof that   every family tree must have its sap. (Actor :

original English: Under the cover of darkness the foreign agents prepared to carry out their plans.

original Spanish: Bonito momento para preguntarme eso. Estoy muerta de frío hambrienta y...
original English: This is a fine time to ask me that.

original Spanish: Encontramos a la tripulación en un lugar tranquilo y seguro para dormir.
original English: We now find the crew   with a safe and quiet place to sleep.

original Spanish: Instrucciones para Buceadores
original English: Instructions for Deep Sea Divers

original Spanish: La señora West está angustiada por la partida de su marido.
original English: Mrs. West in distress over her husband's departure

original Spanish: La comodidad significa distintas cosas para distintas personas.
original English: Comfort means different things to different people.

original Spanish: Pero dígame ¿cómo hizo para venir con mi maletín?
original English: - Pray tell me where did you come across my briefcase?

original Spanish: El Sr. West es conducido en un tour por Moscú.
original English: Mr. West is taken on a tour of Moscow.

original Spanish: Quiero escenificar algunas atrocidades bolcheviques para el americano idiota.
original English: I want to stage a few Bolshevik atrocities for the American idiot.

original Spanish: Le sacaremos por la chimenea.
original English: We'll get you out through the chimney.

original Spanish: En la oficina americana preocupados por la desaparición del Sr. West.
original English: At the American office everyone was worried about Mr. West's long absence.

original Spanish: Conocimiento para los trabajadores.
original English: Knowledge for all workers.

original Spanish: De cómo Krimilda lloraba la muerte de Sigfrido y de cómo el rey Atila solicitó su mano por medio de su embajador Rüdiger von Bechlam.
original English: How Kriemhild mourned over Siegfried and how King Attilla woos her through his ambassador Ruediger von Bechlam.

original Spanish: El fiel Hagen habla: ¡Allí señora donde nadie pueda usar el oro  para forjar armas contra los reyes de Burgundia!
original English: The loyal Hagen speaks: At a place my lady where no one can use the gold to forge weapons against the kings of Burgundy!

original Spanish: De cómo Krimilda se despidió de su patria y de cómo fue recibida por el rey Atila.
original English: How Kriemhild takes leave from her homeland and how she was received by King Attilla.

original Spanish: ¡Tened por seguro que volveré!
original English: Rest assured I'll come back!

original Spanish: ¿No queréis saludarlos por última vez señora?
original English: Don't you want to greet them one last time my Lady?

original Spanish: ¡Rüdiger escoge un reino de mis tierras en agradecimiento por esta mujer maravillosa!
original English: Ruediger choose a kingdom from my lands in gratitude for this wondrous woman!

original Spanish: Y cuando Atila subió a su montura cabalgó por todo el mundo. Y cuando su látigo dejaba de azotar el mundo gritaba:
original English: And when King Attilla his mount bestrode It was the world over which he rode And when he paused his whip to crack the world cried out

original Spanish: ¡Hagen Tronje luchará en duelo conmigo por su vida!
original English: Hagen Tronje shall duel with me for his life!

original Spanish: El señor Hagen Tronje sabe bien por qué nunca se separa de su espada!
original English: Lord Hagen Tronje knows well why he never lays aside his sword!

original Spanish: ¡Solicito salvoconducto de esta sala para mí y para los míos!
original English: Safe conduct from these halls I demand for me and my following!

original Spanish: ¡Rüdiger lo jurásteis por el filo de vuestra espada!
original English: Ruediger you swore by the sharp edge of your sword!

original Spanish: Gracias Krimilda. ¡Aunque nunca estuvimos unidos por amor por fin estaremos unidos por el odio!
original English: Thank you Kriemhild! Although we were never one in love we are at last united in hate!

original Spanish: ¡Quiero evitarle el rey Gunther que muera por las llamas!
original English: I wish to spare King Gunther death in the flames.

original Spanish: ¡Mirad! ¡Volker templa las cuerda de su violín para el último canto!
original English: Volker prepares his violin for a last song!

original Spanish: ¡Quiero partir para conquistar a Krimilda!
original English: I shall go there to win Kriemhild!

original Spanish: ¡Que la herencia se convierta en maldición para el heredero!
original English: All is lost. Cursed be the heritage of the heir!

original Spanish: ¡Volker acepta esta capa que yo misma he bordado a mano como agradecimiento por tu canto!
original English: I embroidered it myself.

original Spanish: ¡El puede ayudarnos a conquistar a Brunilda para ti!
original English: He may help us win Brunhild for you!

original Spanish: Prepárate para ir en busca de la novia rey Bunther pues Sigfrido el héroe fuerte conquistará a Brunilda para ti.
original English: Prepare for the quest to get your bride King Gunther. It is Siegfried the mighty hero who will win Brunhild for you.

original Spanish: De como Sigfrido conquistó a Brunilda para Brunther.
original English: How Siegfried won Brunhild for Gunther

original Spanish: Rey Bunther ¡concededme permiso para avisar al barco de que antes del anochecer llegarás para emprender el regreso a casa con Brunilda tu regia prometida!
original English: Give me leave King Gunther to make ready your ship for your royal bride. We should set sail for home before sundown!

original Spanish: ¡Yo arrojaré la piedra por ti!
original English: Make you the motions and my strength will win each contest.

original Spanish: ¿Debe convertirse el rey de Burgundia en objeto de burla por culpa de una mujer testaruda?
original English: Shall the king of Burgundy be scorned by an obstinate woman?

original Spanish: Rey Gunther me parece que es hora de que concedas permiso al señor Sigfrido para regresar a Xanten.
original English: It seems to me high time King Gunther that you send Siegfried back home to Xanten!

original Spanish: ¡Ejercia funciones de siervo para mi esposo!
original English: He did servant's work for my husband!

original Spanish: ¡Qué bien Krimilda que tú tengas por esposo al que mató al dragón el invulnerable!
original English: Good for you Kriemhild that your husband is the dragon slayer the invincible!

original Spanish: ¡Quién me garantiza que en el fragor de la lucha por una falta coincidencia una lanza no le alcance allí donde le alcanzó la hoja de tilo?
original English: Who warrants me that in the heat of battle not a chance blade should pierce where the lime leaf fell?

original Spanish: ¡Un puñado de oro rojo por un trago de vino blanco!
original English: A handful of red gold for a cooling draught of white wine!

original Spanish: Siempre he oído que te alababan como al más ágil de los varones. Si te parece hacemos una carrera tú y yo por el primer trago.
original English: I always heard of you as the fastest runner of all heroes let's run you and I for the first draught!

original Spanish: ¡Lealtad por lealtad Krimilda!
original English: Loyalty for loyalty Kriemhild.

original Spanish: ¡Sus manos... por el amor de Dios... sus manos!
original English: The hands ... holy God ... the hands ...

original Spanish: Vasseur niega los hechos... pero sus huellas digitales que estaban por todas partes constituyen una prueba irrefutable.
original English: Vasseur denied the act ... but the fingerprints which were found gave the real evidence.

original Spanish: La cabeza y el corazón guían el cuerpo y por tanto también las manos...
original English: The head the heart control the body ... also the hands ...

original Spanish: ¿Es por el dinero?
original English: Money? Money?

original Spanish: ¿Es por el dinero por lo que me persigue incluso en mis sueños?
original English: And therefore you follow me awake and in my dreams?

original Spanish: Las huellas digitales que se han encontrado por todas partes provienen de los dedos de Vasseur.
original English: These fingerprints which are clearly visible are the fingerprints of Vasseur.

original Spanish: La carta que ha incitado al viejo criado a dejar la casa ha sido escrita por la mano de Vasseur y esta mano ahora... ¡es la suya!
original English: The letter which passed through all the servants in the house was written by the hand of Vasseur and this hand is now - your hand!

original Spanish: Esperen quizá haya noticias para la edición de la tarde.
original English: Wait perhaps and we will have news for the evening paper.

original Spanish: Señor Orlac le damos las gracias por su testimonio...
original English: Mr. Orlac we thank you for your evidence ...

original Spanish: Esta película fue realizada en 1924 en Moscú por los estudios Mejrabpom-Rus.
original English: This film was made in 1924 in Moscow by Mejrabpom-Rus studios

original Spanish: El norteamericano MacBright se interesaba por negocios con la Rusia soviética y estaba en ruta hacia Moscú.
original English: The American MacBright who is interested in Soviet Russia is en route for Moscow...

original Spanish: Sin desear ser poético debo decirle que albergo por usted los más sinceros sentimientos y que mi salario es el de un trabajador de duodécimo nivel.
original English: Without wishing to be poetic I must tell you that I harbour for you the most sincere feelings and that my salary is that of a worker on the twelfth level.

original Spanish: El tiempo es valioso para aquellos que están ocupados.
original English: Time is precious for those who are busy.

original Spanish: Esperaban por un medio más adecuado de transporte.
original English: Waiting for a more suitable means of transport.

original Spanish: Qué amable de tu parte esperar por mí.
original English: How kind of you to have waited for me.

original Spanish: Tanto tiempo esperé por este maravilloso momento.
original English: How long I've waited for this wonderful moment.

original Spanish: Idiota es solamente un truco para la cámara.
original English: Idiot it's just a trick for the camera.

original Spanish: ¿Me podría mostrar su perfil por favor?
original English: Could you show me your profile please.

original Spanish: Existe nuevo interés por vida cotidiana en Rusia.
original English: The interest life Soviet Russia constantly growing.

original Spanish: Crees que podrías darme el look de un poeta por favor.
original English: Do you think you could give me the allure of a poet.

original Spanish: Latugin se apresuraba para terminar su película.
original English: Latugin hurries to finish his film.

original Spanish: Hoy se proyectará la película encargada por MacBright.
original English: Today brings the screening of the film commissioned by MacBright.

original Spanish: La vida cotidiana en el nuevo Moscú por A. Latugin
original English: Daily life in the New Moscow by A. Latugin.

original Spanish: Estimado señor MacBright después de pensar en su oferta he llegado a la conclusión de que para una pobre joven mujer como yo los escrúpulos son un lujo.
original English: Dear Mr. MacBright after thinking over your offer I have come to the conclusion that for a poor young woman like myself scrupules are a luxury.

original Spanish: Estimado señor MacBright ...después de pensar en su oferta he llegado a la conclusión de que para una pobre y joven mujer como yo los escrúpulos son un lujo.
original English: Dear Mr. MacBright After thinking over your offer I have come to the conclusion that:

original Spanish: Te pido por favor que sepas perdonarme.
original English: Please will you forgive me.

original Spanish: La causa de todo esto es mi amor por ti.
original English: The cause of all this is my love for you.

original Spanish: Mientras tanto le escribe al norteamericano para que la mantenga.
original English: And she's written to the American for an interview.

original Spanish: Dígale al señor MacBright que no deseo trabajar más para él.
original English: Tell Mr. MacBright that I don't wish to work for him any more.

original Spanish: Es de gran importancia para mí.
original English: It is of very great importance for me

original Spanish: Me siento halagada pero no estoy lista para casarme.
original English: I am flattered but I'm not ready for marriage.

original Spanish: Toda correspondencia para el señor MacBright debe ser reenviada a: Avenida 26ª 143 Nueva York.
original English: Any mail for Mr. MacBright should be forwarded to:

original Spanish: No está permitido saltar por las ventanas del tranvía.
original English: Jumping out of tram windows isn't allowed.

original Spanish: Una noche París se fue a dormir y a la mañana siguiente el vigilante nocturno de la Torre Eiffel se pregunta por qué nada se mueve en la ciudad y ya que nadie viene...
original English: One evening Paris went to sleep and the following morning the night watchman in the Eiffel Tower wonders why not a thing is stirring in the city and since no one comes...

original Spanish: ¡Me ocuparé de que todas las tiendas abran para vosotros hasta el Banco de Francia!
original English: I'll see that every shop is open for you even the Bank of France!

original Spanish: Pues trabajaba de operador de cine en una pequeña localidad... y también estudiaba para ser detective.
original English: While employed as a moving picture operator is a small town... theater he was also studying to be a detective.

original Spanish: Esta edición combina trozos de ocho copias para presentar la más completa reconstrucción posible.
original English: This edition combines portions of eight prints to present the most complete reconstruction believed possible.

original English: By arrangement with Watterson R. Rothacker

original English: But why can't you love me Gladys?

original Spanish: Quiero su asesoramiento legal. El Profesor Challenger amenaza con demandar al periódico por dudar sobre su historia de dinosaurios vivos.
original English: Profesor Challenger threatens to sue my paper... for doubting his yarn about live dinosaurs.

original Spanish: Desafortunadamente para la reputación del profesor y su veracidad se niega a dar la situación exacta de sus alegados descubrimientos y para mayor desgracia las fotografías en su poder están muy dañadas (ya que el profesor dice que su canoa volcó) para que puedan ser aceptadas como evidencia en este caso.
original English: Unfortunately for the professor's reputation for veracity he refuses to give the exact location of his alleged discoveries and still more unfortunately the photographs in his possession are so badly damaged... (when the Professor's canoe is said to have been overturned) ...that they certainly cannot be acepted as evidence in this case.

original Spanish: ¡Parece muy ansioso por perder la vida!
original English: You seem very anxious to lose your life!

original Spanish: Está aquí para verificar si la historia de Challenger es un camelo.
original English: He's here to check up on Challenger's cock-and-bull story.

original Spanish: - los estudiantes están fuera para soliviantar con preguntas molestas al viejo Challenger.
original English: - the students are out in force to heckle old Challenger.

original Spanish: - Si cualquiera de ustedes gusanos invertebrados son lo bastante valientes como para adentrarse conmigo en las impenetrables selvas donde viven estos monstruos!
original English: I will - if any of you spineless worms are brave enough to go back with me into the trackless jungles where these monsters live!

original Spanish: Y no estoy aquí esta noche para defender mis declaraciones - sino para exigir que se cree un comité para regresar conmigo al Mundo Perdido -
original English: And I'm not here tonight to defend my statements - but to demand that a committee be formed to go back to the Lost World with me -

original Spanish: Voluntarios para enfrentarse a la muerte - o a algo peor - por la causa de la ciencia.
original English: Volunteers to face death - or worse - for the sake of science.

original Spanish: Voluntarios para enfrentarse a la muerte - o a algo peor - por la causa de la ciencia.
original English: Volunteers to face death - or worse - for the sake of science.

original English: My husband promised to raise funds for a rescue party - but instead of getting people to help him he throws them out of windows and things!

original Spanish: Mi marido prometió recabar fondos para una expedición de rescate - pero en lugar de conseguir que las personas le ayuden ¡los golpea y tira por la ventana!

original Spanish: Finalmente nos encontramos en esa tierra de nadie formada por las indefinidas fronteras entre Perú Brasil y Colombia.
original English: Eventually we found ourselves in that no-man's-land which is formed by the half-defined frontiers between Peru Brazil and Colombia.

original Spanish: - ¡será mucho más útil para nosotros que usted mi querido señor!
original English: - he will be far more use to us than you my dear sir!

original English: Challenger has guided us to this spot and proven that the Plateau is a fact - ...but we have no reason to believe that any monsters are roaming about up there.

original Spanish: Chalenger nos ha guiado a este lugar y demostrado que la Meseta es real - pero no tenemos ninguna razón para creer que existan monstruos vagando por aquí.
original English: Challenger has guided us to this spot and proven that the Plateau is a fact - ...but we have no reason to believe that any monsters are roaming about up there.

original English: Paula says her father felled one of the trees on that pinnacle so that it dropped across the chasm and made a bridge.

original Spanish: ¡Mi fusil para cazar elefantes parece un rifle de perdigones!
original English: My elephant gun might as well be a bean-shooter!

original English: Jocko will be mighty lonesome down here without Miss. Paula - he climbed that big rock this morning to get to her - he can't bear that girl out of his sight!

original Spanish: Debemos establecer el campamento aquí - nuestro único refugio contra estos monstruos - si sobrevivimos tendremos mucho tiempo para buscar a su padre.
original English: We must establish camp here - our only refuge from these monsters - ...if we'll live long enough to search for your father.

original Spanish: Cuando suelte el árbol retrocederá con fuerza terrorífica - y calculando el arco que la piedra describirá cuando se mueva por el aire -
original English: When I release the tree it will snap back with terrific force - ...and by calculating the curve the rock will describe as it rushes through the air-

original Spanish: Trabajaremos toda la noche y haremos bastante escala para llegar a ustedes por la mañana.

original English: Go hunt up the professors - I have something to - tell Paula-

original English: If they get back we must be here to show them the way to the tunnel opening.

original English: I'd give my entrie personal fortune to get that beast to London - alive!

original English: Is there not in every human soul a first spark a divine element so that good can develop and radiate and evil can never completely extinguish?

original English: Fantine abandoned and alone in ParÃ­s decides to return to her home town to work.

original English: There's nothing like spying on people's actions than with those who pretend not to look.

original Spanish: -- ¡El trabajo se para por tres meses!
