original Spanish: Somos demasiado buenos por esperar.
original English: We are fed up with waiting.

original Spanish: Un café de provincias frecuentado por los elegantes de la época.
original English: A provincial cafe frequented by the smart set of the day.

original Spanish: Esta clase de mujeres son entregadas por ley a la discreción de la policía.
original English: This class of woman is subject to the law at the discretion of the police.

original Spanish: Acaba de ver a la sociedad representada por un votante insultado y atacado por una criatura al margen de todo.
original English: He has just seen a prominent member of society insulted and attacked by a creature from beyond the pale.

original Spanish: -- ¡Tienes para seis meses!
original English: I'm giving you 6 months!

original Spanish: Si soy lo que soy ¡es por miseria!
original English: I only became what I am because I'm destitute!

original Spanish: Hace seis semanas tras la escena por la Fantine le denuncié a la Súreté como antiguo forzado y usurpador de estado civil.
original English: Six weeks ago after that episode with Fantine... I denounced you to the prefecture as an ex-convict and usurper of public office.

original Spanish: Champmathieu por robo escalo etcétera.
original English: Champmathieu for robbery breaking and entering etc.

original Spanish: Ha sido identificado por tres coetáneos de la cárcel de Tolón...
original English: He has been identified by three fellow-inmates at Toulon jail.

original Spanish: - - Convocado por el juez. yo mismo lo he reconocido.
original English: Summoned by the judge I've recognised him myself.

original Spanish: Volveré para entregarle mis poderes pues debo ser castigado.
original English: I'll return to relinquish my authority for I must be punished.

original Spanish: Desde el momento en que impulsado por el deseo de vengarme he abusado de la policía no soy más que un delator que debe ser destituido.
original English: From the moment I tried to misuse my authority out of revenge I've been no more than an informer who must be dismissed.

original Spanish: -- ¿Debo sacrificarme por ese Champmathieu que ha robado?
original English: Am I going to sacrifice myself for that robber Champmathieu?

original Spanish: ¡Tanto peor para Champnathieu!
original English: Too bad for Champmathieu!

original Spanish: Pido para él los trabajos forzados a perpetuidad.
original English: I demand hard labour for life.".

original Spanish: - - Concededme tres días para ir a buscar a su hija.
original English: Give me three days to find her child.".

original Spanish: El resto será para los pobres.
original English: The rest can be for the poor.

original Spanish: La consigna de Javert había sido el respeto por la autoridad sin restricción ni objeciones.
original English: Javert's personal ethos called for unqualified respect for authority.

original Spanish: Pero su veneración por sor Simplice que nunca había mentido en su vida era una excepción.
original English: But his veneration for Sister Simplice who had never lied was exceptional.

original Spanish: No miraba ni a derecha ni a izquiera por miedo a ver cosas en las ramas y en la maleza.
original English: She looked to neither left nor right... for fear of seeing something in the branches or undergrowth.

original Spanish: Hace la ropa para mis hijas.
original English: She makes stockings for my daughters.

original Spanish: Es una pobre pequeña que cuido por caridad.
original English: She's a poor little wretch I raised out of charity...

original Spanish: -- ¡Es para ti!
original English: This is for you!

original Spanish: - - Si se mete por el callejón sin salida está hecho.
original English: If he goes down the dead-end alley he' done for!

original Spanish: - - Ganaréis cien francos si me dais asilo por esta noche.
original English: You'll get 100 francs if you give me a refuge for tonight.

original Spanish: Esa campana es para advertirlas cuando yo paso.
original English: The bell is to warn them when I pass.

original Spanish: El padre pobre a media pensión y fiel al emperador perseguido por la Restauración había cedido por el interés de su hijo que creció bajo los más puros sentimientos realistas y también en la creencia fanática de que Bonaparte y sus partidarios eran unos bandidos
original English: The father poor on a half-pension faithful to the Emperor persecuted by the restoration... had given up any interest in his son who grew up... with pure royalist sentiments and a fanatic belief that Bonaparte and his supporters were bandits

original Spanish: Marius se vio preso por una adoración póstuma hacia su padre.
original English: Marius embraced a posthumous adoration of his father.

original Spanish: Con mis respetuosos sentimientos tengo el honor de ser madame Don Álvarez capitán español de caballería realista refugiado en Francia sin recursos para continuar su viaje.
original English: Don Alvarez Spanish cavalry captain Royalist refugee in France without the means needed to continue my journey.

original Spanish: Me permito rogarle que me conceda el precioso favor de su simpatía para interesarse por un hombre de letras que acaba de ver rechazado un drama en el Theâtre Francais.
original English: I allow myself to beg you to grant me the precious favour of your sympathy to take an interest in a man of letters whose drama was just rejected by the Theatre Francais.

original Spanish: Me permito rogarle que me conceda el precioso favor de su simpatía para interesarse por un hombre de letras que acaba de ver rechazado un drama en el Theâtre Francais.
original English: I allow myself to beg you to grant me the precious favour of your sympathy to take an interest in a man of letters whose drama was just rejected by the Theatre Francais.

original Spanish: Dos luises para la chica... ¡Menuda pitanza!
original English: How it shines! This is going to feed us!

original Spanish: - - Salid por la puerta.
original English: Come through the door...

original Spanish: La cuerda de forzados que se trasladaban a la cárcel por etapas.
original English: The chain of convicts transferred to a jail in stages.

original Spanish: Al día siguiente por la noche.
original English: The following night.

original Spanish: -- ¿Qué me importa si me encuentran mañana muerta a golpes por mi padre?
original English: What do I care if I'm found tomorrow stabbed to death by my own father?

original Spanish: Señor vengo a pediros permiso para casarme.
original English: Sir I come to ask your permission to marry.

original Spanish: La Fayette ha sido amenazado por los dragones de Luis-Felipe en el funeral del general
original English: LaFayette was menaced by Louis-Phillipe dragoons at General Lamarque's funeral.

original Spanish: Cuando estemos en la ventana ¡al diablo con quien avance por la calle!
original English: Once we're at the window to hell with anyone advancing!

original Spanish: Ahora por mi dolor prométeme que cuando esté muerta me besarás en la frente.
original English: And now do something for me..." "Promise me that when I die you'll kiss me on the forehead.

original Spanish: - - Somos feos en Nanterre es por culpa de Voltaire.
original English: We're ugly in Nanterre It's because of Voltaire.

original Spanish: Y estúpidos en Palaisseau es por culpa de Rousseau.
original English: And stupid in Palaisseau It's because of Rousseau.

original Spanish: Alegre es mi carácter por culpa de Voltaire.
original English: Happy is my character because of Voltaire.

original Spanish: Mísero es mi ropaje por culpa de Rousseau.
original English: My clothes are in tatters because of Rousseau.

original Spanish: Me caigo al suelo por culpa de Voltaire.
original English: I fall to the ground because of Voltaire.

original Spanish: La nariz contra la corriente es por culpa de...
original English: My face in the gutter because of...

original Spanish: - - Fingí una herida para no quedar mal.
original English: I faked an injury so as not to to commit a forgery.

original Spanish: Todo para su amor absorta por sus ocupaciones múltiples y nuevas Cosette se hizo menos tierna para Jean Valjean.
original English: Gripped by his love and devoted to many new activities... her feelings for Jean Valjean begin to weaken.

original Spanish: Todo para su amor absorta por sus ocupaciones múltiples y nuevas Cosette se hizo menos tierna para Jean Valjean.
original English: Gripped by his love and devoted to many new activities... her feelings for Jean Valjean begin to weaken.

original Spanish: Aunque la suerte fue para él muy extraña. El vivió.
original English: Although fate had been strange to him he was alive.

original Spanish: Matsuzumi Eizan es interpretado por Seki Misao.
original English: Matsuzumi Eizan played by Seki Misao.

original Spanish: El maestro sonríe cuando sus alumnos se acercan a él... para desearle felicidad.
original English: The master smiles as his students come to congratulate him on his good fortune.

original Spanish: Namie la hija de Eizan es conocida por su incontestable belleza.
original English: Eizan's daughter Namie is known far and wide for her stunning beauty.

original Spanish: Namie es interpretada por Tamaki Utako.
original English: Namie played by Tamaki Utako.

original Spanish: No obstante hay un joven samurai llamado Kuritomi Heizaburo... cuya pasión por Namie supera a la de los demás.
original English: However a young samurai. Kuritomi Heizaburo burns with a passion for Namie that outshines the others.

original Spanish: Kuritomi Heizaburo es interpretado por Bando Tsumasaburo.
original English: Kuritomi Heizaburo by Bando Tsumasaburo.

original Spanish: Uno tras otro todos los samuráis se dirigen a su maestro para desearle lo mejor.
original English: One by one the samurai toast their master and wish him the best.

original Spanish: Namioka es interpretado por Yamamura Momotaro.
original English: Namioka is played by Yamamura Momotaro.

original Spanish: Namioka ha bebido demasiado y por ello se le nubla la vista.
original English: He has drunk too much and everything appears in a thick haze.

original Spanish: Pero debido a su alto rango los demás se alejan de él y Namioka se siente molesto por ello.
original English: His high rank keeps the others away and Namioka is annoyed.

original Spanish: ¿Pero quién te crees que eres para rechazar mi invitación?
original English: Who are you to refuse my bowl!

original Spanish: ¿Es que eso no significa nada para ti?
original English: Doesn't that mean anything to you?

original Spanish: Aquí no hay sitio para los rufianes.
original English: There's no room for ruffians here.

original Spanish: Una tarde mientras Heizaburo vagaba por la ciudad sufriendo por la frialdad de Namie nuestro héroe se cruzó... con tres samuráis que conversaban.
original English: One afternoon as he was wandering around town and pondering over Namie's coldness our hero came across three chatting samurai.

original Spanish: Pero estos tres samuráis no eran rivales para Heizaburo.
original English: But the three samurai were no match for Heizaburo.

original Spanish: Casualmente los compañeros de clase de Heizaburo pasaban por allí.
original English: By chance Heizaburo's classmates came along.

original Spanish: Todo lo hice para defender su honor y van y me expulsan.
original English: All I tried to do was defend her name. And now I'm kicked out.

original Spanish: ¿Qué he hecho yo para merecer esto?
original English: What did I do to deserve this?

original Spanish: Sé que se me advirtió de que no hiciera cosas así pero lo hice para defender el honor de Namie.
original English: Even if I did what I was told not to do it was only to protect Namie's honor.

original Spanish: ¿Quién anda por ahí?
original English: Who's there?

original Spanish: Eres una vergüenza para los samuráis.
original English: You are a shame to the name of the samurai.

original Spanish: Estaba a punto de desenvainar la katana para hacerse escuchar pero al contemplar las lágrimas de Namie perdió sus energías.
original English: He was ready to draw his sword and show them. But one look at Namie's tears and he lost all force.

original Spanish: Al pasar por la ciudad la gente observa la triste imagen de este ángel caído.
original English: Watch as he wanders through town. A sad sight this fallen angel.

original Spanish: Ochio es interpretada por Mori Shizuko.
original English: Ochio played by MoriShizuko.

original Spanish: ¿Es que este mundo no está formado más que por imágenes perecederas?
original English: Is the world no more than fleeting images?

original Spanish: Heizaburo no estaba para bromas.
original English: Heizaburo was in no mood for a joke.

original Spanish: Pero no para Heizaburo como ahora veremos.
original English: But Heizaburo didn't see it that way.

original Spanish: Pero por muy bajo que hubiese caído Heizaburo no era un ladrón así que la oferta le enfureció aún más.
original English: However low he may have fallen Heizaburo is no thief. The offering infuriates him.

original Spanish: ¡No puedo por favor perdóneme!
original English: What am I to do... Please forgive me.

original Spanish: Sólo para defenderse Heizaburo se resistía a ser arrestado.
original English: Only to defend himself Heizaburo resisted arrest.

original Spanish: Me quedaré por aquí.
original English: I'll stick around here.

original Spanish: Empezó a desesperarse por lo lamentable de su situación.
original English: He began to despair at his sorry state.

original Spanish: Interpretado por Nakamura Kotonosuke.
original English: Played by Nakamura Kotonosuke.

original Spanish: La cuenta por favor.
original English: The bill please.

original Spanish: Interpretado por Arashi Shigeo.
original English: Played by ArashiShigeo.

original Spanish: Me alegro de verte por aquí.
original English: I'm so glad to see her.

original Spanish: Ochio una más por favor.
original English: Ochio I'd like one more if you please.

original Spanish: Heizaburo trató por todos los medios de resolverlo pero mientras llegó la guardia.
original English: Heizaburo tried his best to break it up but in no time at all the police arrived.

original Spanish: Cuando le veían aparecer la gente huía temiendo por sus vidas.
original English: At the sight of him the townspeople ran for their lives.

original Spanish: De esta manera Heizaburo sufrió los prejuicios y el desprecio de una sociedad que juzga a los hombres por su apariencia y no por sus actos o forma de ser.
original English: Thus Heizaburo suffered the ignorance and prejudices of a society that judges a man on appearance and not on his true self or deeds.

original Spanish: Espera por favor.
original English: Please wait.

original Spanish: Sólo por ti.
original English: Only for you.

original Spanish: Y para ello planeó secuestrar a Ochio y traérsela a Heizaburo.
original English: So he planned to kidnap Ochio and bring her to Heizaburo.

original Spanish: No por favor.
original English: Please. No.

original Spanish: ¡No me toques por favor!
original English: Please don't touch me.

original Spanish: No por favor.
original English: Please. No.

original Spanish: Las cosas están tranquilas por acá.
original English: It's gotten quiet in there.

original Spanish: Sin embargo la casa estaba rodeada por la guardia.
original English: But the house was already surrounded by the police.

original Spanish: Heizaburo y los demás fueron reducidos por aquella despiadada guardia.
original English: Heizaburo and the rest were hauled away by the merciless police.

original Spanish: Seis meses pasaron lentamente para Heizaburo encerrado en una fría celda.
original English: Six months passed slowly as Heizaburo wasted away in a cold cell.

original Spanish: ¿Ha visto a algún extraño por acá?
original English: See anyone strange?

original Spanish: El fugitivo conducido por el amor sólo tenía a Ochio en mente.
original English: The runaway driven by his love had only one thought. Ochio.

original Spanish: ¡Mirad por ahí!
original English: Check over here!

original Spanish: La Ochio de sus sueños aquella mujer por la que soportó 6 meses de prisión ya no era para él.
original English: The Ochio of his dreams who had sustained him for 6 months in the cell was no more.

original Spanish: La Ochio de sus sueños aquella mujer por la que soportó 6 meses de prisión ya no era para él.
original English: The Ochio of his dreams who had sustained him for 6 months in the cell was no more.

original Spanish: Heizaburo se deshizo en lágrimas deprimido por el amor perdido.
original English: Heizaburo forgot himself in tears for his lost love.

original Spanish: ¡Se te va la fuerza por la boca Heizaburo!
original English: You talk big Heizaburo!

original Spanish: El jardín pertenece a la casa de un respetable señor local Akagi Jirozo interpretado por Nakamura Kichimatsu.
original English: This is the house of a respected local lord Akagi Jirozo played by Nakamura Kichimatsu.

original Spanish: ¡Creo que se fue por allá!
original English: I think I saw him over there!

original Spanish: Cuando Heizaburo supo que su patrón era conocido en la ciudad por su sabiduría y nobleza empezó a respetarle y admirarle.
original English: When Heizaburo heard that his patron was known around town for his wisdom and nobility he came to respect him greatly.

original Spanish: Santa el Payaso interpretado por Yasuda Zenichiro.
original English: Santa the Fool. Yasuda Zenichiro.

original Spanish: No soy rival para ti.
original English: I'm no match for you.

original Spanish: Usaba toda su riqueza para tapar la bajeza de sus actos.
original English: He used his wealth to hide the vileness of his deeds.

original Spanish: Los huéspedes no eran otros que... Namie el primer amor de Heizaburo y su marido Shinnojo interpretado por Haruji Kensaku.
original English: The "guests"are none other than Heizaburo's first love Namie and her husband Shinnojo played by HarujiKensaku.

original Spanish: Enfermo y débil Shinnojo da las gracias a Jirozo por su hospitalidad.
original English: Sick and weak Shinnojo thanks Jirozo for his kihdness.

original Spanish: Pero por supuesto Jirozo tenía otros planes para aquella irresistible belleza.
original English: But of course he had his own plans for the unsuspecting beauty.

original Spanish: Pero por supuesto Jirozo tenía otros planes para aquella irresistible belleza.
original English: But of course he had his own plans for the unsuspecting beauty.

original Spanish: Desde luego no eres de por aquí.
original English: You're no local yokel.

original Spanish: No he visto semejante belleza por estos lares.
original English: I've never seen such beauty.

original Spanish: ¿Es que el sake de un plebeyo no es suficiente para la mujer de un samurai?
original English: So a commoner's sake isn't good enough for a samurais wife?

original Spanish: ¿Así que lo prefieres por las malas eh?
original English: So you like it rough do you?

original Spanish: Nuestros caminos por fin se han cruzado.
original English: Our paths finally met.

original Spanish: Por favor tenga compasión por esta pobre pareja de vagabundos.
original English: Please have some compassion for a poor wandering couple.

original Spanish: Deje que nos vayamos por compasión.
original English: Let us go. Please...

original Spanish: ¿Quién eres tú para decirme a quién debo o no debo humillar?
original English: Who are you to tell me who to bully?

original Spanish: ¡Si quieres forzarla tendrá que ser por encima de mi cadáver!
original English: You'll touch her only over my dead body!

original Spanish: Un samurai nunca se olvida de sus deudas pero tampoco incurre en el mal para pagarlas.
original English: A samurai never forgets a debt. But neither will he commit evil to repay it.

original Spanish: Su corazón estaba excitado por la rabia y la rebeldía.
original English: His heart burned with rage and rebellion.

original Spanish: En medio de este júbilo un hombre era ignorado por todos.
original English: Amongst all this joy - one forsaken man is dragged away.

original Spanish: ¡Qué triste fin para nuestro héroe!
original English: What a miserable end for our hero.

original Spanish: Dos mujeres por las que di todo...
original English: The two women for whom he gave up everything...

original Spanish: Aunque Heizaburo no lo pudo ver dos almas la del samurai y su esposa Namie rezaron por él.
original English: Unseen to Heizaburo two lost souls prayed for him.

original Spanish: Incapaces de poder hacer otra cosa Namie y Shinnojo rezaron por su alma.
original English: Unable to do more Namie and Shinnojo prayed for his soul.

original Spanish: Este hombre tuvo que sufrir para que ellas dos pudieran vivir.
original English: One man dragged away so that two may live.

original Spanish: La música flota por el hall y los pasillos incluso por las oficinas donde se firma un extraño contrato.
original English: Melody floats through hall and corridor even to the executive offices where a strange deal is being closed.

original Spanish: ¡El acomodador del Palco 5 no se reirá..." "...cuando le pregunten por los fantasmas de la ópera!
original English: The attendant of Box Five will not laugh when you ask about the opera ghost!

original Spanish: Cualquier intento por su parte de interferir en la representación será desastroso para su carrera.
original English: Any jealous attempt on your part to interefere with the performance will prove disastrous to your career.

original Spanish: Cualquier intento por su parte de interferir en la representación será desastroso para su carrera.
original English: Any jealous attempt on your part to interefere with the performance will prove disastrous to your career.

original Spanish: Mademoiselle Carlotta Si se presenta en el teatro mañana por la noche la prevengo de que una gran desgracia podría sucederle. Le aconsejo que se encuentre "indispuesta".
original English: Mlle Carlotta If you appear tomorrow night you must be prepared for a great misfortune and therefore I advise you to be "ill" The Phantom

original Spanish: Pero mi hija contará mañana por la noche ¡Vamos si cantará!
original English: But my daughter shall sing tomorrow night come what may!

original Spanish: Queridos empresarios... El papel de "Marguerite" será interpretado mañana por la noche por Christine Daaé sustituyendo a Carlotta. El Fantasma
original English: My dear Managers - The role of "Marguerite" shall be sung again tomorrow evening by Christine Daae instead of Carlotta The Phantom

original Spanish: Animada por su madre Carlotta desafió la amenaza y la noche siguiente se presentó para representar el papel de "Marguerite".
original English: Encouraged by her mother Carlotta defied every warning and the following evening appeared as - "Marguerite'.

original Spanish: Animada por su madre Carlotta desafió la amenaza y la noche siguiente se presentó para representar el papel de "Marguerite".
original English: Encouraged by her mother Carlotta defied every warning and the following evening appeared as - "Marguerite'.

original Spanish: Este sentimiento que ha surgido en mí alentado por tu pureza..." "...suplica ahora por tu amor!
original English: So that which is good within me aroused by your purity might plead for your love.

original Spanish: Estaré en el Baile de Máscaras mañana por la noche pero no estaré sola. ¡Ten cuidado!
original English: I will be at the Bal Masque tomorrow night but not alone beware!

original Spanish: Desterrado a la Isla del Diablo por sus crímenes. EVADIDO.
original English: ESCAPED NOW AT LARGE

original Spanish: Seca tus lágrimas querida y apresúrate. ¡Tienes que estar lista para la función!
original English: Dry your tears dear and hasten -- you must make ready for your performance!

original Spanish: Temiendo por la seguridad de su hermano el Comandante de Chagny fue a la Ópera esa noche.
original English: Fear for his brother's safety brought Comte de Chagny to the Opera house that night.

original Spanish: Ya no segregaré el veneno del odio como un sapo en estos sótanos asquerosos..." "¡... será amor por ti!
original English: No Longer like a toad in these foul cellarswill i secrete the venom of hatred   for you shall bring me love!

original Spanish: Ella reunía cada semana a las comadres de la comarca para cotillear a gusto.
original English: She gathered the town gossips together once a week to let her tongue wag freely.

original Spanish: - Ya no queda melón para tí.
original English: There's no more melon for you.

original Spanish: - ¿Me quieres dar una miga de pan para acabar mi sopa?
original English: Could you pass me some bread to finish off my compote?

original Spanish: - Mamá por favor...
original English: Mom please...

original Spanish: ¡No sé por que oreja te entra! ¡Quédate amiguito y lloriquea a tu gusto!
original English: You're as fickle as the wind!

original Spanish: Haz que no esté obligado a ir al gallinero mañana por la noche.
original English: I don't want to go to the henhouse again tomorrow night.

original Spanish: - ¡Qué le haría yo al cielo para haber merecido un muchacho así!
original English: What in heaven's name have I done to deserve such a child!

original Spanish: - Pero para irse hace falta dinero.
original English: To run away we need money.

original Spanish: - Y a Madame Lepic no le gusta que tenga debilidad por él.
original English: And Mrs. Lepic doesn't like me because I take pity on him.

original Spanish: He aquí una de esas seducciones o por lo menos el "Nuevo Edén" intenta serlo.
original English: Here is one of those seductions or at least the "New Eden" tries to be.

original Spanish: El colmo del horror para el director es un teatro vacío... (El director Duval - Hugo Thimig)
original English: The height of horror for the director is an empty theater... (Director Duval Hugo Thimig)

original Spanish: En Montmartre entre los cabarets iluminados y el espectáculo típico ofrecido por La Butte un faro atrae a los noctámbulos parisinos.
original English: In Montmartre among the illuminated cabarets and the typical show offered by La Butte a lighthouse attracts Parisian nocturnal.

original Spanish: Ese joven que no para de mirarnos ¿es uno de tus amigos?
original English: That young man who keeps looking at us are you one of your friends?

original Spanish: Pero Miles ya ha olvidado por completo a la primera.
original English: But Miles has already completely forgotten the first one.

original Spanish: Christina Landrolet estaba celosa no del interés de Maudry por Célimène sino del éxito de Célimène que parecía sobrepasar el suyo.
original English: Christina Landrolet was jealous not of Maudry's interest in Célimène but of the success of Célimène which seemed to surpass his.

original Spanish: La bella Célimène tiene bastante juicio como para saber que ...hoy en día vale más servir al dinero que al amor.
original English: The beautiful Célimène has enough judgment to know that Nowadays it is better to serve money than love.

original Spanish: Llegó el momento soñado por Christina de intentar con ciertas perspectivas de éxito reconquistar al vizconde de Maudry.
original English: The moment dreamed up by Christina to try With certain prospects of success reconquer the viscount of Maudry.

original Spanish: Tengo una sorpresa para ti...
original English: I have a surprise for you...

original Spanish: Cada vez más sensible a la atracción singular ejercida por Miles
original English: Increasingly sensitive to the unique attraction exerted by Miles

original Spanish: Susana como para aturdirse y escapar al abismo sentimental que se abría a sus pies se lanzó al torbellino del baile más alocado el alegre charlestón...
original English: Susana as if to confuse herself and escape the sentimental abyss that opened up her feet he threw himself into the whirlwind of the most crazy dance the merry charlestun...

original Spanish: Lo que para Célimène no era más que una simple pirueta de coquetería femenina hacía que a Miles el corazón se le saltara del pecho.
original English: What for Célimène was no more than a simple pirouette of female coquettier it made Miles's heart skip from his chest.

original Spanish: ¿De dónde sacarás la fortuna para el tren de vida de esa mujer?
original English: Where will you get the fortune for that woman's life train?

original Spanish: ¡Yo te lo daría todo mi amor mi futuro lucharía por ti contra toda la sociedad!
original English: I would give it to you all my love my future I would fight for you against the whole society!

original Spanish: Realmente parecen hechos el uno para el otro.
original English: Actually they seem made for each other.

original Spanish: Y Célimène sintió por primera vez en su vida que su corazón de mujer frívola se le salía del pecho.
original English: And Célimène felt for the first time in her life that her heart of a woman who was frivolous came out of her chest.

original Spanish: Había hecho una locura pero aquella mujer era todo para él...
original English: He had done crazy but that woman was everything to him...

original Spanish: No he podido resistirme no sé qué me atrae en ti la paz o la angustia que siento. Sólo pienso en ti sólo quiero estar a tu lado y para eso estoy dispuesta a abandonarlo todo... ¡Todo!

original English: We suggest that you forthwith remove from the program the "Human Question" and the clown Coco who has been expelled from the union due to information received concerning their anti-social activities.

original English: Ella Cinders the stepdaughter slaves for the entire family.

original English: In that contest lay way out... Ella decided it was time to act... and to act she must get that book.

original Spanish: Lo más importante para convertirse en estrella son los ojos.
original English: The greatest requisite to stardom is the eyes.

original Spanish: Esas fotos para el concurso costaban tres dólares... por lo que durante tres tardes Ella cuidaba a los chicos de los vecinos... a un dólar cada uno.
original English: Those photos for the contest cost three dollars... so for three evening Ella minded the neighbors' kids... at one dollar per mind.

original Spanish: Esas fotos para el concurso costaban tres dólares... por lo que durante tres tardes Ella cuidaba a los chicos de los vecinos... a un dólar cada uno.
original English: Those photos for the contest cost three dollars... so for three evening Ella minded the neighbors' kids... at one dollar per mind.

original Spanish: Cuando Ella se puso sus mejores ropas para el fotógrafo seis mariposas rieron hasta morir.
original English: When Ella got into her best clothes for the photographer six moths laughed until they died.

original Spanish: ¿Seguro que mi foto para los jueces estará a tiempo?
original English: You'll be sure to get my photo to the judges on time?

original Spanish: Oh vaya por Dios... sí...
original English: Oh dear me... yes...

original Spanish: ¿Por qué intentaba... coquetear por todas partes... para que Lotta pudiera ganar?
original English: Why you old Eaglebeak... you tried to vamp me all over the place... so Lotta could win!

original Spanish: ¿Por qué intentaba... coquetear por todas partes... para que Lotta pudiera ganar?
original English: Why you old Eaglebeak... you tried to vamp me all over the place... so Lotta could win!

original Spanish: Equipada por los comerciantes de Roseville todo preparado para triunfar en Hollywood.
original English: Outfitted by Roseville merchants... all ready for Hollywood... Ella was willing to let bygones be has-beens.

original Spanish: Equipada por los comerciantes de Roseville todo preparado para triunfar en Hollywood.
original English: Outfitted by Roseville merchants... all ready for Hollywood... Ella was willing to let bygones be has-beens.

original English: A crowd gathered at the station to bit Ella "bon ami". But were oh where was Ella?

original Spanish: Miss Cinders no conoce más que las cosas bellas de la vida ha sido criada como una frágil flor por quienes la aman y esperamos que nada se rompa antes...
original English: MISS CINDERS HAS KNOWN NOTHING BUT THE BEAUTIFUL THINGS IN LIFE SHE HAS BEEN CHERISHED AS A FRAGILE FLOWER BY HER LOVED ONES AND WE HOPE THE STEM WON'T BREAK BEFORE

original Spanish: Después del Estado de Colorado vino el Estado de Asombro para Ella.
original English: After the state of Colorado came the State of Amazement.

original Spanish: Nunca esperó tener un coche para ella sola.

original English: Help... please... a lion...

original English: Dad I'm leaving for Hollywood tomorrow..

original English: First you disgrace me by turning iceman and now you've fallen head over heels in love with a nobody!

original English: The scenes for Ella's next picture were "shot" far from the studio... but Ella was quite "at home" in her part.

original Spanish: Llego mañana para preguntarte algo muy importante.

original English: - Then in a few days I'll be there with my daughter... Thank you for the idea!

original English: ... 700m below the mountain.

original Spanish: - Acepte este dinero no por reparación del mal que le he hecho sino por el futuro de sus hijos. -
original English: Accept this money;

original Spanish: ¡Pero los impíos serán aniquilados por la muerte!

original English: And if thou would summon the Prince of Darkness to aid thee and give thee all the might and glory of the world go to a crossroad and call on him three times.

original Spanish: ¡Rezaré siempre por ti al crucificado si la curas!
original English: In the name of Christ crucified help my child!

original Spanish: ¡Todo hombre es libre de optar por la muerte!
original English: Death sets all men free!

original English: Our pact stands for eternity?

original English: Three little drops from this love potion by night and all the girls' hearts will be yours!

original English: A small bouquet for the bridegroom a little wreath for the bride!

original English: He gave me this necklace as a gift for you!

original Spanish: Primero celebrad la misa de difuntos por mi.Después. ¡a la picota con la puta!
original English: First read a requiem. Mass for me! Then to the stocks with this harlot!

original Spanish: La Tierra y el Universo temblarán cuando los muertos se levanten para responder a su Señor....
original English: Now death and nature with surprise Behold the trembling sinners rise To meet the Judge's searching eyes.

original Spanish: ¡La hoguera para la infanticida!
original English: To the stake with the child murderer!

original Spanish: ¡Ya están preparando la hoguera para tu querida!
original English: Even now they build her funeral pyre!

original Spanish: ¡Tus deseos son órdenes para mí!
original English: What you wish I must grant!

original Spanish: ¡Aquí no hay paso para tí!
original English: Here is no place for thee!

original English: Brother Paul" gentle soul preaching a doctrine of love in a spot... ..where English was used only on billiard balls.

original Spanish: Será todo por hoy James".
original English: We'll just kidnap "Manners" and argue it out with him back at the club. That will be all for today James.

original Spanish: ...y cuando leí que buscaba cómo gastarse algo de su dinero resolví pedirle usar tan solo un poco... para ayudar a mi padre a establecer sus misiones...
original English: and when I read that you wanted suggestion or how to spend some of your money. I determined... ..to ask you to use just a little of it to help my father establish a mission in "SLATTERY SQUARE".

original Spanish: Si tan sólo tuviera dinero para una misión... no tendría que estar aquí en la calle".
original English: I wouldn't have to be out here on the money for a mission.

original Spanish: ¡Me pone enfermo esto de... hacer buenos actos sólo para salir en el diario!
original English: It makes me sick this doing good just to get your name in the paper.

original English: You must meet my daughter she's so anxious to tell you what she thinks of you.

original English: This guy is a one-man crime wave!

original English: There are ore hymn books in the store-room I'll get them.

original English: Fellers if this guy can preach like he can hit it's gonna be a tough season for "Satan"!

original English: The underworld came to the surface for the big event.

original English: The boys rescued me but they're a little dizzy from the excitement... ..and I'll have to stick with them to keep them out of trouble.

original Spanish: ¡Aprisa chicos por favor!
original English: Hurry boys please!

original English: I've followed you for ten minutes and you've done everything but go over "Niagara Falls" in a barrel!

original Spanish: Finalmente estoy rumbo a casa. Ya estoy lejos de Sumatra y en poco tiempo estaré con ustedes. Les envío estos "regalos de invitado" por adelantado.
original English: I am finally swimming toward home Sumatra lies behind me and in a short while I shall be with you I am sending these 'guest present' on ahead.

original Spanish: ¿Hay algún motivo por el que no quiera entrar a su casa?
original English: Is there some reason you're reluctant to enter your house?

original Spanish: Atormentado por miedos inexplicables. Me es imposible tocar un cuchillo.
original English: ...It is impossible for me to touch a knife...!

original Spanish: No hay motivo para lamentarse.
original English: There's no reason to despair.

original Spanish: Sólo puede ser curado cuando trabajemos juntos... para descubrir los conflictos mentales del inconsciente que... lo llevaron a su enfermedad.
original English: You can be cured only when we have worked together to uncover the 'unconscious' psychological conflicts which led to your illness!

original Spanish: Comenzará por contarme todo lo que vea en su mente.
original English: You will start by telling me everything you see in your mind's eye!

original Spanish: No omita ninguna idea por considerarla irrelevante o sin sentido.
original English: Don't hold back anything because you think it is unimportant or nonsensical!

original Spanish: ¿Su esposa le ha dado una razón para estar celoso de su primo?
original English: Did your wife give you a reason to be jealous of her cousin?

original Spanish: En su pesadilla la pequeña herida en el cuello de su esposa se proyectó al... crimen de la casa vecina por esta razón se vio... a si mismo como un asesino.
original English: In your nightmare the small wound on your wife's neck flowed together with the crime in the nearby house for this reason you saw yourself condemned as a murderer.

original Spanish: Tengo mucho por lo que disculparme.
original English: I've got a lot to apologize for!

original English: Those well-known sportsmen who participated in the making of THE HOLY MOUNTAIN ask the audience not to mistake their performances for trick photography.

original Spanish: La gran carrera de esquí es practicada por grandes esquiadores alemanes noruegos y austriacos.
original English: The big ski race is performed by German Norwegian and Austrian master skiers.

original English: The screenplay to this motion picture was inspired by actual events that occurred during a twenty year period in the life of the great mountains.

original Spanish: y así como Diotima baila...baila para saciar su nostalgia por él a quien ella ha visto en sus sueños sobre la más alta cima de montaña.

original English: When he comes home today I have a surprise for him.

original English: But no single man has the strength to lift a body from an overhang.

original Spanish: Bebamos por el bienestar de nuestro ausente maestro esquiador.
original English: We drink to the welfare of our absent ski-master.

original Spanish: ¿Por qué... por qué?

original Spanish: – Ya tengo suficiente trabajo para él.
original English: – I have enough of my own work for him!

original English: I was given my land for service not for birth-rank.

original Spanish: Así lo hacía el terrateniente para aumentar sus trabajadores en esos tiempos.
original English: Such was the landowner's means of increasing his labor force in these times.

original English: I'm going to the tsar's estate to make petition against an offender!

original English: – That impious cur carted off my peasants for himself!

original English: The tsar's pride – a flax-scutching wheel – had been invented by a captive Livonian.

original English: The tsar's pride – a flax-scutching wheel – had been invented by a captive Livonian.

original English: – Those wings of his are satanic and he seduced Fimka to fly over the sea with him!

original English: – It's time thou knew that such matters are handled by the tsar's court.

original English: They were opposed by the petty gentry and merchant folk who were supported by the tsar...

original English: The oprichniki – low-born boyars – had their own scores to settle with the feudal lords (hereditary princes) thus the oprichniki always took the chance to avenge themselves...

original English: And on this 18th day of the month of March the tsar and grand prince of all Rus' hath heard this case and ordered to have the chamberlain Vasily Petrovich Lupatov raised in rank ABOVE the boyar-prince Stepan Yuryevich Kurlyatev.

original English: This artifice as it was constructed with the Devil's aid is to be burned by fire after the holy liturgy is read.

original English: What secrets that night held and for whom was it the last.

original English: The medical world has gathered to watch the American surgeon Arthur Burdon demonstrate a new miracle in surgery.

original Spanish: Y aquí Oliver Haddo ha buscado durante meses la antigua fórmula mágica para crear vida humana.
original English: Here Oliver Haddo has made a search for months for an old magic formula for the magical creation of human life.

original English: If it were not forbidden I would have you cut one of these beautiful roses for me.

original English: And then

original English: I am very sorry about the tragedy that occurred last night.

original Spanish: Vine para pedirle disculpas.
original English: I came to express my regrets to you.

original English: I know one thing - Margaret is not marrying Haddo by her own will - she is under his hypnotic power.

original Spanish: Mañana por la mañana estará en su laboratorio de Latourette.
original English: Tomorrow morning he will be in his laboratory in Latourette.

original Spanish: - Nada cambió mi amor por ti.
original English: - Nothing has changed my love for you.

original Spanish: Creo que quiere matarme para algún experimento de magia.
original English: I think he wants to kill me in a magic experiment.

original Spanish: Dejó este mensaje para usted en su almohada.
original English: She left this message for you on her pillows.

original Spanish: Voy a felicitar a Bordenave por su éxito.
original English: I will congratulate Bordenave on his success.

original Spanish: Muffat está loco por ti y Fauchery por su parte también desea que la Condesa quede libre.
original English: Muffat is crazy for you   and Fauchery for his part also   wants the Countess to be free.

original Spanish: Muffat está loco por ti y Fauchery por su parte también desea que la Condesa quede libre.
original English: Muffat is crazy for you   and Fauchery for his part also   wants the Countess to be free.

original Spanish: Reíros cuanto queráis pero para los papeles elegantes no hay nadie mejor que yo.
original English: You may laugh but for the elegant role   there is nobody better than me.

original Spanish: Yo os amo y haría cualquier cosa por usted.
original English: I love you   and would do anything for you.

original Spanish: ¿Harías eso por mí?
original English: Will that be me?

original Spanish: Un tanto prematuramente los amigos de Rose Mignon la felicitaban por haber conseguido tan hermoso papel.
original English: Somewhat prematurely Mignon Rose's friends   congratulated her for having gotten such a wonderful role.

original Spanish: Su última creación había sido para sus amigos el entierro de numerosas esperanzas.
original English: His latest creation was for his friends   the burial of many hopes.

original Spanish: Será sólo para mí.
original English: You will be all mine.

original Spanish: ¡Pero si todo esto no está hecho más que para romperse!
original English: But if all this is not done things will break!

original Spanish: Os juro que este niño es para mí como un hermano.
original English: I swear to you that this child is as a brother to me.

original English: Vandeuvres dreamt of separating Nana ... from her generous protector ... it would require a lot of money!

original English: And the gentleman was so perverted by contact with the courtesan ... that he thought of winning such a large sum ... by no matter what method.

original Spanish: Además le cubriré por escrito.
original English: In addition I will cover you in writing.

original Spanish: ¿Sería usted tan amable de apostar por mí 2.000 luises por Nana?
original English: Would you kindly bet for me   2000 Louis on Nana?

original Spanish: ¿Sería usted tan amable de apostar por mí 2.000 luises por Nana?
original English: Would you kindly bet for me   2000 Louis on Nana?

original Spanish: El señor apuesta por Nana.
original English: Nana's bet.

original Spanish: Aquel señor ha apostado por Nana en su lugar.
original English: He bet it on Nana instead.

original Spanish: Nana he deshonrado mi nombre por usted.
original English: Nana I have dishonored my name for you.

original Spanish: El eco del suicidio de Vandeuvres se extendía por todo París.
original English: The news of the suicide of Vandeuvres spread throughout Paris.

original Spanish: Muffat preocupado por la suerte de Nana...
original English: Muffat concerned about the fate of Nana ...

original English: What brings you here my pet?

original English: Well then? Are you crying because of a man?

original English: The old servants of Nana after a full-scale pillage of her things  she is carried by her friends to her deserted home seriously sick.

original Spanish: Inspirada por la historia de
original English: Film adaptation of the story

original Spanish: ¡Lo ha perdido por la envidia!
original English: He lost his appetite due to envy!

original English: One inch per hour.

original English: It's for you - a birthday present ...

original Spanish: Acusado eres irlandés... y por lo tanto te juzgaremos... en nombre de la Reina Victoria.
original English: Accused you are an Irishman ... and therefore we will pass judgement over you ... in the name of Queen Victoria.

original English: Michael Dennin by the Queen's law you shall be hanged by the neck ... until you are dead.

original Spanish: ¡Es por ti y por tu trata de mujeres por lo que están aquí!

original English: The Vicomte de la Marche the King's Lieutenant General for the Province and Edmée's suitor hesitates to add to the Chevalier's obvious burdens.

original English: Prepare to receive them in an appropriate manner.

original English: Hubert and Tristan heads of the senior and junior branches fought over custody of the child.

original English: Work to deserve his friendship especially as his marriage with Edmée will make him one of the family.

original Spanish: ¡Sus pliegues tenían el perfume del campo el gusto por la libertad!
original English: Their folds breathed the perfume of the outdoors the appeal to liberty!

original English: He expected a reward for this hard work and only Edmée's love could content him.

original Spanish: Jamás seré tuya por la fuerza.
original English: I will never be yours through force.

original English: Sir I am most grieved by the generous sentiment you say you have for me.

original English: It is possible that at one time I might not have cared much for Bernard;

original English: With my uncle's consent I am going into the army.

original English: Good Marcasse you must go into the army with Bernard to watch over him.

original Spanish: ¡Hazlo por mí!
original English: Do it for me!

original English: The good Chevalier feeling age creeping upon him thought of Edmée's future and so waited impatiently for Bernard's return.

original Spanish: Ah nadie me ama; los pensamientos son para el ausente esperando su retorno.
original English: Ah no one loves me; all thoughts are for the absent awaiting his return.

original English: Would you care to come fox-hunting with the young people next Tuesday?

original Spanish: Mi querido Bernard pensando en tu futuro conservé para ti el patrimonio que la mala conducta de tus tíos desgraciadamente arruinó.
original English: My dear Bernard thinking of your future I've kept for you the inheritance that your uncles' misconduct has unfortunately ruined.

original Spanish: Obedeciendo las órdenes del Caballero acompañado por Marcasse y guiado por la hija de un campesino local ...Bernard examina las ruinas de Mauprat su nueva propiedad.
original English: Accompanied by Marcasse Bernard wanders among the ruins of Mauprat and views his new property. A local farmer's daughter is their guide.

original Spanish: Pero no es necesario que se prive de este placer por mí.
original English: But there's no need for you to lose this pleasure because of me.

original Spanish: El Caballero abrumado por la impresión aún está muy débil para testificar en persona.
original English: The Chevalier overpowered by shock is still too weak to testify in person.

original Spanish: El Caballero abrumado por la impresión aún está muy débil para testificar en persona.
original English: The Chevalier overpowered by shock is still too weak to testify in person.

original Spanish: Según mi alma y mi conciencia juro que creo en la inocencia de Bernard y si dije antes palabras distintas fue por mi estado de delirio.
original English: I solemnly swear that I believe Bernard to be innocent and if I said anything else it was due to delirium.

original English: Why would Bernard do such a thing?

original English: And that's why a king isn't worth more than other men.

original Spanish: Recomiendo a todos mis parientes que vivan en buena connivencia y que no olviden en caso de necesidad sacrificar su interés personal por el bienestar de la Patria y a favor del Estado.
original English: I recommend to all my relatives to live in harmony with each other and not to forget, in case of emergency, to sacrifice their personal interest to the welfare of the fatherland and the state.

original Spanish: Mis últimos deseos en el instante en el que voy a exhalar mi último suspiro serán para la felicidad de mi Imperio.
original English: My last wish, when I'm about to utter my final breath, will be for the happiness of my kingdom.

original Spanish: Ojalá que sea gobernado siempre con justicia sabiduría y con aplomo que por la templanza de sus leyes sea el más feliz que sea el mejor administrado con respeto a las finanzas que sea el más valerosamente defendido por un ejército que sólo aspire al honor y a la noble gloria y que con la máxima prosperidad ¡perdure hasta el final de los tiempos!
original English: May it forever be ruled by justice, wisdom and efficiency, by its mild laws, may it be the happiest, by its finances, the best administered, by its army, only striving for honour and noble glory, may it be the state defended most bravely, may it continue to blossom and prosper till the end of time.

original Spanish: Si tengo indigestión no será por culpa de un pastel caducado.
original English: Well, if I get indigestion, it won't be from an old hen.

original Spanish: No hablabas así eso cuando querías el dinero para administrar este garito.
original English: You didn't say that when you wanted the money to run this joint.

original Spanish: Ya estoy harto de que estés danzando por aquí día tras día observando y vigilando cada cosa que hago.
original English: I'm sick and tired of you sitting around this joint day in and day out, staring and watching every move I make.

original Spanish: Sí y va a ser muy duro para el tipo que lo hizo.
original English: Yes, and it's going to be tough on the guy who did it.

original Spanish: Este asesinato fue cosa de contrabandistas por el tema del alcohol.
original English: This killing was a bootleg job, and it concerns liquor.

original Spanish: Ellos iban a por mercancía de la marca 'Old Century'.
original English: Nothing much. The stuff they was after was all censured.

original Spanish: ¿Has visto algo de eso por aquí?
original English: See any around?

original Spanish: No iréis a creer que yo podría tener algo de eso por aquí ¿verdad?
original English: Surely you don't think that I would have any stuff like that lying around, do you?

original Spanish: No perjudicaría a un amigo por nada del mundo.
original English: Why, I wouldn't hurt a pal for the world.

original Spanish: ¡Escúchame Eddie por favor!
original English: Oh, listen to me, Eddie, please!

original Spanish: Creo que me quedaré por aquí un ratito.
original English: Well, I think I'll stick around a while.

original Spanish: Te exaltas por nada.
original English: Why, you're all excited about nothing.

original Spanish: Esa es la razón por la que querías que las dejara aquí.
original English: That's the reason you wanted me to plant it in this joint.

original Spanish: Estoy lo suficientemente loco como para saber... que tú eres el tipo que mató a ese policía.
original English: I am just crazy enough to know that you're the guy that bumped off that cop!

original Spanish: Se fue por esa puerta.
original English: Oh, he went out that door.

original Spanish: Debes tomarme por imbécil.
original English: You must take me for an awful boob.

original Spanish: Tengo pruebas suficientes para enviarte a la silla.
original English: I've got proof enough to send you to the chair.

original Spanish: Y por lo tanto puedo hablar sin traicionarle.
original English: So I can tell you about double-crossing.

original Spanish: Queremos hacer lo correcto por nosotros mismos... y por todos los demás.
original English: We want to do right for each other, and everyone else.

original Spanish: No creo que vaya a ser tan duro para ti.
original English: I don't think it's gonna be so tough for you.

original Spanish: Había una recompensa para el asesino, vivo o muerto.
original English: There was a reward for the killer, dead or alive.

original Spanish: Además, le has ahorrado al estado muchos gastos... por el coste de una electrocución.
original English: Besides, you've saved the state a lot of expense— the cost of an electrocution.

original Spanish: No olvidéis coger ese tren para iros al campo.
original English: Don't forget the train to the country.
